"keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error during web scraping: {e}") "keyword">if &#x27;driver' "keyword">in locals(): driver.quit() # Fallback: Try requests-based scraping print(f"\n=== FALLBACK: REQUESTS-BASED SCRAPING ===\n") "keyword">try: headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print(f"Attempting requests-based access to: {graveyard_url}") response = requests.get(graveyard_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) response.raise_for_status() print(f"Successfully retrieved page (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Parse "keyword">with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Save the content fallback_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_graveyard_fallback.html') "keyword">with open(fallback_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"Fallback content saved to: {fallback_file}") # Basic analysis of page structure print(f"\nBasic page structure analysis:") print(f"Title: {soup.title.get_text() "keyword">if soup.title "keyword">else &#x27;No title found'}") # Look "keyword">for any flavor-related content page_text = soup.get_text() flavor_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;flavor') discontinued_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;discontinued') print(f"&#x27;Flavor' mentions: {flavor_mentions}") print(f"&#x27;Discontinued' mentions: {discontinued_mentions}") "keyword">if flavor_mentions > 0 "keyword">or discontinued_mentions > 0: print(f"Page appears to contain flavor-related content.") "keyword">else: print(f"Page may "keyword">not be the flavor graveyard "keyword">or may require JavaScript.") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as fallback_error: print(f"Fallback scraping also failed: {fallback_error}") print(f"\n=== INITIAL GRAVEYARD ACCESS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Next steps: Analyze extracted data to identify oldest flavor "keyword">and examine headstone photos")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === BEN & JERRY'S FLAVOR GRAVEYARD ANALYSIS === Objective: Find the oldest discontinued flavor and analyze its headstone photo Strategy: Access Ben & Jerry's flavor graveyard, identify oldest flavor, examine headstone background === STEP 1: ACCESSING BEN & JERRY'S FLAVOR GRAVEYARD === Accessing Ben & Jerry's Flavor Graveyard: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard Initializing Chrome WebDriver... Loading page: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard Waiting for page to load... [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_708b99c5-e4a7-49cb-a5cf-933c8d46470d
developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 2)
2025-08-11 07:42:46

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import re "keyword">import time print("=== BEN & JERRY&#x27;S FLAVOR GRAVEYARD ANALYSIS (FALLBACK APPROACH) ===\n") print("Objective: Access graveyard using requests, extract flavor data, find oldest flavor") print("Strategy: Use requests-based scraping "keyword">with proper headers "keyword">and error handling\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # Check "keyword">if any previous files exist "keyword">in workspace print("=== STEP 1: CHECKING WORKSPACE FOR EXISTING DATA ===\n") "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f"Files "keyword">in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}") "keyword">for file "keyword">in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found - creating new analysis") # Use requests-based approach to access Ben & Jerry's Flavor Graveyard print("\n=== STEP 2: ACCESSING BEN & JERRY&#x27;S GRAVEYARD WITH REQUESTS ===\n") graveyard_url = "https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard" # Set up proper headers to mimic a real browser headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } print(f"Accessing URL: {graveyard_url}") print(f"Using User-Agent: {headers[&#x27;User-Agent'][:50]}...") "keyword">try: # Make the request "keyword">with proper timeout print("\nSending GET request...") response = requests.get(graveyard_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) response.raise_for_status() print(f"‚úì Successfully retrieved page (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"‚úì Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") print(f"‚úì Content type: {response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', 'Unknown')}") # Parse the HTML content print("\nParsing HTML content...") soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Save the full page content "keyword">for reference page_content_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_graveyard_page_requests.html') "keyword">with open(page_content_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"‚úì Full page content saved to: {page_content_file}") # Basic page analysis page_title = soup.title.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if soup.title "keyword">else &#x27;No title found' print(f"\nPage title: {page_title}") # Get page text "keyword">for initial analysis page_text = soup.get_text() print(f"Total page text length: {len(page_text):,} characters") # Count flavor-related mentions flavor_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;flavor') graveyard_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;graveyard') discontinued_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;discontinued') print(f"\nContent analysis:") print(f" &#x27;Flavor' mentions: {flavor_mentions}") print(f" &#x27;Graveyard' mentions: {graveyard_mentions}") print(f" &#x27;Discontinued' mentions: {discontinued_mentions}") "keyword">if flavor_mentions > 5: # Reasonable threshold "keyword">for flavor content print(f"‚úì Page appears to contain substantial flavor-related content") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö† Page may "keyword">not contain expected flavor content "keyword">or may be dynamically loaded") print("\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING FOR FLAVOR CONTAINERS AND DATA ===\n") # Try multiple approaches to find flavor information flavors_found = [] # Approach 1: Look "keyword">for common flavor container selectors flavor_selectors = [ &#x27;.flavor-card', &#x27;.flavor-item', &#x27;.graveyard-item', &#x27;.flavor', &#x27;.product-card', &#x27;.card', &#x27;.item', &#x27;[data-flavor]', &#x27;.graveyard-flavor', &#x27;.discontinued-flavor' ] print("Approach 1: Searching "keyword">for flavor containers using CSS selectors...") all_containers = [] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in flavor_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: print(f" Found {len(elements)} elements "keyword">with selector &#x27;{selector}'") all_containers.extend(elements) "keyword">else: print(f" No elements found "keyword">with selector &#x27;{selector}'") # Remove duplicates unique_containers = list(set(all_containers)) print(f"\nTotal unique containers found: {len(unique_containers)}") # Approach 2: Search "keyword">for links that might lead to individual flavor pages print("\nApproach 2: Searching "keyword">for flavor-related links...") all_links = soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) flavor_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in all_links: href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') link_text = link.get_text(strip="keyword">True) # Look "keyword">for links that might be flavor-related "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in href.lower() "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;flavor', 'graveyard', 'discontinued']): flavor_links.append({ &#x27;href': href, &#x27;text': link_text, &#x27;full_url': href "keyword">if href.startswith('http') "keyword">else f'https://www.benjerry.com{href}' "keyword">if href.startswith('/') "keyword">else f'https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/{href}' }) print(f"Found {len(flavor_links)} potentially flavor-related links:") "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(flavor_links[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f" {i}. {link[&#x27;text'][:50]}{'...' "keyword">if len(link['text']) > 50 "keyword">else ''} -> {link['href']}") # Approach 3: Search "keyword">for text patterns that might indicate flavor names "keyword">and dates print("\nApproach 3: Searching "keyword">for flavor names "keyword">and dates "keyword">in page text...") # Split text into paragraphs "keyword">and sentences paragraphs = page_text.split(&#x27;\n') # Look "keyword">for year patterns (1970s-2020s) year_pattern = r&#x27;\b(19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)\b' date_pattern = r&#x27;\b(19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)[-‚Äì‚Äî](19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)\b' # Date ranges potential_flavors = [] "keyword">for i, paragraph "keyword">in enumerate(paragraphs): paragraph_clean = paragraph.strip() "keyword">if len(paragraph_clean) < 10 "keyword">or len(paragraph_clean) > 500: # Skip very short "keyword">or very long paragraphs "keyword">continue # Check "keyword">if paragraph contains years years_found = re.findall(year_pattern, paragraph_clean) date_ranges = re.findall(date_pattern, paragraph_clean) "keyword">if years_found "keyword">or date_ranges: # This paragraph might contain flavor information potential_flavors.append({ &#x27;paragraph_index': i, &#x27;text': paragraph_clean, &#x27;years': years_found, &#x27;date_ranges': date_ranges }) print(f"Found {len(potential_flavors)} paragraphs "keyword">with date information:") "keyword">for i, flavor_info "keyword">in enumerate(potential_flavors[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f"\n{i}. Years: {flavor_info[&#x27;years']} | Ranges: {flavor_info['date_ranges']}") print(f" Text: {flavor_info[&#x27;text'][:150]}{'...' "keyword">if len(flavor_info['text']) > 150 "keyword">else ''}") # Approach 4: Look "keyword">for images that might be headstones print("\n=== STEP 4: SEARCHING FOR HEADSTONE IMAGES ===\n") all_images = soup.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f"Total images found on page: {len(all_images)}") headstone_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in all_images: img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') "keyword">or img.get('data-src', '') "keyword">or img.get('data-lazy-src', '') img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') img_title = img.get(&#x27;title', '') "keyword">if img_src: # Convert relative URLs to absolute "keyword">if img_src.startswith(&#x27;//'): img_src = &#x27;https:' + img_src "keyword">elif img_src.startswith(&#x27;/'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com' + img_src "keyword">elif "keyword">not img_src.startswith(&#x27;http'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com/' + img_src # Check "keyword">if this might be a headstone image headstone_keywords = [&#x27;headstone', 'graveyard', 'grave', 'tombstone', 'rip', 'flavor'] img_context = f"{img_src} {img_alt} {img_title}".lower() "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in img_context "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in headstone_keywords) "keyword">or &#x27;graveyard' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): headstone_images.append({ &#x27;src': img_src, &#x27;alt': img_alt, &#x27;title': img_title, &#x27;context_score': sum(1 "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in headstone_keywords "keyword">if keyword "keyword">in img_context) }) print(f"Found {len(headstone_images)} potentially relevant images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(headstone_images, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Source: {img[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: {img[&#x27;alt']}") print(f" Title: {img[&#x27;title']}") print(f" Relevance score: {img[&#x27;context_score']}") # Save all extracted data extraction_data = { &#x27;extraction_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;source_url': graveyard_url, &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;content_stats': { &#x27;page_length': len(page_text), &#x27;flavor_mentions': flavor_mentions, &#x27;graveyard_mentions': graveyard_mentions, &#x27;discontinued_mentions': discontinued_mentions }, &#x27;containers_found': len(unique_containers), &#x27;flavor_links': flavor_links, &#x27;potential_flavors_with_dates': potential_flavors, &#x27;headstone_images': headstone_images, &#x27;total_images': len(all_images) } extraction_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_graveyard_extraction_requests.json') "keyword">with open(extraction_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(extraction_data, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Complete extraction data saved to: {extraction_file}") # Summary of findings print(f"\n=== STEP 5: EXTRACTION SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed Ben & Jerry&#x27;s Flavor Graveyard") print(f"‚úì Page contains {flavor_mentions} flavor mentions") print(f"‚úì Found {len(flavor_links)} flavor-related links") print(f"‚úì Identified {len(potential_flavors)} paragraphs "keyword">with date information") print(f"‚úì Located {len(headstone_images)} potentially relevant images") "keyword">if len(potential_flavors) > 0: print(f"\nüéØ Ready "keyword">for next phase: Analyze date information to identify oldest flavor") "keyword">elif len(flavor_links) > 0: print(f"\nüéØ Ready "keyword">for next phase: Follow flavor links to find detailed information") "keyword">elif len(headstone_images) > 0: print(f"\nüéØ Ready "keyword">for next phase: Download "keyword">and analyze headstone images") "keyword">else: print(f"\n‚ö† May need alternative approach - limited flavor data extracted "keyword">from main page") print(f"Recommendation: Try accessing individual flavor pages "keyword">or use different selectors") "keyword">except requests.exceptions.RequestException "keyword">as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing Ben & Jerry&#x27;s website: {e}") print(f"This could be due to:") print(f" - Network connectivity issues") print(f" - Website blocking automated requests") print(f" - Temporary website downtime") print(f" - Need "keyword">for different headers "keyword">or approach") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"‚ùå Unexpected error during analysis: {e}") "keyword">import traceback traceback.print_exc() print(f"\n=== REQUESTS-BASED GRAVEYARD ACCESS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Next: Analyze extracted data to identify oldest flavor "keyword">and examine headstone photos")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === BEN & JERRY'S FLAVOR GRAVEYARD ANALYSIS (FALLBACK APPROACH) === Objective: Access graveyard using requests, extract flavor data, find oldest flavor Strategy: Use requests-based scraping with proper headers and error handling === STEP 1: CHECKING WORKSPACE FOR EXISTING DATA === Files in workspace: 2 - ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html (374,976 bytes) - ben_jerrys_flavors_initial_extraction.json (205 bytes) === STEP 2: ACCESSING BEN & JERRY'S GRAVEYARD WITH REQUESTS === Accessing URL: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard Using User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWeb... Sending GET request... ‚ùå Error accessing Ben & Jerry's website: 403 Client Error: Forbidden for url: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard This could be due to: - Network connectivity issues - Website blocking automated requests - Temporary website downtime - Need for different headers or approach === REQUESTS-BASED GRAVEYARD ACCESS COMPLETE === Next: Analyze extracted data to identify oldest flavor and examine headstone photos
tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 07:42:46

Execution failed - The requests-based approach encountered a 403 Forbidden error when trying to access the Ben & Jerry's graveyard page, indicating the website is blocking automated requests. However, the code did successfully check the workspace and found existing data from a previous attempt: 'ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html' (374,976 bytes) and 'ben_jerrys_flavors_initial_extraction.json' (205 bytes). **PLAN** alignment: 0% for current execution, but we have substantial existing data to work with. The 403 error suggests the website has anti-bot protection, making direct scraping challenging. Recommended next step: Instead of trying to re-scrape the website, analyze the existing 374KB HTML file that was successfully retrieved in a previous attempt. Parse 'ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html' to extract flavor information, identify the oldest flavor, and locate headstone images - this will bypass the access restrictions and utilize the data we already have.

üìù Code Python

Look "keyword">for links that might be flavor-related "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in href.lower() "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;flavor', 'graveyard', 'discontinued']): flavor_links.append({ &#x27;href': href, &#x27;text': link_text, &#x27;full_url': href "keyword">if href.startswith('http') "keyword">else f'https://www.benjerry.com{href}' "keyword">if href.startswith('/') "keyword">else f'https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/{href}' }) print(f"Found {len(flavor_links)} potentially flavor-related links:") "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(flavor_links[:10], 1): # "keyword">if len(link['text']) > 50 "keyword">else ''} -> {link['href']}") # Approach 3: Search "keyword">for text patterns that might indicate flavor names "keyword">and dates print("\nApproach 3: Searching "keyword">for flavor names "keyword">and dates "keyword">in page text...") # Split text into paragraphs "keyword">and sentences paragraphs = page_text.split(&#x27;\n') # Look "keyword">for year patterns (1970s-2020s) year_pattern = r&#x27;\b(19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)\b' date_pattern = r&#x27;\b(19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)[-‚Äì‚Äî](19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)\b' # Date ranges potential_flavors = [] "keyword">for i, paragraph "keyword">in enumerate(paragraphs): paragraph_clean = paragraph.strip() "keyword">if len(paragraph_clean) < 10 "keyword">or len(paragraph_clean) > 500: # Skip very short "keyword">or very long paragraphs "keyword">continue # Check "keyword">if paragraph contains years years_found = re.findall(year_pattern, paragraph_clean) date_ranges = re.findall(date_pattern, paragraph_clean) "keyword">if years_found "keyword">or date_ranges: # This paragraph might contain flavor information potential_flavors.append({ &#x27;paragraph_index': i, &#x27;text': paragraph_clean, &#x27;years': years_found, &#x27;date_ranges': date_ranges }) print(f"Found {len(potential_flavors)} paragraphs "keyword">with date information:") "keyword">for i, flavor_info "keyword">in enumerate(potential_flavors[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f"\n{i}. Years: {flavor_info[&#x27;years']} | Ranges: {flavor_info['date_ranges']}") print(f" Text: {flavor_info[&#x27;text'][:150]}{'...' "keyword">if len(flavor_info['text']) > 150 "keyword">else ''}") # Approach 4: Look "keyword">for images that might be headstones print("\n=== STEP 4: SEARCHING FOR HEADSTONE IMAGES ===\n") all_images = soup.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f"Total images found on page: {len(all_images)}") headstone_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in all_images: img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') "keyword">or img.get('data-src', '') "keyword">or img.get('data-lazy-src', '') img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') img_title = img.get(&#x27;title', '') "keyword">if img_src: # Convert relative URLs to absolute "keyword">if img_src.startswith(&#x27;//'): img_src = &#x27;https:' + img_src "keyword">elif img_src.startswith(&#x27;/'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com' + img_src "keyword">elif "keyword">not img_src.startswith(&#x27;http'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com/' + img_src # Check "keyword">if this might be a headstone image headstone_keywords = [&#x27;headstone', 'graveyard', 'grave', 'tombstone', 'rip', 'flavor'] img_context = f"{img_src} {img_alt} {img_title}".lower() "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in img_context "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in headstone_keywords) "keyword">or &#x27;graveyard' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): headstone_images.append({ &#x27;src': img_src, &#x27;alt': img_alt, &#x27;title': img_title, &#x27;context_score': sum(1 "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in headstone_keywords "keyword">if keyword "keyword">in img_context) }) print(f"Found {len(headstone_images)} potentially relevant images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(headstone_images, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Source: {img[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: {img[&#x27;alt']}") print(f" Title: {img[&#x27;title']}") print(f" Relevance score: {img[&#x27;context_score']}") # Save all extracted data extraction_data = { &#x27;extraction_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;source_url': graveyard_url, &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;content_stats': { &#x27;page_length': len(page_text), &#x27;flavor_mentions': flavor_mentions, &#x27;graveyard_mentions': graveyard_mentions, &#x27;discontinued_mentions': discontinued_mentions }, &#x27;containers_found': len(unique_containers), &#x27;flavor_links': flavor_links, &#x27;potential_flavors_with_dates': potential_flavors, &#x27;headstone_images': headstone_images, &#x27;total_images': len(all_images) } extraction_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_graveyard_extraction_requests.json') "keyword">with open(extraction_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(extraction_data, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Complete extraction data saved to: {extraction_file}") # Summary of findings print(f"\n=== STEP 5: EXTRACTION SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed Ben & Jerry&#x27;s Flavor Graveyard") print(f"‚úì Page contains {flavor_mentions} flavor mentions") print(f"‚úì Found {len(flavor_links)} flavor-related links") print(f"‚úì Identified {len(potential_flavors)} paragraphs "keyword">with date information") print(f"‚úì Located {len(headstone_images)} potentially relevant images") "keyword">if len(potential_flavors) > 0: print(f"\nüéØ Ready "keyword">for next phase: Analyze date information to identify oldest flavor") "keyword">elif len(flavor_links) > 0: print(f"\nüéØ Ready "keyword">for next phase: Follow flavor links to find detailed information") "keyword">elif len(headstone_images) > 0: print(f"\nüéØ Ready "keyword">for next phase: Download "keyword">and analyze headstone images") "keyword">else: print(f"\n‚ö† May need alternative approach - limited flavor data extracted "keyword">from main page") print(f"Recommendation: Try accessing individual flavor pages "keyword">or use different selectors") "keyword">except requests.exceptions.RequestException "keyword">as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing Ben & Jerry&#x27;s website: {e}") print(f"This could be due to:") print(f" - Network connectivity issues") print(f" - Website blocking automated requests") print(f" - Temporary website downtime") print(f" - Need "keyword">for different headers "keyword">or approach") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"‚ùå Unexpected error during analysis: {e}") "keyword">import traceback traceback.print_exc() print(f"\n=== REQUESTS-BASED GRAVEYARD ACCESS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Next: Analyze extracted data to identify oldest flavor "keyword">and examine headstone photos")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === BEN & JERRY'S FLAVOR GRAVEYARD ANALYSIS (FALLBACK APPROACH) === Objective: Access graveyard using requests, extract flavor data, find oldest flavor Strategy: Use requests-based scraping with proper headers and error handling === STEP 1: CHECKING WORKSPACE FOR EXISTING DATA === Files in workspace: 2 - ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html (374,976 bytes) - ben_jerrys_flavors_initial_extraction.json (205 bytes) === STEP 2: ACCESSING BEN & JERRY'S GRAVEYARD WITH REQUESTS === Accessing URL: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard Using User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWeb... Sending GET request... ‚ùå Error accessing Ben & Jerry's website: 403 Client Error: Forbidden for url: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard This could be due to: - Network connectivity issues - Website blocking automated requests - Temporary website downtime - Need for different headers or approach === REQUESTS-BASED GRAVEYARD ACCESS COMPLETE === Next: Analyze extracted data to identify oldest flavor and examine headstone photos
developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 3)
2025-08-11 07:44:08

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== ANALYZING EXISTING BEN & JERRY&#x27;S GRAVEYARD DATA ===\n") print("Objective: Parse existing HTML file to find oldest flavor "keyword">and headstone photos") print("Strategy: Analyze workspace files, extract flavor data, identify oldest flavor\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, let's inspect the existing files to understand their structure print("=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE FILES ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f"Files "keyword">in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}") "keyword">for file "keyword">in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Inspect the JSON file structure first ("keyword">as recommended) json_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_flavors_initial_extraction.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(json_file): print(f"\n=== INSPECTING JSON FILE STRUCTURE ===\n") print(f"Reading: {json_file}") "keyword">with open(json_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: json_content = f.read() print(f"JSON file content length: {len(json_content)} characters") print(f"JSON content preview: {json_content}") "keyword">try: json_data = json.loads(json_content) print(f"\nJSON structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in json_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # If there's flavor data, show a sample "keyword">if &#x27;flavors_data' "keyword">in json_data "keyword">and json_data['flavors_data']: print(f"\nSample flavor data structure:") sample_flavor = json_data[&#x27;flavors_data'][0] "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in sample_flavor.items(): print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}{&#x27;...' "keyword">if len(str(value)) > 100 "keyword">else ''}") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"JSON parsing error: {e}") print("File may be corrupted "keyword">or incomplete") "keyword">else: print(f"JSON file "keyword">not found: {json_file}") # Now analyze the main HTML file html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html') "keyword">if os.path.exists(html_file): print(f"\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILE ===\n") print(f"Reading: {html_file}") "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML file length: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse "keyword">with BeautifulSoup print(f"Parsing HTML content...") soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') # Get page title page_title = soup.title.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if soup.title "keyword">else &#x27;No title found' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Basic content analysis page_text = soup.get_text() print(f"Total text length: {len(page_text):,} characters") flavor_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;flavor') graveyard_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;graveyard') discontinued_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;discontinued') print(f"Content analysis:") print(f" &#x27;Flavor' mentions: {flavor_mentions}") print(f" &#x27;Graveyard' mentions: {graveyard_mentions}") print(f" &#x27;Discontinued' mentions: {discontinued_mentions}") print(f"\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR FLAVOR CONTAINERS ===\n") # Try multiple approaches to find flavor information # Approach 1: Look "keyword">for common container patterns container_selectors = [ &#x27;.flavor-card', &#x27;.flavor-item', &#x27;.graveyard-item', &#x27;.flavor', &#x27;.product-card', &#x27;.card', &#x27;.item', &#x27;[data-flavor]', &#x27;.graveyard-flavor', &#x27;.discontinued-flavor', &#x27;div["keyword">class*="flavor"]', &#x27;div["keyword">class*="graveyard"]', &#x27;div["keyword">class*="card"]' ] print("Searching "keyword">for flavor containers using CSS selectors...") all_containers = [] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in container_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: print(f" Found {len(elements)} elements "keyword">with selector &#x27;{selector}'") all_containers.extend(elements) "keyword">else: print(f" No elements found "keyword">with selector &#x27;{selector}'") # Remove duplicates unique_containers = list(set(all_containers)) print(f"\nTotal unique containers found: {len(unique_containers)}") # Approach 2: Look "keyword">for any divs "keyword">or sections that might contain flavor information print(f"\nSearching "keyword">for divs "keyword">and sections "keyword">with flavor-related content...") all_divs = soup.find_all([&#x27;div', 'section', 'article']) flavor_divs = [] "keyword">for div "keyword">in all_divs: div_text = div.get_text(strip="keyword">True) div_classes = &#x27; '.join(div.get('"keyword">class', [])) div_id = div.get(&#x27;id', '') # Check "keyword">if this div contains flavor-related content combined_text = f"{div_text} {div_classes} {div_id}".lower() "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;flavor', 'graveyard', 'discontinued']) "keyword">and len(div_text) > 20: flavor_divs.append({ &#x27;element': div, &#x27;text': div_text[:200] + ('...' "keyword">if len(div_text) > 200 "keyword">else ''), &#x27;classes': div_classes, &#x27;id': div_id, &#x27;text_length': len(div_text) }) print(f"Found {len(flavor_divs)} divs "keyword">with flavor-related content") # Sort by text length (longer content might be more relevant) flavor_divs.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;text_length'], reverse="keyword">True) print(f"\nTop 10 flavor-related divs by content length:") "keyword">for i, div_info "keyword">in enumerate(flavor_divs[:10], 1): print(f"\n{i}. Length: {div_info[&#x27;text_length']:,} chars") print(f" Classes: {div_info[&#x27;classes']}") print(f" ID: {div_info[&#x27;id']}") print(f" Text preview: {div_info[&#x27;text']}") print(f"\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING FOR IMAGES (HEADSTONES) ===\n") # Find all images all_images = soup.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f"Total images found: {len(all_images)}") headstone_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in all_images: img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') "keyword">or img.get('data-src', '') "keyword">or img.get('data-lazy-src', '') img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') img_title = img.get(&#x27;title', '') img_class = &#x27; '.join(img.get('"keyword">class', [])) "keyword">if img_src: # Convert relative URLs to absolute "keyword">if img_src.startswith(&#x27;//'): img_src = &#x27;https:' + img_src "keyword">elif img_src.startswith(&#x27;/'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com' + img_src "keyword">elif "keyword">not img_src.startswith(&#x27;http'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com/' + img_src # Check relevance "keyword">for headstone/graveyard images img_context = f"{img_src} {img_alt} {img_title} {img_class}".lower() relevance_keywords = [&#x27;headstone', 'graveyard', 'grave', 'tombstone', 'rip', 'flavor', 'discontinued'] relevance_score = sum(1 "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in relevance_keywords "keyword">if keyword "keyword">in img_context) "keyword">if relevance_score > 0 "keyword">or &#x27;graveyard' "keyword">in img_src.lower() "keyword">or 'flavor' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): headstone_images.append({ &#x27;src': img_src, &#x27;alt': img_alt, &#x27;title': img_title, &#x27;"keyword">class': img_class, &#x27;relevance_score': relevance_score, &#x27;context': img_context }) # Sort by relevance score headstone_images.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;relevance_score'], reverse="keyword">True) print(f"Found {len(headstone_images)} potentially relevant images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(headstone_images[:15], 1): # Show top 15 print(f"\n{i}. Relevance score: {img[&#x27;relevance_score']}") print(f" Source: {img[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: {img[&#x27;alt']}") print(f" Title: {img[&#x27;title']}") print(f" Class: {img[&#x27;"keyword">class']}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: SEARCHING FOR FLAVOR NAMES AND DATES ===\n") # Look "keyword">for text patterns that indicate flavor names "keyword">with dates year_pattern = r&#x27;\b(19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)\b' # 1970-2029 date_range_pattern = r&#x27;\b(19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)[-‚Äì‚Äî](19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)\b' # Date ranges # Split page text into meaningful chunks paragraphs = [p.strip() "keyword">for p "keyword">in page_text.split(&#x27;\n') "keyword">if p.strip()] flavors_with_dates = [] "keyword">for paragraph "keyword">in paragraphs: "keyword">if len(paragraph) < 10 "keyword">or len(paragraph) > 1000: # Skip very short "keyword">or very long paragraphs "keyword">continue # Check "keyword">if paragraph contains years years_found = re.findall(year_pattern, paragraph) date_ranges = re.findall(date_range_pattern, paragraph) "keyword">if years_found "keyword">or date_ranges: # This might be a flavor "keyword">with date information flavors_with_dates.append({ &#x27;text': paragraph, &#x27;years': list(set(years_found)), # Remove duplicates &#x27;date_ranges': date_ranges, &#x27;earliest_year': min([int(y) "keyword">for y "keyword">in years_found]) "keyword">if years_found "keyword">else "keyword">None }) print(f"Found {len(flavors_with_dates)} text sections "keyword">with date information") # Sort by earliest year to find the oldest flavors_with_dates_sorted = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in flavors_with_dates "keyword">if f[&#x27;earliest_year']] flavors_with_dates_sorted.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"\nTop 15 sections by earliest year (potential oldest flavors):") "keyword">for i, flavor_info "keyword">in enumerate(flavors_with_dates_sorted[:15], 1): print(f"\n{i}. Earliest year: {flavor_info[&#x27;earliest_year']}") print(f" All years: {flavor_info[&#x27;years']}") print(f" Date ranges: {flavor_info[&#x27;date_ranges']}") print(f" Text: {flavor_info[&#x27;text'][:200]}{'...' "keyword">if len(flavor_info['text']) > 200 "keyword">else ''}") # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_data = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;source_file': html_file, &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;content_stats': { &#x27;html_length': len(html_content), &#x27;text_length': len(page_text), &#x27;flavor_mentions': flavor_mentions, &#x27;graveyard_mentions': graveyard_mentions, &#x27;discontinued_mentions': discontinued_mentions }, &#x27;containers_found': len(unique_containers), &#x27;flavor_divs_found': len(flavor_divs), &#x27;total_images': len(all_images), &#x27;relevant_images': len(headstone_images), &#x27;flavors_with_dates': len(flavors_with_dates), &#x27;top_flavor_divs': flavor_divs[:10], # Top 10 by content length &#x27;top_headstone_images': headstone_images[:10], # Top 10 by relevance &#x27;oldest_flavors_candidates': flavors_with_dates_sorted[:10] # Top 10 oldest } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, default=str) # default=str to handle any non-serializable objects print(f"\n‚úì Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Summary "keyword">and next steps print(f"\n=== STEP 5: ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"‚úì Successfully parsed Ben & Jerry&#x27;s Graveyard HTML ({len(html_content):,} chars)") print(f"‚úì Found {len(flavor_divs)} flavor-related content sections") print(f"‚úì Located {len(headstone_images)} potentially relevant images") print(f"‚úì Identified {len(flavors_with_dates)} text sections "keyword">with date information") "keyword">if flavors_with_dates_sorted: oldest_candidate = flavors_with_dates_sorted[0] print(f"\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR CANDIDATE IDENTIFIED:") print(f" Earliest year: {oldest_candidate[&#x27;earliest_year']}") print(f" Years mentioned: {oldest_candidate[&#x27;years']}") print(f" Text preview: {oldest_candidate[&#x27;text'][:300]}...") print(f"\nüìã NEXT STEPS:") print(f" 1. Extract the specific flavor name "keyword">from the oldest candidate") print(f" 2. Find the corresponding headstone image "keyword">for this flavor") print(f" 3. Download "keyword">and analyze the headstone photo "keyword">for background details") print(f" 4. Identify other headstones visible "keyword">in the background") print(f" 5. Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme text "keyword">from background headstone") "keyword">else: print(f"\n‚ö† No clear oldest flavor identified - may need refined analysis") print(f"Recommendation: Examine flavor divs "keyword">and images more closely") "keyword">else: print(f"HTML file "keyword">not found: {html_file}") print(f"Cannot proceed "keyword">with analysis without the graveyard page content") print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Ready to proceed "keyword">with oldest flavor identification "keyword">and headstone image analysis")
üìÑ Output

tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 07:44:08

Partial success - Code executed without errors and performed comprehensive analysis of the existing Ben & Jerry's graveyard HTML file (373,435 characters). Successfully identified 43 headstone tombstone images and 40 flavor-related content sections. However, the date extraction was problematic - only found 2 text sections with years (2011 and 2025), with 2011 being identified as the 'oldest' which is clearly incorrect for a flavor graveyard that should contain much older discontinued flavors from the 1980s-1990s. The analysis shows the page structure was parsed correctly, but the date/year extraction logic needs refinement to capture the actual flavor discontinuation dates that are likely embedded within the flavor content sections. **PLAN** alignment: 40% - we have the page data and headstone images identified, but haven't correctly identified the truly oldest flavor. Next step: Examine the flavor-related div content more closely (especially the 7,640-character accordion sections) to extract the actual flavor names and their discontinuation date ranges, then properly identify the oldest flavor and its corresponding headstone image.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== ANALYZING EXISTING BEN & JERRY&#x27;S GRAVEYARD DATA ===\n") print("Objective: Parse existing HTML file to find oldest flavor "keyword">and headstone photos") print("Strategy: Analyze workspace files, extract flavor data, identify oldest flavor\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, let's inspect the existing files to understand their structure print("=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE FILES ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f"Files "keyword">in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}") "keyword">for file "keyword">in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Inspect the JSON file structure first ("keyword">as recommended) json_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_flavors_initial_extraction.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(json_file): print(f"\n=== INSPECTING JSON FILE STRUCTURE ===\n") print(f"Reading: {json_file}") "keyword">with open(json_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: json_content = f.read() print(f"JSON file content length: {len(json_content)} characters") print(f"JSON content preview: {json_content}") "keyword">try: json_data = json.loads(json_content) print(f"\nJSON structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in json_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # If there's flavor data, show a sample "keyword">if &#x27;flavors_data' "keyword">in json_data "keyword">and json_data['flavors_data']: print(f"\nSample flavor data structure:") sample_flavor = json_data[&#x27;flavors_data'][0] "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in sample_flavor.items(): print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}{&#x27;...' "keyword">if len(str(value)) > 100 "keyword">else ''}") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"JSON parsing error: {e}") print("File may be corrupted "keyword">or incomplete") "keyword">else: print(f"JSON file "keyword">not found: {json_file}") # Now analyze the main HTML file html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html') "keyword">if os.path.exists(html_file): print(f"\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILE ===\n") print(f"Reading: {html_file}") "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML file length: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse "keyword">with BeautifulSoup print(f"Parsing HTML content...") soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') # Get page title page_title = soup.title.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if soup.title "keyword">else &#x27;No title found' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Basic content analysis page_text = soup.get_text() print(f"Total text length: {len(page_text):,} characters") flavor_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;flavor') graveyard_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;graveyard') discontinued_mentions = page_text.lower().count(&#x27;discontinued') print(f"Content analysis:") print(f" &#x27;Flavor' mentions: {flavor_mentions}") print(f" &#x27;Graveyard' mentions: {graveyard_mentions}") print(f" &#x27;Discontinued' mentions: {discontinued_mentions}") print(f"\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR FLAVOR CONTAINERS ===\n") # Try multiple approaches to find flavor information # Approach 1: Look "keyword">for common container patterns container_selectors = [ &#x27;.flavor-card', &#x27;.flavor-item', &#x27;.graveyard-item', &#x27;.flavor', &#x27;.product-card', &#x27;.card', &#x27;.item', &#x27;[data-flavor]', &#x27;.graveyard-flavor', &#x27;.discontinued-flavor', &#x27;div["keyword">class*="flavor"]', &#x27;div["keyword">class*="graveyard"]', &#x27;div["keyword">class*="card"]' ] print("Searching "keyword">for flavor containers using CSS selectors...") all_containers = [] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in container_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: print(f" Found {len(elements)} elements "keyword">with selector &#x27;{selector}'") all_containers.extend(elements) "keyword">else: print(f" No elements found "keyword">with selector &#x27;{selector}'") # Remove duplicates unique_containers = list(set(all_containers)) print(f"\nTotal unique containers found: {len(unique_containers)}") # Approach 2: Look "keyword">for any divs "keyword">or sections that might contain flavor information print(f"\nSearching "keyword">for divs "keyword">and sections "keyword">with flavor-related content...") all_divs = soup.find_all([&#x27;div', 'section', 'article']) flavor_divs = [] "keyword">for div "keyword">in all_divs: div_text = div.get_text(strip="keyword">True) div_classes = &#x27; '.join(div.get('"keyword">class', [])) div_id = div.get(&#x27;id', '') # Check "keyword">if this div contains flavor-related content combined_text = f"{div_text} {div_classes} {div_id}".lower() "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;flavor', 'graveyard', 'discontinued']) "keyword">and len(div_text) > 20: flavor_divs.append({ &#x27;element': div, &#x27;text': div_text[:200] + ('...' "keyword">if len(div_text) > 200 "keyword">else ''), &#x27;classes': div_classes, &#x27;id': div_id, &#x27;text_length': len(div_text) }) print(f"Found {len(flavor_divs)} divs "keyword">with flavor-related content") # Sort by text length (longer content might be more relevant) flavor_divs.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;text_length'], reverse="keyword">True) print(f"\nTop 10 flavor-related divs by content length:") "keyword">for i, div_info "keyword">in enumerate(flavor_divs[:10], 1): print(f"\n{i}. Length: {div_info[&#x27;text_length']:,} chars") print(f" Classes: {div_info[&#x27;classes']}") print(f" ID: {div_info[&#x27;id']}") print(f" Text preview: {div_info[&#x27;text']}") print(f"\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING FOR IMAGES (HEADSTONES) ===\n") # Find all images all_images = soup.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f"Total images found: {len(all_images)}") headstone_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in all_images: img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') "keyword">or img.get('data-src', '') "keyword">or img.get('data-lazy-src', '') img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') img_title = img.get(&#x27;title', '') img_class = &#x27; '.join(img.get('"keyword">class', [])) "keyword">if img_src: # Convert relative URLs to absolute "keyword">if img_src.startswith(&#x27;//'): img_src = &#x27;https:' + img_src "keyword">elif img_src.startswith(&#x27;/'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com' + img_src "keyword">elif "keyword">not img_src.startswith(&#x27;http'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com/' + img_src # Check relevance "keyword">for headstone/graveyard images img_context = f"{img_src} {img_alt} {img_title} {img_class}".lower() relevance_keywords = [&#x27;headstone', 'graveyard', 'grave', 'tombstone', 'rip', 'flavor', 'discontinued'] relevance_score = sum(1 "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in relevance_keywords "keyword">if keyword "keyword">in img_context) "keyword">if relevance_score > 0 "keyword">or &#x27;graveyard' "keyword">in img_src.lower() "keyword">or 'flavor' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): headstone_images.append({ &#x27;src': img_src, &#x27;alt': img_alt, &#x27;title': img_title, &#x27;"keyword">class': img_class, &#x27;relevance_score': relevance_score, &#x27;context': img_context }) # Sort by relevance score headstone_images.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;relevance_score'], reverse="keyword">True) print(f"Found {len(headstone_images)} potentially relevant images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(headstone_images[:15], 1): # Show top 15 print(f"\n{i}. Relevance score: {img[&#x27;relevance_score']}") print(f" Source: {img[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: {img[&#x27;alt']}") print(f" Title: {img[&#x27;title']}") print(f" Class: {img[&#x27;"keyword">class']}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: SEARCHING FOR FLAVOR NAMES AND DATES ===\n") # Look "keyword">for text patterns that indicate flavor names "keyword">with dates year_pattern = r&#x27;\b(19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)\b' # 1970-2029 date_range_pattern = r&#x27;\b(19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)[-‚Äì‚Äî](19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)\b' # Date ranges # Split page text into meaningful chunks paragraphs = [p.strip() "keyword">for p "keyword">in page_text.split(&#x27;\n') "keyword">if p.strip()] flavors_with_dates = [] "keyword">for paragraph "keyword">in paragraphs: "keyword">if len(paragraph) < 10 "keyword">or len(paragraph) > 1000: # Skip very short "keyword">or very long paragraphs "keyword">continue # Check "keyword">if paragraph contains years years_found = re.findall(year_pattern, paragraph) date_ranges = re.findall(date_range_pattern, paragraph) "keyword">if years_found "keyword">or date_ranges: # This might be a flavor "keyword">with date information flavors_with_dates.append({ &#x27;text': paragraph, &#x27;years': list(set(years_found)), # Remove duplicates &#x27;date_ranges': date_ranges, &#x27;earliest_year': min([int(y) "keyword">for y "keyword">in years_found]) "keyword">if years_found "keyword">else "keyword">None }) print(f"Found {len(flavors_with_dates)} text sections "keyword">with date information") # Sort by earliest year to find the oldest flavors_with_dates_sorted = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in flavors_with_dates "keyword">if f[&#x27;earliest_year']] flavors_with_dates_sorted.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"\nTop 15 sections by earliest year (potential oldest flavors):") "keyword">for i, flavor_info "keyword">in enumerate(flavors_with_dates_sorted[:15], 1): print(f"\n{i}. Earliest year: {flavor_info[&#x27;earliest_year']}") print(f" All years: {flavor_info[&#x27;years']}") print(f" Date ranges: {flavor_info[&#x27;date_ranges']}") print(f" Text: {flavor_info[&#x27;text'][:200]}{'...' "keyword">if len(flavor_info['text']) > 200 "keyword">else ''}") # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_data = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;source_file': html_file, &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;content_stats': { &#x27;html_length': len(html_content), &#x27;text_length': len(page_text), &#x27;flavor_mentions': flavor_mentions, &#x27;graveyard_mentions': graveyard_mentions, &#x27;discontinued_mentions': discontinued_mentions }, &#x27;containers_found': len(unique_containers), &#x27;flavor_divs_found': len(flavor_divs), &#x27;total_images': len(all_images), &#x27;relevant_images': len(headstone_images), &#x27;flavors_with_dates': len(flavors_with_dates), &#x27;top_flavor_divs': flavor_divs[:10], # Top 10 by content length &#x27;top_headstone_images': headstone_images[:10], # Top 10 by relevance &#x27;oldest_flavors_candidates': flavors_with_dates_sorted[:10] # Top 10 oldest } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, default=str) # default=str to handle any non-serializable objects print(f"\n‚úì Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Summary "keyword">and next steps print(f"\n=== STEP 5: ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"‚úì Successfully parsed Ben & Jerry&#x27;s Graveyard HTML ({len(html_content):,} chars)") print(f"‚úì Found {len(flavor_divs)} flavor-related content sections") print(f"‚úì Located {len(headstone_images)} potentially relevant images") print(f"‚úì Identified {len(flavors_with_dates)} text sections "keyword">with date information") "keyword">if flavors_with_dates_sorted: oldest_candidate = flavors_with_dates_sorted[0] print(f"\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR CANDIDATE IDENTIFIED:") print(f" Earliest year: {oldest_candidate[&#x27;earliest_year']}") print(f" Years mentioned: {oldest_candidate[&#x27;years']}") print(f" Text preview: {oldest_candidate[&#x27;text'][:300]}...") print(f"\nüìã NEXT STEPS:") print(f" 1. Extract the specific flavor name "keyword">from the oldest candidate") print(f" 2. Find the corresponding headstone image "keyword">for this flavor") print(f" 3. Download "keyword">and analyze the headstone photo "keyword">for background details") print(f" 4. Identify other headstones visible "keyword">in the background") print(f" 5. Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme text "keyword">from background headstone") "keyword">else: print(f"\n‚ö† No clear oldest flavor identified - may need refined analysis") print(f"Recommendation: Examine flavor divs "keyword">and images more closely") "keyword">else: print(f"HTML file "keyword">not found: {html_file}") print(f"Cannot proceed "keyword">with analysis without the graveyard page content") print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Ready to proceed "keyword">with oldest flavor identification "keyword">and headstone image analysis")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === ANALYZING EXISTING BEN & JERRY'S GRAVEYARD DATA === Objective: Parse existing HTML file to find oldest flavor and headstone photos Strategy: Analyze workspace files, extract flavor data, identify oldest flavor === STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE FILES === Files in workspace: 2 - ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html (374,976 bytes) - ben_jerrys_flavors_initial_extraction.json (205 bytes) === INSPECTING JSON FILE STRUCTURE === Reading: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_flavors_initial_extraction.json JSON file content length: 205 characters JSON content preview: { "extraction_date": "2025-08-11T07:41:33.756389", "source_url": "https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard", "total_containers_analyzed": 12, "flavors_with_data": 0, "flavors_data": [] } JSON structure: extraction_date: 2025-08-11T07:41:33.756389 source_url: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard total_containers_analyzed: 12 flavors_with_data: 0 flavors_data: List with 0 items === ANALYZING HTML FILE === Reading: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html HTML file length: 373,435 characters Parsing HTML content... developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 4)
2025-08-11 07:45:13

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== REFINED FLAVOR DATE EXTRACTION FROM ACCORDION SECTIONS ===\n") print("Objective: Extract actual flavor names "keyword">and discontinuation dates "keyword">from accordion content") print("Strategy: Focus on the 7,640-character accordion sections that contain flavor details\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First inspect the comprehensive analysis file structure analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("=== STEP 1: INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE STRUCTURE ===\n") "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_content = f.read() print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters") "keyword">try: analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content) print("\nAnalysis file structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in analysis_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # Examine the top flavor divs structure "keyword">if &#x27;top_flavor_divs' "keyword">in analysis_data: print(f"\nTop flavor divs structure (first item):") "keyword">if analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs']: first_div = analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs'][0] "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in first_div.items(): "keyword">if key == &#x27;text': print(f" {key}: {len(str(value))} characters") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"JSON parsing error: {e}") "keyword">else: print(f"Analysis file "keyword">not found: {analysis_file}") # Now analyze the HTML file directly, focusing on accordion sections html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html') "keyword">if os.path.exists(html_file): print(f"\n=== STEP 2: FOCUSED ANALYSIS OF ACCORDION SECTIONS ===\n") "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML file length: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse "keyword">with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') # Look specifically "keyword">for accordion elements "keyword">and their content print("Searching "keyword">for accordion elements...") accordion_elements = soup.find_all([&#x27;div'], class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and 'accordion' "keyword">in ' '.join(x)) print(f"Found {len(accordion_elements)} accordion elements") # Also look "keyword">for collapse elements that contain flavor information collapse_elements = soup.find_all([&#x27;div'], class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and 'collapse' "keyword">in ' '.join(x)) print(f"Found {len(collapse_elements)} collapse elements") # Combine "keyword">and analyze all potential flavor containers flavor_containers = accordion_elements + collapse_elements print(f"\n=== STEP 3: EXTRACTING FLAVOR NAMES AND DATES FROM CONTAINERS ===\n") extracted_flavors = [] "keyword">for i, container "keyword">in enumerate(flavor_containers, 1): container_text = container.get_text(strip="keyword">True) container_classes = &#x27; '.join(container.get('"keyword">class', [])) container_id = container.get(&#x27;id', '') print(f"\nContainer {i}:") print(f" Classes: {container_classes}") print(f" ID: {container_id}") print(f" Text length: {len(container_text):,} characters") "keyword">if len(container_text) > 100: # Focus on containers "keyword">with substantial content print(f" Text preview: {container_text[:200]}...") # Look "keyword">for flavor name patterns (usually at the beginning) lines = container_text.split(&#x27;\n') first_meaningful_line = "keyword">None "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_clean = line.strip() "keyword">if len(line_clean) > 3 "keyword">and "keyword">not line_clean.lower().startswith((&#x27;skip', 'search', 'suggestions')): first_meaningful_line = line_clean "keyword">break "keyword">if first_meaningful_line: print(f" First meaningful line (potential flavor name): {first_meaningful_line}") # Extract date patterns "keyword">with more comprehensive regex date_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})', # 1993-2001 r&#x27;(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})', # 1993 - 2001 r&#x27;\b(19\d{2}|20\d{2})[-‚Äì‚Äî](19\d{2}|20\d{2})\b', # More specific year ranges r&#x27;\b(19\d{2}|20\d{2})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(19\d{2}|20\d{2})\b' # With spaces ] dates_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, container_text) dates_found.extend(matches) # Also look "keyword">for individual years individual_years = re.findall(r&#x27;\b(19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)\b', container_text) "keyword">if dates_found "keyword">or individual_years: print(f" Date ranges found: {dates_found}") print(f" Individual years found: {individual_years}") # Determine the earliest year "keyword">for this flavor all_years = [] "keyword">for date_range "keyword">in dates_found: all_years.extend([int(date_range[0]), int(date_range[1])]) all_years.extend([int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in individual_years]) "keyword">if all_years: earliest_year = min(all_years) latest_year = max(all_years) # Try to extract the flavor name more precisely flavor_name = "keyword">None # Look "keyword">for text before the first date text_before_date = container_text "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in date_patterns + [r&#x27;\b19\d{2}\b', r'\b20\d{2}\b']: match = re.search(pattern, text_before_date) "keyword">if match: text_before_date = text_before_date[:match.start()].strip() "keyword">break # Clean up the potential flavor name potential_names = [line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text_before_date.split(&#x27;\n') "keyword">if line.strip()] # Find the most likely flavor name (usually short "keyword">and meaningful) "keyword">for name "keyword">in potential_names: "keyword">if 5 <= len(name) <= 50 "keyword">and "keyword">not any(skip_word "keyword">in name.lower() "keyword">for skip_word "keyword">in [&#x27;skip', 'search', 'flavor graveyard', 'ben & jerry', 'ice cream']): flavor_name = name "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not flavor_name "keyword">and potential_names: flavor_name = potential_names[0] # Fallback to first line extracted_flavors.append({ &#x27;container_index': i, &#x27;flavor_name': flavor_name, &#x27;earliest_year': earliest_year, &#x27;latest_year': latest_year, &#x27;date_ranges': dates_found, &#x27;individual_years': individual_years, &#x27;container_classes': container_classes, &#x27;container_text_preview': container_text[:500] }) print(f" *** FLAVOR EXTRACTED ***") print(f" Name: {flavor_name}") print(f" Earliest year: {earliest_year}") print(f" Latest year: {latest_year}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: SORTING FLAVORS BY AGE TO FIND THE OLDEST ===\n") # Sort by earliest year to find the true oldest flavor extracted_flavors.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}") print(f"\nTop 15 oldest flavors:") "keyword">for i, flavor "keyword">in enumerate(extracted_flavors[:15], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {flavor[&#x27;flavor_name'] "keyword">or 'Unknown Name'}") print(f" Years: {flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']} - {flavor['latest_year']}") print(f" Date ranges: {flavor[&#x27;date_ranges']}") print(f" Container classes: {flavor[&#x27;container_classes']}") "keyword">if extracted_flavors: oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0] print(f"\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:") print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;flavor_name']}") print(f" Years: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']} - {oldest_flavor['latest_year']}") print(f" Date ranges: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;date_ranges']}") print(f"\n=== STEP 5: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n") # Load the headstone images "keyword">from previous analysis "keyword">if &#x27;analysis_data' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and 'top_headstone_images' "keyword">in analysis_data: headstone_images = analysis_data[&#x27;top_headstone_images'] print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}") # Try to match the oldest flavor name "keyword">with a headstone image oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[&#x27;flavor_name'] "keyword">or '' matching_headstones = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in headstone_images: img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '').lower() img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '').lower() # Check "keyword">if the flavor name appears "keyword">in the image alt text "keyword">or filename "keyword">if oldest_flavor_name: flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.lower().split() "keyword">if any(word "keyword">in img_alt "keyword">or word "keyword">in img_src "keyword">for word "keyword">in flavor_words "keyword">if len(word) > 3): matching_headstones.append(img) "keyword">if matching_headstones: print(f"Found {len(matching_headstones)} potentially matching headstone images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(matching_headstones, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {img[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: {img[&#x27;alt']}") print(f" Relevance score: {img.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 0)}") best_match = matching_headstones[0] print(f"\n‚úì BEST MATCHING HEADSTONE IMAGE:") print(f" URL: {best_match[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: {best_match[&#x27;alt']}") "keyword">else: print(f"No direct matches found "keyword">for &#x27;{oldest_flavor_name}'") print(f"Will need to examine all headstone images manually") # Show all available headstone images "keyword">for manual inspection print(f"\nAll available headstone images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(headstone_images[:10], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {img[&#x27;alt']}") print(f" URL: {img[&#x27;src']}") # Save the refined flavor extraction results refined_results = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'focused_accordion_analysis', &#x27;total_flavors_extracted': len(extracted_flavors), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor "keyword">if extracted_flavors "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;all_flavors_by_age': extracted_flavors, &#x27;next_steps': [ &#x27;Download the oldest flavor headstone image', &#x27;Analyze the image "keyword">for background headstones', &#x27;Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">from background headstone', &#x27;Identify the last line of the background headstone rhyme' ] } refined_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_refined_flavor_extraction.json') "keyword">with open(refined_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(refined_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Refined flavor extraction results saved to: {refined_file}") "keyword">else: print(f"HTML file "keyword">not found: {html_file}") print(f"\n=== REFINED FLAVOR EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Next: Download "keyword">and analyze the oldest flavor&#x27;s headstone image "keyword">for background details")
üìÑ Output

class="hero-content"> <h1 class="heading-1">Flavor Graveyard</h1> <div class="hero-body"><p>Even the best Ben &amp; Jerry‚Äôs flavors eventually melt away. Here we lay our dearly de-pinted to rest so we can mourn their chunks and swirls and keep their sweet memories alive.</p> </div> <div class="hero-buttons"> </div> </div> </div> </article><div class="row grid-row"> <div class="col-md-3"></div> <div class="col-md-6"> <article class="youtube-video"> <h2 class="visually-hidden">Flavor Graveyard | Ben &amp; Jerry‚Äôs ‚Äì Video</h2> <div class="ratio ratio-16x9"> <div class="d-none alert alert-warning m-4" id="consent-warning-17941d74-57a4-446c-aaf1-5fb878cea71d" role="alert"> <div class="alert-icon"> <span class="icon icon-warning" role="img"></span> </div> <div class="alert-content"> <p>Content and/or functionality on this page requires you to accept cookies.</p> <div class="alert-buttons"> <button class="btn btn-primary" data-ot-accept=""> Accept All Cookies</button> </div> </div> </div> <iframe allowfullscreen="" class="optanon-category-C0004" data-one-trust="C0004" data-warning="consent-warning-17941d74-57a4-446c-aaf1-5fb878cea71d" loading="lazy" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/1V-sovk_3qE?rel=0&amp;cc_lang_pref=en&amp;modestbranding=1&amp;disablekb=1" title="Flavor Graveyard | Ben &amp; Jerry‚Äôs ‚Äì Video"></iframe> </div> </article></div> <div class="col-md-3"></div> </div><div class="row grid-row"> <div class="col-md-3"></div> <div class="col-md-6"><div class="accordion" id="accordion-1ace45df-77cb-4f67-be03-08379c5e27c0"> <header> <div class="accordion-body"></div> </header> <ul> <li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-eb65abaf-ead3-4bc0-8ffd-bcc0fc880109"> <button aria-controls="collapse-eb65abaf-ead3-4bc0-8ffd-bcc0fc880109" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-eb65abaf-ead3-4bc0-8ffd-bcc0fc880109" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Aloha Macadamia</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-eb65abaf-ead3-4bc0-8ffd-bcc0fc880109" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-eb65abaf-ead3-4bc0-8ffd-bcc0fc880109" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2001-2002</strong></p> <p>Rich milk chocolate cashew Brazil-nut butter ice cream with macadamia nuts covered in white &amp; dark fudge &amp; milk chocolatey swirl.</p> <p><em>We won't blame the macadamia<br/> But we were kinda in denial<br/> The Marketplace had spoken:<br/> Mac got aloha'ed off the aisle.</em></p> </div><img alt="Aloha Macadamia tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0039_graveyard_aloha_macadamia.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-1d2561b7-a462-4ef9-ac71-71f5ba6940c4"> <button aria-controls="collapse-1d2561b7-a462-4ef9-ac71-71f5ba6940c4" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-1d2561b7-a462-4ef9-ac71-71f5ba6940c4" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Bovinity Divinity</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-1d2561b7-a462-4ef9-ac71-71f5ba6940c4" class="accordion-collapse collapse" fudge cows swirled with white chocolate ice cream &amp; dark fudge cows</p> <p><em>Where do all the cows go<br/> when heaven gives the word?<br/> This flavor kicked the bucket<br/> when angels took the herd.</em></p> </div><img alt="Bovinity Divinity tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-a5812a41-ed7a-40f6-83d9-1b6a7ed578ac"> <button aria-controls="collapse-a5812a41-ed7a-40f6-83d9-1b6a7ed578ac" aria-expanded="false" <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-a5812a41-ed7a-40f6-83d9-1b6a7ed578ac" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-a5812a41-ed7a-40f6-83d9-1b6a7ed578ac" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1994-2001</strong></p> <p>Vanilla frozen yogurt with gobs of chocolate chip cookie dough</p> <p><em>So now we know: ¬†our Dough Fro Yo<br/> Just wasn't as greate as expected.<br/> Folks who love Dough as well as Fro Yo<br/> Love 'em separate, not interconnected.</em></p> </div><img alt="Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Frozen Yogurt </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-2d01794e-8670-4895-b570-649ca17f8481"> <button data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Chocolate Comfort</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-2d01794e-8670-4895-b570-649ca17f8481" class="accordion-collapse collapse" swirled with White Chocolate Low Fat Ice Cream.</p> <p><em>It's curtains for the<br/> chocolate pair<br/> I ate alone in the comfy chair,<br/> One pint per night it might<br/> have been<br/> But 'twas low fat so it<br/> weren't no sin.</em></p> </div><img alt="Chocolate Comfort tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2010-2011</strong></p> <p>Chocolate &amp; Vanilla Ice Creams with Chocolatey Covered Macadamia Nuts</p> <p><em>Nuts about chocolate<br/> Chocolate about nuts<br/> Swirled vanilla with chocolate<br/> Maybe too much?</em></p> </div><img alt="image-from-the-document-manager" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2011-2012</strong></p> <p>Chocolate Ice Cream with Coconut Caramel Swirls &amp; a Chocolatey Covered Coconut Caramel Crunch</p> <p><em>Chocolate and coconut<br/> is<br/> beyond compare,<br/> So it may not be beaucoup<br/> too late to save<br/> Cr√®me Brulee from<br/> beyond the grave.</em></p> </div><img alt="Creme Brulee tombstone" class="" height="750" <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1988-1988</strong></p> <p>Vanilla Ice Cream with Chocolate Covered Almonds</p> <p><em>In memory of nuts<br/> And Green Mountain Boys,<br/> Here history shuts<br/> The pint lid on their joys.</em></p> </div><img alt="Ethan Almond tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1986-1991</strong></p> <p>Vanilla Ice Cream with Fresh Georgia Peaches</p> <p><em>Fresh-picked peaches<br/> trucked from Georgia<br/> Tasted great but couldn't <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-335e70e3-a145-432e-b499-71c7641d6d93"> <button aria-controls="collapse-335e70e3-a145-432e-b499-71c7641d6d93" aria-expanded="false" <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1997-1998</strong></p> <p>Creamy Ricotta and Pistachio Ice Cream with Chocolate Covered Cannolis and Roasted Pistachios</p> <p><em>Now in front of the pearly gates,<br/> Holy Cannoli sits and waits.<br/> What brought its ruin no one knows,<br/> Must have been the pistachios.</em></p> </div><img alt="Holy Cannoli tombstone" class="" height="750" class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-ece71f74-1251-487c-98b6-6b910b427cbe"> <button aria-controls="collapse-ece71f74-1251-487c-98b6-6b910b427cbe" </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-ece71f74-1251-487c-98b6-6b910b427cbe" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-ece71f74-1251-487c-98b6-6b910b427cbe" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1992-1993</strong></p> <p>Ginger Ice Cream with a Fudge Swirl</p> <p><em>One Potato, two potato,<br/> Sweet Potato Pie,<br/> No one could appreciate it,<br/> So we had to let it die.</em></p> </div><img alt="Miz Jelena's Sweet Potato Pie tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy"
