<h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-49d6c88e-66b9-48e4-8b07-3f5bef44428e"> <button aria-controls="collapse-49d6c88e-66b9-48e4-8b07-3f5bef44428e" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-49d6c88e-66b9-48e4-8b07-3f5bef44428e" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Oh Pear</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-49d6c88e-66b9-48e4-8b07-3f5bef44428e" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-49d6c88e-66b9-48e4-8b07-3f5bef44428e" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1997-1997</strong></p> <p>Fresh Pear Ice Cream with a hint of Almond and a Light Fudge Swirl</p> <p><em>Oh Pear, Oh Pear,<br/> A mixture of mirth<br/> All nannies did weep<br/> When you left of this earth.</em></p> </div><img alt="Oh Pear tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0038_graveyard_oh_pear.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-494aaa0a-bbcd-40b1-a09d-bf130c28ec51"> <button aria-controls="collapse-494aaa0a-bbcd-40b1-a09d-bf130c28ec51" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-494aaa0a-bbcd-40b1-a09d-bf130c28ec51" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Peanut Butter and Jelly</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-494aaa0a-bbcd-40b1-a09d-bf130c28ec51" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-494aaa0a-bbcd-40b1-a09d-bf130c28ec51" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1989-1990</strong></p> <p>Peanut Butter Ice Cream with Peanut Butter Bits and Strawberry Jelly Swirl</p> <p><em>An unbeatable duo!<br/> Yet somehow it managed<br/> To flop in a cone,<br/> So we stuck to the sammich.</em></p> </div><img alt="Peanut Butter and Jelly tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0032_graveyard_peanut_butter_jelly.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-2aa50596-7130-471a-98f0-193811c1e733"> <button aria-controls="collapse-2aa50596-7130-471a-98f0-193811c1e733" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-2aa50596-7130-471a-98f0-193811c1e733" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Peanuts! Popcorn!</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-2aa50596-7130-471a-98f0-193811c1e733" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-2aa50596-7130-471a-98f0-193811c1e733" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2000-2000</strong></p> <p>Caramel Ice Cream with White Fudge-covered Caramel Popcorn, Toffee-coated Peanuts &amp; a Caramel Swirl</p> <p><em>Peanuts, Popcorn!<br/> mix 'em in a pot!<br/> Plop 'em in your ice cream!<br/> Well, maybe not.</em></p> </div><img alt="Peanuts! Popcorn! tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0018_graveyard_popcorn_peanuts.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-792b892d-2781-41e4-931e-02b6a2a90d2b"> <button aria-controls="collapse-792b892d-2781-41e4-931e-02b6a2a90d2b" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-792b892d-2781-41e4-931e-02b6a2a90d2b" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Purple Passion Fruit</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-792b892d-2781-41e4-931e-02b6a2a90d2b" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-792b892d-2781-41e4-931e-02b6a2a90d2b" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1996-2001</strong></p> <p>Swirls of Raspberry-Blackberry &amp; Passion Fruit Sorbet With Other Natural Flavors</p> <p><em>We kept the passion going<br/> 'til all efforts were in vain.<br/> Now Purple Passion's majesty's<br/> beneath the fruited plain.</em></p> </div><img alt="Purple Passion Fruit tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0007_graveyard_purle_passionfruit.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-176211a6-af3d-43f6-af25-8263ec7b105c"> <button aria-controls="collapse-176211a6-af3d-43f6-af25-8263ec7b105c" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-176211a6-af3d-43f6-af25-8263ec7b105c" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Rainforest Crunch</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-176211a6-af3d-43f6-af25-8263ec7b105c" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-176211a6-af3d-43f6-af25-8263ec7b105c" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1989-1999</strong></p> <p>Ice Cream with Rainforest Crunch ‚Äì a cashew and Brazil nut butter crunch</p> <p><em>With aching heart &amp; heavy sigh<br/> We bid Rainforest Crunch goodbye.<br/> That nutty brittle from exotic places<br/> Got sticky in between our braces.</em></p> </div><img alt="Rainforest Crunch tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0036_graveyard_rainforest_crunch.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-de528e8c-3825-45c4-8f86-1ca7a677f217"> <button aria-controls="collapse-de528e8c-3825-45c4-8f86-1ca7a677f217" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-de528e8c-3825-45c4-8f86-1ca7a677f217" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Schweddy Balls</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-de528e8c-3825-45c4-8f86-1ca7a677f217" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-de528e8c-3825-45c4-8f86-1ca7a677f217" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <img alt="Schweddy Balls tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_schweddy2.jpg" width="750"/> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2011 Holiday Season Limited Batch</strong></p> <p>Vanilla ice cream with a hint of rum &amp; loaded with fudge-covered rum &amp; malt balls</p> <p><em>Born of the classic SNL sketch<br/> The masses rejoiced<br/> while others kvetched.</em></p> <p><em>Fudge-covered rum balls<br/> &amp; malt balls galore!<br/> The double entendre -<br/> too fun to ignore!</em></p> <p><em>This holiday favorite -<br/> with love from Pete Schweddy,<br/> vanished from store shelves<br/> before we were ready.</em></p> </div></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-6167633c-0bcf-4ec3-b03b-b8e95727e520"> <button aria-controls="collapse-6167633c-0bcf-4ec3-b03b-b8e95727e520" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-6167633c-0bcf-4ec3-b03b-b8e95727e520" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Sugar Plum</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-6167633c-0bcf-4ec3-b03b-b8e95727e520" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-6167633c-0bcf-4ec3-b03b-b8e95727e520" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1989-1990</strong></p> <p>Plum Ice Cream with a Caramel Swirl</p> <p><em>It swirled in our heads,<br/> It danced in our dreams,<br/> It proved not to be though,<br/> The best of ice creams.</em></p> </div><img alt="Sugar Plum tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0005_graveyard_sugar_plum.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-4c36567f-30ad-4c3c-92e6-3dd2b14d8f42"> <button aria-controls="collapse-4c36567f-30ad-4c3c-92e6-3dd2b14d8f42" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-4c36567f-30ad-4c3c-92e6-3dd2b14d8f42" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Tennessee Mud</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-4c36567f-30ad-4c3c-92e6-3dd2b14d8f42" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-4c36567f-30ad-4c3c-92e6-3dd2b14d8f42" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1988-1989</strong></p> <p>Coffee Ice Cream with Amaretto, Jack Daniels Tennessee Whiskey and Roasted Slivered Almonds</p> <p><em>The bottle is empty,<br/> The cup, and the glass.<br/> Mud with Jack Daniels<br/> Was not meant to last.</em></p> </div><img alt="Tennessee Mud tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0006_graveyard_tennesee_mud.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-6d1da59d-42be-4e5d-992c-a95b33de098f"> <button aria-controls="collapse-6d1da59d-42be-4e5d-992c-a95b33de098f" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-6d1da59d-42be-4e5d-992c-a95b33de098f" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> The Wich</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-6d1da59d-42be-4e5d-992c-a95b33de098f" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-6d1da59d-42be-4e5d-992c-a95b33de098f" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2004-2006</strong></p> <p>Chewy Fudge-Swirled Chocolate Chunk Cookies &amp; Vanilla Fudge Chip Ice Cream</p> <p><em>The Wich that was,<br/> Was wicked good,<br/> And all was well<br/> For quite a spell.<br/> However it was,<br/> The Wich that was<br/> Was ditched‚Ä¶because.</em></p> </div><img alt="The Wich tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0014_graveyard_the_wich.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-6e3def69-7ba5-43f0-b42e-84fc1b40fdd1"> <button aria-controls="collapse-6e3def69-7ba5-43f0-b42e-84fc1b40fdd1" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-6e3def69-7ba5-43f0-b42e-84fc1b40fdd1" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> This is Nuts</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-6e3def69-7ba5-43f0-b42e-84fc1b40fdd1" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-6e3def69-7ba5-43f0-b42e-84fc1b40fdd1" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2001-2002</strong></p> <p>A nutty mix of chocolate &amp; pistachio ice creams with fudge covered almonds &amp; lightly roasted pistachios</p> <p><em>The name was meant to say it all<br/> Without the pompous prose<br/> Was it nuts we chose to say so,<br/> or was it the nuts we chose?</em></p> </div><img alt="This Is Nuts tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0037_graveyard_this_is_nuts.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-5a76dfdd-5296-44c1-abd7-ca7617334880"> <button aria-controls="collapse-5a76dfdd-5296-44c1-abd7-ca7617334880" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-5a76dfdd-5296-44c1-abd7-ca7617334880" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Turtle Soup</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-5a76dfdd-5296-44c1-abd7-ca7617334880" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-5a76dfdd-5296-44c1-abd7-ca7617334880" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2006-2010</strong></p> <p>Vanilla ice cream with fudge-covered caramel cashews &amp; a caramel swirl</p> <p><em>Slow and Steady wins the race,<br/> Turtle Soup kept up the pace,<br/> You may protest, but we suggest,<br/> Turtle Soup deserves a rest.</em></p> </div><img alt="Turtle Soup tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0012_graveyard_turtle_soup.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-b0a50328-4d52-4254-8f8a-b105a85bee95"> <button aria-controls="collapse-b0a50328-4d52-4254-8f8a-b105a85bee95" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-b0a50328-4d52-4254-8f8a-b105a85bee95" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Tuskeegee Chunk</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-b0a50328-4d52-4254-8f8a-b105a85bee95" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-b0a50328-4d52-4254-8f8a-b105a85bee95" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1989-1990</strong></p> <p>Peanut butter ice cream with chocolate chunks</p> <p><em>Lost flavor so melted.<br/> Who could have foreseen it?<br/> Perhaps we misspelt it?<br/> Adieu, precious peanut.</em></p> </div><img alt="Tuskeegee Chunk tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_graveyard_tuskeegee_chunk.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-a57be029-8f10-46c7-971c-e0231963eab3"> <button aria-controls="collapse-a57be029-8f10-46c7-971c-e0231963eab3" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-a57be029-8f10-46c7-971c-e0231963eab3" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Urban Jumble</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-a57be029-8f10-46c7-971c-e0231963eab3" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-a57be029-8f10-46c7-971c-e0231963eab3" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2000-2001</strong></p> <p>Coconut Almond Fudge Chip meets New York Super Fudge Chunk A Swirling Safari of Chocolate Ice Cream &amp; Coconut Ice Cream mixed with White &amp; Dark Chocolatey Chunks, Pecans &amp; Roasted Almonds</p> <p><em>The chaos &amp; cacophony<br/> of busy city life<br/> lies peaceful now under a maple tree,<br/> the flavor lost its strife</em></p> </div><img alt="Urban Jungle tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0034_graveyard_urban_jumble.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-bf2c3e2d-b884-48d8-b9b3-b02123b2112a"> <button aria-controls="collapse-bf2c3e2d-b884-48d8-b9b3-b02123b2112a" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-bf2c3e2d-b884-48d8-b9b3-b02123b2112a" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Vermonty Python</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-bf2c3e2d-b884-48d8-b9b3-b02123b2112a" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-bf2c3e2d-b884-48d8-b9b3-b02123b2112a" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2006-2008</strong></p> <p>Coffee liqueur ice cream with chocolate cookie crumb swirl &amp; fudge cows</p> <p><em>right, then‚Ä¶is it dead or isn't it?<br/> no it isn't‚Ä¶<br/> yes it is‚Ä¶<br/> no it isn't‚Ä¶<br/> rubbish! you're a loony!<br/> no i'm not‚Ä¶</em></p> </div><img alt="Vermonty Python tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0010_graveyard_vermonty_python.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-f4f6bfcf-77ef-4a66-b565-9f5699e05075"> <button aria-controls="collapse-f4f6bfcf-77ef-4a66-b565-9f5699e05075" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-f4f6bfcf-77ef-4a66-b565-9f5699e05075" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Wavy Gravy</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-f4f6bfcf-77ef-4a66-b565-9f5699e05075" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-f4f6bfcf-77ef-4a66-b565-9f5699e05075" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1993-2001</strong></p> <p>A caramel &amp; cashew brazil nut ice cream with a chocolate hazelnut fudge swirl &amp; roasted almonds</p> <p><em>Just so there's no confusion<br/> We thought we oughtta warn ya:<br/> Wavy Gravy isn't dead -¬†<br/> He lives in California.</em></p> <p><em>No such luck for Wavy's flavor,<br/> But we've been wrong before,¬†<br/> We won't give up the ghost if you won't,<br/> So what're you waiting for?</em></p> </div><img alt="Wavy Gravy tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0011_graveyard_wavy_gravy.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-724ade98-9ebd-405b-a67f-5cf12288f20a"> <button aria-controls="collapse-724ade98-9ebd-405b-a67f-5cf12288f20a" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-724ade98-9ebd-405b-a67f-5cf12288f20a" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> White Russian</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-724ade98-9ebd-405b-a67f-5cf12288f20a" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-724ade98-9ebd-405b-a67f-5cf12288f20a" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1986-1996</strong></p> <p>Coffee Ice Cream with Kahlua Coffee Liqueur</p> <p><em>Bid adieu to ol' White Russian,<br/> Our tears, they are a-gushin',<br/> But in our scoop shops,<br/> please don't forget,<br/> Dead it's not, oh no, not nyet.</em></p> </div><img alt="White Russian tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0041_graveyard_white_russian.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-bdfa1b7b-4192-4c5c-bdc5-23f96cb4f166"> <button aria-controls="collapse-bdfa1b7b-4192-4c5c-bdc5-23f96cb4f166" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-bdfa1b7b-4192-4c5c-bdc5-23f96cb4f166" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Wild Maine Blueberry</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-bdfa1b7b-4192-4c5c-bdc5-23f96cb4f166" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-bdfa1b7b-4192-4c5c-bdc5-23f96cb4f166" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1992-1993</strong></p> <p>Blueberry ice cream with Maine blueberry puree and wild Maine blueberries</p> <p><em>Wild Maine Blueberry<br/> From the land of the puffin,<br/> Now when we crave you<br/> We turn to the muffin.</em></p> </div><img alt="Wild Maine Blueberry tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0008_graveyard_wild-maine_blueberry.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li></ul> </div></div> <div class="banner-content"> <h2 class="heading heading-2">Tell us what flavor you'd like to see back!</h2> <div class="banner-body"><p>Tell us what flavor you'd like to see back and why and we will resurrect the most popular.</p> </div> <div class="banner-buttons"> <a class="btn btn-primary" href="/contact-us" target="_self" title="Contact Us">Resurrect a Flavor</a></div> </div> </article><div tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 07:45:13

Execution failed - The code ran without errors and attempted to extract flavor information from accordion sections, but the core extraction logic failed completely. The code found 0 accordion elements and 0 collapse elements when searching for containers, resulting in 0 flavors extracted despite having 374KB of Ben & Jerry's graveyard page data. The output shows the comprehensive analysis file structure was loaded correctly, revealing 40 flavor divs and 43 headstone images were previously identified, but the current implementation's search approach missed the actual flavor data containers. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no flavors were extracted, so we cannot identify the oldest flavor or proceed with headstone analysis. Issue: The code's CSS selectors for accordion and collapse elements didn't match the actual HTML structure. Recommended fix: Instead of searching for generic 'accordion' class elements, parse the large flavor content sections that were already identified in the previous analysis (the 7,640-character accordion sections contain the actual flavor names and dates). Use the existing comprehensive analysis data to extract flavor information from the accordion HTML structure that's already been located.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== REFINED FLAVOR DATE EXTRACTION FROM ACCORDION SECTIONS ===\n") print("Objective: Extract actual flavor names "keyword">and discontinuation dates "keyword">from accordion content") print("Strategy: Focus on the 7,640-character accordion sections that contain flavor details\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First inspect the comprehensive analysis file structure analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("=== STEP 1: INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE STRUCTURE ===\n") "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_content = f.read() print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters") "keyword">try: analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content) print("\nAnalysis file structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in analysis_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # Examine the top flavor divs structure "keyword">if &#x27;top_flavor_divs' "keyword">in analysis_data: print(f"\nTop flavor divs structure (first item):") "keyword">if analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs']: first_div = analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs'][0] "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in first_div.items(): "keyword">if key == &#x27;text': print(f" {key}: {len(str(value))} characters") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"JSON parsing error: {e}") "keyword">else: print(f"Analysis file "keyword">not found: {analysis_file}") # Now analyze the HTML file directly, focusing on accordion sections html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html') "keyword">if os.path.exists(html_file): print(f"\n=== STEP 2: FOCUSED ANALYSIS OF ACCORDION SECTIONS ===\n") "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML file length: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse "keyword">with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') # Look specifically "keyword">for accordion elements "keyword">and their content print("Searching "keyword">for accordion elements...") accordion_elements = soup.find_all([&#x27;div'], class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and 'accordion' "keyword">in ' '.join(x)) print(f"Found {len(accordion_elements)} accordion elements") # Also look "keyword">for collapse elements that contain flavor information collapse_elements = soup.find_all([&#x27;div'], class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and 'collapse' "keyword">in ' '.join(x)) print(f"Found {len(collapse_elements)} collapse elements") # Combine "keyword">and analyze all potential flavor containers flavor_containers = accordion_elements + collapse_elements print(f"\n=== STEP 3: EXTRACTING FLAVOR NAMES AND DATES FROM CONTAINERS ===\n") extracted_flavors = [] "keyword">for i, container "keyword">in enumerate(flavor_containers, 1): container_text = container.get_text(strip="keyword">True) container_classes = &#x27; '.join(container.get('"keyword">class', [])) container_id = container.get(&#x27;id', '') print(f"\nContainer {i}:") print(f" Classes: {container_classes}") print(f" ID: {container_id}") print(f" Text length: {len(container_text):,} characters") "keyword">if len(container_text) > 100: # Focus on containers "keyword">with substantial content print(f" Text preview: {container_text[:200]}...") # Look "keyword">for flavor name patterns (usually at the beginning) lines = container_text.split(&#x27;\n') first_meaningful_line = "keyword">None "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_clean = line.strip() "keyword">if len(line_clean) > 3 "keyword">and "keyword">not line_clean.lower().startswith((&#x27;skip', 'search', 'suggestions')): first_meaningful_line = line_clean "keyword">break "keyword">if first_meaningful_line: print(f" First meaningful line (potential flavor name): {first_meaningful_line}") # Extract date patterns "keyword">with more comprehensive regex date_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})', # 1993-2001 r&#x27;(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})', # 1993 - 2001 r&#x27;\b(19\d{2}|20\d{2})[-‚Äì‚Äî](19\d{2}|20\d{2})\b', # More specific year ranges r&#x27;\b(19\d{2}|20\d{2})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(19\d{2}|20\d{2})\b' # With spaces ] dates_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, container_text) dates_found.extend(matches) # Also look "keyword">for individual years individual_years = re.findall(r&#x27;\b(19[7-9]\d|20[0-2]\d)\b', container_text) "keyword">if dates_found "keyword">or individual_years: print(f" Date ranges found: {dates_found}") print(f" Individual years found: {individual_years}") # Determine the earliest year "keyword">for this flavor all_years = [] "keyword">for date_range "keyword">in dates_found: all_years.extend([int(date_range[0]), int(date_range[1])]) all_years.extend([int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in individual_years]) "keyword">if all_years: earliest_year = min(all_years) latest_year = max(all_years) # Try to extract the flavor name more precisely flavor_name = "keyword">None # Look "keyword">for text before the first date text_before_date = container_text "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in date_patterns + [r&#x27;\b19\d{2}\b', r'\b20\d{2}\b']: match = re.search(pattern, text_before_date) "keyword">if match: text_before_date = text_before_date[:match.start()].strip() "keyword">break # Clean up the potential flavor name potential_names = [line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text_before_date.split(&#x27;\n') "keyword">if line.strip()] # Find the most likely flavor name (usually short "keyword">and meaningful) "keyword">for name "keyword">in potential_names: "keyword">if 5 <= len(name) <= 50 "keyword">and "keyword">not any(skip_word "keyword">in name.lower() "keyword">for skip_word "keyword">in [&#x27;skip', 'search', 'flavor graveyard', 'ben & jerry', 'ice cream']): flavor_name = name "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not flavor_name "keyword">and potential_names: flavor_name = potential_names[0] # Fallback to first line extracted_flavors.append({ &#x27;container_index': i, &#x27;flavor_name': flavor_name, &#x27;earliest_year': earliest_year, &#x27;latest_year': latest_year, &#x27;date_ranges': dates_found, &#x27;individual_years': individual_years, &#x27;container_classes': container_classes, &#x27;container_text_preview': container_text[:500] }) print(f" *** FLAVOR EXTRACTED ***") print(f" Name: {flavor_name}") print(f" Earliest year: {earliest_year}") print(f" Latest year: {latest_year}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: SORTING FLAVORS BY AGE TO FIND THE OLDEST ===\n") # Sort by earliest year to find the true oldest flavor extracted_flavors.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}") print(f"\nTop 15 oldest flavors:") "keyword">for i, flavor "keyword">in enumerate(extracted_flavors[:15], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {flavor[&#x27;flavor_name'] "keyword">or 'Unknown Name'}") print(f" Years: {flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']} - {flavor['latest_year']}") print(f" Date ranges: {flavor[&#x27;date_ranges']}") print(f" Container classes: {flavor[&#x27;container_classes']}") "keyword">if extracted_flavors: oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0] print(f"\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:") print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;flavor_name']}") print(f" Years: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']} - {oldest_flavor['latest_year']}") print(f" Date ranges: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;date_ranges']}") print(f"\n=== STEP 5: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n") # Load the headstone images "keyword">from previous analysis "keyword">if &#x27;analysis_data' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and 'top_headstone_images' "keyword">in analysis_data: headstone_images = analysis_data[&#x27;top_headstone_images'] print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}") # Try to match the oldest flavor name "keyword">with a headstone image oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[&#x27;flavor_name'] "keyword">or '' matching_headstones = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in headstone_images: img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '').lower() img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '').lower() # Check "keyword">if the flavor name appears "keyword">in the image alt text "keyword">or filename "keyword">if oldest_flavor_name: flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.lower().split() "keyword">if any(word "keyword">in img_alt "keyword">or word "keyword">in img_src "keyword">for word "keyword">in flavor_words "keyword">if len(word) > 3): matching_headstones.append(img) "keyword">if matching_headstones: print(f"Found {len(matching_headstones)} potentially matching headstone images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(matching_headstones, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {img[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: {img[&#x27;alt']}") print(f" Relevance score: {img.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 0)}") best_match = matching_headstones[0] print(f"\n‚úì BEST MATCHING HEADSTONE IMAGE:") print(f" URL: {best_match[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: {best_match[&#x27;alt']}") "keyword">else: print(f"No direct matches found "keyword">for &#x27;{oldest_flavor_name}'") print(f"Will need to examine all headstone images manually") # Show all available headstone images "keyword">for manual inspection print(f"\nAll available headstone images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(headstone_images[:10], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {img[&#x27;alt']}") print(f" URL: {img[&#x27;src']}") # Save the refined flavor extraction results refined_results = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'focused_accordion_analysis', &#x27;total_flavors_extracted': len(extracted_flavors), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor "keyword">if extracted_flavors "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;all_flavors_by_age': extracted_flavors, &#x27;next_steps': [ &#x27;Download the oldest flavor headstone image', &#x27;Analyze the image "keyword">for background headstones', &#x27;Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">from background headstone', &#x27;Identify the last line of the background headstone rhyme' ] } refined_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_refined_flavor_extraction.json') "keyword">with open(refined_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(refined_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Refined flavor extraction results saved to: {refined_file}") "keyword">else: print(f"HTML file "keyword">not found: {html_file}") print(f"\n=== REFINED FLAVOR EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Next: Download "keyword">and analyze the oldest flavor&#x27;s headstone image "keyword">for background details")
üìÑ Output

Dictionary with 5 keys containers_found: 9 flavor_divs_found: 40 total_images: 84 relevant_images: 43 flavors_with_dates: 2 top_flavor_divs: List with 10 items top_headstone_images: List with 10 items <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-a5812a41-ed7a-40f6-83d9-1b6a7ed578ac"> <button aria-controls="collapse-a5812a41-ed7a-40f6-83d9-1b6a7ed578ac" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-a5812a41-ed7a-40f6-83d9-1b6a7ed578ac" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Frozen Yogurt</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-a5812a41-ed7a-40f6-83d9-1b6a7ed578ac" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-a5812a41-ed7a-40f6-83d9-1b6a7ed578ac" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1994-2001</strong></p> <p>Vanilla frozen yogurt with gobs of chocolate chip cookie dough</p> <p><em>So now we know: ¬†our Dough Fro Yo<br/> Just wasn't as greate as expected.<br/> Folks who love Dough as well as Fro Yo<br/> Love 'em separate, not interconnected.</em></p> </div><img alt="Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Frozen Yogurt tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0003_graveyard_cccd_fro_yo.jpg" width="750"/></div> </div> </li><li class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-2d01794e-8670-4895-b570-649ca17f8481"> <button data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Chocolate Comfort</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-2d01794e-8670-4895-b570-649ca17f8481" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-2d01794e-8670-4895-b570-649ca17f8481" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1999-1999</strong></p> <p>Chocolate Truffle Low Fat Ice Cream swirled with White Chocolate Low Fat Ice Cream.</p> <p><em>It's curtains for the<br/> chocolate pair<br/> I ate alone in the comfy chair,<br/> One pint per night it might<br/> have been<br/> But 'twas low fat so it<br/> weren't no sin.</em></p> </div><img alt="Chocolate Comfort tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-3d314f75-5efb-4888-953f-47c16feb787c"> <button aria-controls="collapse-3d314f75-5efb-4888-953f-47c16feb787c" aria-expanded="false" <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2010-2011</strong></p> <p>Chocolate &amp; Vanilla Ice Creams with Chocolatey Covered Macadamia Nuts</p> <p><em>Nuts about chocolate<br/> Chocolate about nuts<br/> Swirled vanilla with chocolate<br/> Maybe too much?</em></p> </div><img alt="image-from-the-document-manager" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>2011-2012</strong></p> <p>Chocolate Ice Cream with Coconut Caramel Swirls &amp; a Chocolatey Covered Coconut Caramel Crunch</p> <p><em>Chocolate and coconut<br/> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1995-1998</strong></p> <p>Vanilla ice cream with strawberries and fudge covered shortbread</p> <p><em>A flavour so smashing -<br/> &amp; yet it fouled out:<br/> is<br/> beyond compare,<br/> So it may not be beaucoup<br/> too late to save<br/> Cr√®me Brulee from<br/> beyond the grave.</em></p> </div><img alt="Creme Brulee tombstone" class="" height="750" class="accordion-item"> <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-ece71f74-1251-487c-98b6-6b910b427cbe"> <button aria-controls="collapse-ece71f74-1251-487c-98b6-6b910b427cbe" </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-ece71f74-1251-487c-98b6-6b910b427cbe" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-ece71f74-1251-487c-98b6-6b910b427cbe" role="region"> <div <h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-49d6c88e-66b9-48e4-8b07-3f5bef44428e"> <button aria-controls="collapse-49d6c88e-66b9-48e4-8b07-3f5bef44428e" aria-expanded="false" aria-labelledby="accordion-item-49d6c88e-66b9-48e4-8b07-3f5bef44428e" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-49d6c88e-66b9-48e4-8b07-3f5bef44428e" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1997-1997</strong></p> <p>Fresh Pear Ice Cream with a hint of Almond and a Light Fudge Swirl</p> <p><em>Oh Pear, Oh Pear,<br/> A mixture of mirth<br/> All nannies did weep<br/> When you left of this earth.</em></p> </div><img alt="Oh Pear tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-494aaa0a-bbcd-40b1-a09d-bf130c28ec51"> <button aria-controls="collapse-494aaa0a-bbcd-40b1-a09d-bf130c28ec51" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-button collapsed" data-bs-target="#collapse-494aaa0a-bbcd-40b1-a09d-bf130c28ec51" data-bs-toggle="collapse" type="button"> Peanut Butter and Jelly</button> </h2> <div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-494aaa0a-bbcd-40b1-a09d-bf130c28ec51" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-494aaa0a-bbcd-40b1-a09d-bf130c28ec51" role="region"> <div class="accordion-body"> <div class="content-block"> <p><strong>1989-1990</strong></p> <p>Peanut Butter Ice Cream with Peanut Butter Bits and Strawberry Jelly Swirl</p> <p><em>An unbeatable duo!<br/> Yet somehow it managed<br/> To flop in a cone,<br/> So we stuck to the sammich.</em></p> </div><img alt="Peanut Butter and Jelly tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" class="banner-content"> <h2 class="heading heading-2">Tell us what flavor you'd like to see back!</h2> <div class="banner-body"><p>Tell us what flavor you'd like to see back and why and we will resurrect the most popular.</p> </div> <div class="banner-buttons"> <a class="btn btn-primary" href="/contact-us" target="_self" title="Contact Us">Resurrect a Flavor</a></div> </div> </article><div developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 5)
2025-08-11 07:46:32

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== EXTRACTING FLAVOR DATA FROM COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS ===\n") print("Objective: Use existing comprehensive analysis data to extract flavor names "keyword">and dates") print("Strategy: Parse the accordion content that was already identified "keyword">in previous analysis\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, let's safely inspect the comprehensive analysis file analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("=== STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE ===\n") "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_content = f.read() print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters") # Parse JSON safely "keyword">try: analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content) print("\nAnalysis file structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in analysis_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # Examine the top_flavor_divs structure safely "keyword">if &#x27;top_flavor_divs' "keyword">in analysis_data "keyword">and analysis_data['top_flavor_divs']: print(f"\nExamining top_flavor_divs structure:") # Look at the structure of the first div first_div = analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs'][0] print(f"First div keys: {list(first_div.keys())}") # The 'text' field should contain the actual flavor content "keyword">if &#x27;text' "keyword">in first_div: text_content = first_div[&#x27;text'] print(f"First div text length: {len(text_content):,} characters") print(f"Text preview: {text_content[:300]}...") # Check "keyword">if this contains the accordion content we need "keyword">if &#x27;accordion' "keyword">in text_content.lower(): print("‚úì Found accordion content "keyword">in the flavor divs!") "keyword">else: print("‚ö† No accordion content found "keyword">in first div text") print(f"\n=== STEP 2: EXTRACTING FLAVOR DATA FROM THE LARGE CONTENT SECTION ===\n") # The second largest div (7,640 chars) should contain the actual flavor data "keyword">if &#x27;top_flavor_divs' "keyword">in analysis_data "keyword">and len(analysis_data['top_flavor_divs']) >= 2: flavor_content_div = analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs'][1] # Second largest print(f"Analyzing flavor content div:") print(f" Classes: {flavor_content_div.get(&#x27;classes', '"keyword">None')}") print(f" ID: {flavor_content_div.get(&#x27;id', '"keyword">None')}") print(f" Text length: {flavor_content_div.get(&#x27;text_length', 0):,} characters") "keyword">if &#x27;text' "keyword">in flavor_content_div: flavor_text = flavor_content_div[&#x27;text'] print(f"\nExtracting flavors "keyword">from {len(flavor_text):,} characters of content...") # This text should contain all the flavor information # Let's parse it to extract individual flavors # Split by flavor names (look "keyword">for patterns like "Aloha Macadamia2001-2002") # First, let's find all the date patterns date_pattern = r&#x27;(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})' date_matches = re.finditer(date_pattern, flavor_text) print(f"\nFound date patterns "keyword">in the text:") extracted_flavors = [] # Find flavor names "keyword">and their associated date ranges lines = flavor_text.split(&#x27;\n') current_flavor = "keyword">None "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_clean = line.strip() # Skip empty lines "keyword">and very short lines "keyword">if len(line_clean) < 5: "keyword">continue # Look "keyword">for date patterns "keyword">in this line date_match = re.search(date_pattern, line_clean) "keyword">if date_match: start_year = int(date_match.group(1)) end_year = int(date_match.group(2)) # The flavor name should be the text before the date text_before_date = line_clean[:date_match.start()].strip() # Clean up the flavor name "keyword">if text_before_date "keyword">and len(text_before_date) < 100: # Reasonable flavor name length flavor_name = text_before_date # Look "keyword">for the description "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">in subsequent lines flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f" Found: {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") # If the above approach didn't work well, "keyword">try a different method "keyword">if len(extracted_flavors) < 10: # We should have many more flavors print(f"\nFirst approach found only {len(extracted_flavors)} flavors. Trying alternative parsing...") # Look "keyword">for flavor patterns using regex # Pattern: Flavor Name followed by year range flavor_pattern = r&#x27;([A-Za-z\s&\'!]+)(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})' flavor_matches = re.finditer(flavor_pattern, flavor_text) extracted_flavors = [] # Reset "keyword">for match "keyword">in flavor_matches: flavor_name = match.group(1).strip() start_year = int(match.group(2)) end_year = int(match.group(3)) # Clean up flavor name (remove common prefixes/suffixes) flavor_name = re.sub(r&#x27;^(Skip to|Search|Flavor Graveyard)', '', flavor_name).strip() "keyword">if len(flavor_name) > 3 "keyword">and len(flavor_name) < 50: # Reasonable length flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f" Found: {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") # Sort by earliest year to find the oldest "keyword">if extracted_flavors: extracted_flavors.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"\n=== STEP 3: OLDEST FLAVORS IDENTIFIED ===\n") print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}") print(f"\nTop 15 oldest flavors:") "keyword">for i, flavor "keyword">in enumerate(extracted_flavors[:15], 1): print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[&#x27;name']} ({flavor['date_range']}) - Started: {flavor['earliest_year']}") "keyword">if extracted_flavors: oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0] print(f"\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:") print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;date_range']}") print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n") # Look "keyword">for matching headstone image "keyword">if &#x27;top_headstone_images' "keyword">in analysis_data: headstone_images = analysis_data[&#x27;top_headstone_images'] print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}") # Try to match the oldest flavor name "keyword">with headstone images oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[&#x27;name'].lower() matching_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in headstone_images: img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '').lower() img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '').lower() # Check "keyword">if flavor name words appear "keyword">in image alt "keyword">or src flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split() matches = 0 "keyword">for word "keyword">in flavor_words: "keyword">if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words like '"keyword">and', 'the' "keyword">if word "keyword">in img_alt "keyword">or word "keyword">in img_src: matches += 1 "keyword">if matches > 0: img[&#x27;match_score'] = matches matching_images.append(img) "keyword">if matching_images: # Sort by match score matching_images.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;match_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) print(f"Found {len(matching_images)} potentially matching headstone images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(matching_images[:3], 1): print(f"\n{i}. Match score: {img.get(&#x27;match_score', 0)}") print(f" Alt text: {img.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')}") print(f" URL: {img.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") best_match = matching_images[0] print(f"\n‚úì BEST MATCHING HEADSTONE IMAGE:") print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')}") print(f" URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") # Save the results final_results = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'comprehensive_analysis_parsing', &#x27;total_flavors_extracted': len(extracted_flavors), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor, &#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image': best_match, &#x27;all_flavors_sorted_by_age': extracted_flavors[:20], # Top 20 oldest &#x27;next_steps': [ &#x27;Download the oldest flavor headstone image', &#x27;Analyze the image "keyword">for background headstones', &#x27;Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">from background headstone', &#x27;Identify the last line of the background headstone rhyme' ] } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_oldest_flavor_identified.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Final results saved to: {results_file}") print(f"\n=== OLDEST FLAVOR SUCCESSFULLY IDENTIFIED ===\n") print(f"üéØ READY FOR NEXT PHASE: Download "keyword">and analyze headstone image") print(f" Oldest flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']} ({oldest_flavor['date_range']})") print(f" Headstone image: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") print(f" Next: Download image "keyword">and examine background "keyword">for other headstones") "keyword">else: print(f"No matching headstone images found "keyword">for &#x27;{oldest_flavor['name']}'") print(f"Will need to examine all headstone images manually") "keyword">else: print(f"No flavors extracted "keyword">from the content. May need manual parsing.") "keyword">else: print(f"No text content found "keyword">in flavor content div") "keyword">else: print(f"Insufficient flavor divs found "keyword">in analysis data") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error parsing analysis JSON: {e}") "keyword">else: print(f"Comprehensive analysis file "keyword">not found: {analysis_file}") print(f"\n=== FLAVOR EXTRACTION FROM ANALYSIS DATA COMPLETE ===\n")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === EXTRACTING FLAVOR DATA FROM COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS === Objective: Use existing comprehensive analysis data to extract flavor names and dates Strategy: Parse the accordion content that was already identified in previous analysis === STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE === Analysis file size: 221,410 characters Analysis file structure: analysis_date: 2025-08-11T07:43:50.546110 source_file: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html page_title: Flavor Graveyard | Ben & Jerry‚Äôs content_stats: Dictionary with 5 keys containers_found: 9 flavor_divs_found: 40 total_images: 84 relevant_images: 43 flavors_with_dates: 2 top_flavor_divs: List with 10 items top_headstone_images: List with 10 items oldest_flavors_candidates: List with 2 items Examining top_flavor_divs structure: First div keys: ['element', 'text', 'classes', 'id', 'text_length'] First div text length: 203 characters Text preview: Flavor GraveyardEven the best Ben & Jerry‚Äôs flavors eventually melt away. Here we lay our dearly de-pinted to rest so we can mourn their chunks and swirls and keep their sweet memories alive.Flavor Gr...... ‚ö† No accordion content found in first div text === STEP 2: EXTRACTING FLAVOR DATA FROM THE LARGE CONTENT SECTION === Analyzing flavor content div: Classes: row grid-row ID: Text length: 7,640 characters Extracting flavors from 203 characters of content... Found date patterns in the text: Found: Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002) First approach found only 1 flavors. Trying alternative parsing... Found: Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002) === STEP 3: OLDEST FLAVORS IDENTIFIED === Total flavors extracted: 1 Top 15 oldest flavors: 1. Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002) - Started: 2001 üéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED: Name: Aloha Macadamia Date Range: 2001-2002 Started: 2001 === STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR === Available headstone images: 10 Found 2 potentially matching headstone images: 1. Match score: 2 Alt text: Aloha Macadamia tombstone URL: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0039_graveyard_aloha_macadamia.jpg 2. Match score: 1 Alt text: image-from-the-document-manager URL: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_graveyard_choc_macadamia.jpg ‚úì BEST MATCHING HEADSTONE IMAGE: Flavor: Aloha Macadamia Alt text: Aloha Macadamia tombstone URL: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0039_graveyard_aloha_macadamia.jpg ‚úì Final results saved to: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_oldest_flavor_identified.json === OLDEST FLAVOR SUCCESSFULLY IDENTIFIED === üéØ READY FOR NEXT PHASE: Download and analyze headstone image Oldest flavor: Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002) Headstone image: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0039_graveyard_aloha_macadamia.jpg Next: Download image and examine background for other headstones === FLAVOR EXTRACTION FROM ANALYSIS DATA COMPLETE ===
tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 07:46:32

Partial success - Code executed without errors and successfully identified the oldest Ben & Jerry's flavor as 'Aloha Macadamia' (2001-2002), but this appears to be incorrect. The analysis extracted only 1 flavor from the comprehensive data, which suggests the parsing logic missed many older flavors that should be in the graveyard (flavors from the 1980s-1990s). However, the code did successfully match the identified flavor with its headstone image URL and saved results to workspace/ben_jerrys_oldest_flavor_identified.json. **PLAN** alignment: 60% - we have a flavor and headstone image identified, but likely not the truly oldest flavor. The output shows 'Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002)' was found, but the graveyard should contain much older discontinued flavors. Next step: The comprehensive analysis data shows there are many more flavors in the accordion content that weren't properly parsed. Need to examine the full accordion text content more thoroughly to extract all flavor names and dates, then correctly identify the true oldest flavor from the 1980s era before proceeding to download and analyze its headstone image for background details.

Find flavor names "keyword">and their associated date ranges lines = flavor_text.split(&#x27;\n') current_flavor = "keyword">None "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_clean = line.strip() # Skip empty lines "keyword">and very short lines "keyword">if len(line_clean) < 5: "keyword">continue # Reasonable flavor name length flavor_name = text_before_date # Look "keyword">for the description "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">in subsequent lines flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f" Found: {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") # If the above approach didn't work well, "keyword">try a different method "keyword">if len(extracted_flavors) < 10: # We should have many more flavors print(f"\nFirst approach found only {len(extracted_flavors)} flavors. Trying alternative parsing...") # Look "keyword">for flavor patterns using regex # Pattern: Flavor Name followed by year range flavor_pattern = r&#x27;([A-Za-z\s&\'!]+)(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})' flavor_matches = re.finditer(flavor_pattern, flavor_text) extracted_flavors = [] # Reset "keyword">for match "keyword">in flavor_matches: flavor_name = match.group(1).strip() start_year = int(match.group(2)) end_year = int(match.group(3)) # Clean up flavor name (remove common prefixes/suffixes) flavor_name = re.sub(r&#x27;^(Skip to|Search|Flavor Graveyard)', '', flavor_name).strip() "keyword">if len(flavor_name) > 3 "keyword">and len(flavor_name) < 50: # Reasonable length flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f" Found: {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") # Sort by earliest year to find the oldest "keyword">if extracted_flavors: extracted_flavors.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"\n=== STEP 3: OLDEST FLAVORS IDENTIFIED ===\n") print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}") print(f"\nTop 15 oldest flavors:") "keyword">for i, flavor "keyword">in enumerate(extracted_flavors[:15], 1): print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[&#x27;name']} ({flavor['date_range']}) - Match score: {img.get(&#x27;match_score', 0)}") print(f" Alt text: {img.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')}") print(f" URL: {img.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") best_match = matching_images[0] print(f"\n‚úì BEST MATCHING HEADSTONE IMAGE:") print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')}") print(f" URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") # Save the results final_results = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'comprehensive_analysis_parsing', &#x27;total_flavors_extracted': len(extracted_flavors), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor, &#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image': best_match, &#x27;all_flavors_sorted_by_age': extracted_flavors[:20], # Top 20 oldest &#x27;next_steps': [ &#x27;Download the oldest flavor headstone image', &#x27;Analyze the image "keyword">for background headstones', &#x27;Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">from background headstone', &#x27;Identify the last line of the background headstone rhyme' ] } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_oldest_flavor_identified.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Final results saved to: {results_file}") print(f"\n=== OLDEST FLAVOR SUCCESSFULLY IDENTIFIED ===\n") print(f"üéØ READY FOR NEXT PHASE: Download "keyword">and analyze headstone image") print(f" Oldest flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']} ({oldest_flavor['date_range']})") print(f" Headstone image: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") print(f" Next: Download image "keyword">and examine background "keyword">for other headstones") "keyword">else: print(f"No matching headstone images found "keyword">for &#x27;{oldest_flavor['name']}'") print(f"Will need to examine all headstone images manually") "keyword">else: print(f"No flavors extracted "keyword">from the content. May need manual parsing.") "keyword">else: print(f"No text content found "keyword">in flavor content div") "keyword">else: print(f"Insufficient flavor divs found "keyword">in analysis data") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error parsing analysis JSON: {e}") "keyword">else: print(f"Comprehensive analysis file "keyword">not found: {analysis_file}") print(f"\n=== FLAVOR EXTRACTION FROM ANALYSIS DATA COMPLETE ===\n")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === EXTRACTING FLAVOR DATA FROM COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS === Objective: Use existing comprehensive analysis data to extract flavor names and dates Strategy: Parse the accordion content that was already identified in previous analysis === STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE === Analysis file size: 221,410 characters Analysis file structure: analysis_date: 2025-08-11T07:43:50.546110 source_file: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html page_title: Flavor Graveyard | Ben & Jerry‚Äôs content_stats: Dictionary with 5 keys containers_found: 9 flavor_divs_found: 40 total_images: 84 relevant_images: 43 flavors_with_dates: 2 top_flavor_divs: List with 10 items top_headstone_images: List with 10 items oldest_flavors_candidates: List with 2 items Examining top_flavor_divs structure: First div keys: ['element', 'text', 'classes', 'id', 'text_length'] First div text length: 203 characters Text preview: Flavor GraveyardEven the best Ben & Jerry‚Äôs flavors eventually melt away. Here we lay our dearly de-pinted to rest so we can mourn their chunks and swirls and keep their sweet memories alive.Flavor Gr...... ‚ö† No accordion content found in first div text === STEP 2: EXTRACTING FLAVOR DATA FROM THE LARGE CONTENT SECTION === Analyzing flavor content div: Classes: row grid-row ID: Text length: 7,640 characters Extracting flavors from 203 characters of content... developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 6)
2025-08-11 07:47:34

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== EXTRACTING ALL FLAVORS FROM ACCORDION HTML CONTENT ===\n") print("Objective: Parse the full accordion HTML structure to extract all flavor names "keyword">and dates") print("Strategy: Use the comprehensive analysis data but access the full HTML content directly\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, inspect the comprehensive analysis file structure safely analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("=== STEP 1: INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS STRUCTURE ===\n") "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_content = f.read() print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters") "keyword">try: analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content) # Safely inspect the structure print("\nAnalysis file structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in analysis_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # Look at the top_flavor_divs structure safely "keyword">if &#x27;top_flavor_divs' "keyword">in analysis_data "keyword">and analysis_data['top_flavor_divs']: print(f"\nExamining top_flavor_divs:") "keyword">for i, div "keyword">in enumerate(analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs'][:5], 1): # First 5 divs print(f"\nDiv {i}:") "keyword">if &#x27;classes' "keyword">in div: print(f" Classes: {div[&#x27;classes']}") "keyword">if &#x27;text_length' "keyword">in div: print(f" Text length: {div[&#x27;text_length']:,} characters") "keyword">if &#x27;text' "keyword">in div: text_preview = div[&#x27;text'][:200] + "..." "keyword">if len(div['text']) > 200 "keyword">else div['text'] print(f" Text preview: {text_preview}") # Check "keyword">if this div contains accordion data "keyword">if &#x27;accordion' "keyword">in div['text'].lower(): print(f" *** CONTAINS ACCORDION CONTENT ***") # This "keyword">is likely the div "keyword">with all the flavor data full_accordion_text = div[&#x27;text'] print(f"\n=== STEP 2: PARSING ACCORDION CONTENT FOR ALL FLAVORS ===\n") print(f"Parsing {len(full_accordion_text):,} characters of accordion content...") # Parse the accordion content using BeautifulSoup to handle HTML structure soup = BeautifulSoup(full_accordion_text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for accordion items (li elements "keyword">with accordion-item "keyword">class) accordion_items = soup.find_all(&#x27;li', class_='accordion-item') print(f"Found {len(accordion_items)} accordion items") extracted_flavors = [] "keyword">for item_idx, item "keyword">in enumerate(accordion_items, 1): # Extract flavor name "keyword">from the button text button = item.find(&#x27;button', class_='accordion-button') flavor_name = button.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if button "keyword">else f"Unknown Flavor {item_idx}" # Extract content "keyword">from the accordion body accordion_body = item.find(&#x27;div', class_='accordion-body') "keyword">if accordion_body: body_text = accordion_body.get_text(strip="keyword">True) # Look "keyword">for date ranges "keyword">in the body text date_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})', # 1979-1991 r&#x27;(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})', # 1979 - 1991 ] dates_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, body_text) dates_found.extend(matches) "keyword">if dates_found: # Use the first date range found start_year, end_year = dates_found[0] start_year, end_year = int(start_year), int(end_year) # Extract the rhyme (text "keyword">in italic/em tags) rhyme_elements = accordion_body.find_all(&#x27;em') rhyme_lines = [] "keyword">for em "keyword">in rhyme_elements: rhyme_text = em.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if rhyme_text: # Split by line breaks "keyword">and clean up lines = [line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in rhyme_text.split(&#x27;\n') "keyword">if line.strip()] rhyme_lines.extend(lines) flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year, &#x27;rhyme_lines': rhyme_lines, &#x27;body_text_preview': body_text[:200] + '...' "keyword">if len(body_text) > 200 "keyword">else body_text } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") "keyword">if rhyme_lines: print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(rhyme_lines)}") "keyword">if rhyme_lines: print(f" Last line: {rhyme_lines[-1]}") "keyword">else: print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No date range found") "keyword">else: print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No accordion body found") # Sort by earliest year to find the true oldest flavor "keyword">if extracted_flavors: extracted_flavors.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"\n=== STEP 3: OLDEST FLAVORS IDENTIFIED ===\n") print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}") print(f"\nTop 15 oldest flavors:") "keyword">for i, flavor "keyword">in enumerate(extracted_flavors[:15], 1): print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[&#x27;name']} ({flavor['date_range']}) - Started: {flavor['earliest_year']}") "keyword">if flavor.get(&#x27;rhyme_lines'): print(f" Rhyme last line: {flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'][-1]}") # Identify the true oldest flavor oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0] print(f"\nüéØ TRUE OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:") print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;date_range']}") print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']}") "keyword">if oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;rhyme_lines'): print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'])}") print(f" Last rhyme line: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'][-1]}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n") # Find matching headstone image "keyword">if &#x27;top_headstone_images' "keyword">in analysis_data: headstone_images = analysis_data[&#x27;top_headstone_images'] print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}") # Match the oldest flavor "keyword">with its headstone image oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[&#x27;name'].lower() matching_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in headstone_images: img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '').lower() img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '').lower() # Check "keyword">for exact matches "keyword">or word matches flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split() matches = 0 "keyword">for word "keyword">in flavor_words: "keyword">if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words "keyword">if word "keyword">in img_alt "keyword">or word "keyword">in img_src: matches += 1 "keyword">if matches > 0: img[&#x27;match_score'] = matches matching_images.append(img) "keyword">if matching_images: # Sort by match score matching_images.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;match_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) best_match = matching_images[0] print(f"\n‚úì BEST MATCHING HEADSTONE IMAGE:") print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')}") print(f" URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") # Save comprehensive results final_results = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'accordion_html_parsing', &#x27;total_flavors_extracted': len(extracted_flavors), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor, &#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image': best_match, &#x27;all_flavors_sorted_by_age': extracted_flavors, &#x27;next_steps': [ f&#x27;Download the oldest flavor headstone image: {best_match.get("src", "No URL")}', &#x27;Analyze the headstone photo "keyword">for background headstones', &#x27;Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">from background headstone', &#x27;Identify the last line of the background headstone rhyme' ] } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_complete_flavor_extraction.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Complete extraction results saved to: {results_file}") print(f"\n=== TRUE OLDEST FLAVOR SUCCESSFULLY IDENTIFIED ===\n") print(f"üéØ READY FOR HEADSTONE IMAGE ANALYSIS:") print(f" Oldest flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']} ({oldest_flavor['date_range']})") print(f" Headstone URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") print(f" Next: Download image "keyword">and examine background "keyword">for other headstones") "keyword">break # Found the accordion content, exit the loop "keyword">else: print(f"No matching headstone images found "keyword">for &#x27;{oldest_flavor['name']}'") "keyword">else: print(f"No flavors extracted "keyword">from accordion content") "keyword">else: print(f"No top_flavor_divs found "keyword">in analysis data") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error parsing analysis JSON: {e}") "keyword">else: print(f"Comprehensive analysis file "keyword">not found: {analysis_file}") print(f"\n=== COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION FINISHED ===\n")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === EXTRACTING ALL FLAVORS FROM ACCORDION HTML CONTENT === Objective: Parse the full accordion HTML structure to extract all flavor names and dates Strategy: Use the comprehensive analysis data but access the full HTML content directly === STEP 1: INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS STRUCTURE === Analysis file size: 221,410 characters Analysis file structure: analysis_date: 2025-08-11T07:43:50.546110 source_file: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html page_title: Flavor Graveyard | Ben & Jerry‚Äôs content_stats: Dictionary with 5 keys containers_found: 9 flavor_divs_found: 40 total_images: 84 relevant_images: 43 flavors_with_dates: 2 top_flavor_divs: List with 10 items top_headstone_images: List with 10 items oldest_flavors_candidates: List with 2 items Examining top_flavor_divs: Div 1: Classes: container-fluid Text length: 8,113 characters Text preview: Flavor GraveyardEven the best Ben & Jerry‚Äôs flavors eventually melt away. Here we lay our dearly de-pinted to rest so we can mourn their chunks and swirls and keep their sweet memories alive.Flavor Gr... tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 07:47:34

Partial success - Code executed without errors and successfully extracted flavor data from the comprehensive analysis file. The code correctly identified that the large flavor content section contains accordion data and attempted to parse flavor names and dates. However, there's a critical data access issue: the code is reading from the wrong div index - it's accessing the first div (203 characters) instead of the larger accordion section that contains the complete flavor data. The output shows only 1 flavor extracted (Aloha Macadamia 2001-2002) when there should be dozens of flavors from the 1980s-1990s era. **PLAN** alignment: 30% - we have the parsing logic and headstone matching working, but we're not accessing the full flavor dataset. The comprehensive analysis shows there are 40 flavor divs and the accordion section should contain all the discontinued flavors. Recommended fix: Access the correct div index that contains the full 7,640-character accordion content with all flavor names and dates, then the existing parsing logic should extract the complete list of flavors and correctly identify the true oldest flavor from the graveyard.

Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, inspect the comprehensive analysis file structure safely analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("=== STEP 1: INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS STRUCTURE ===\n") "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_content = f.read() print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters") "keyword">try: analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content) #
