"keyword">if len(div['text']) > 200 "keyword">else div['text'] print(f" Text preview: {text_preview}") # Check "keyword">if this div contains accordion data "keyword">if &#x27;accordion' "keyword">in div['text'].lower(): print(f" *** CONTAINS ACCORDION CONTENT ***") # This "keyword">is likely the div "keyword">with all the flavor data full_accordion_text = div[&#x27;text'] print(f"\n=== STEP 2: PARSING ACCORDION CONTENT FOR ALL FLAVORS ===\n") print(f"Parsing {len(full_accordion_text):,} characters of accordion content...") # Parse the accordion content using BeautifulSoup to handle HTML structure soup = BeautifulSoup(full_accordion_text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for accordion items (li elements "keyword">with accordion-item "keyword">class) accordion_items = soup.find_all(&#x27;li', class_='accordion-item') print(f"Found {len(accordion_items)} accordion items") extracted_flavors = [] "keyword">for item_idx, item "keyword">in enumerate(accordion_items, 1): # Extract flavor name "keyword">from the button text button = item.find(&#x27;button', class_='accordion-button') flavor_name = button.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if button "keyword">else f"Unknown Flavor {item_idx}" # Extract content "keyword">from the accordion body accordion_body = item.find(&#x27;div', class_='accordion-body') "keyword">if accordion_body: body_text = accordion_body.get_text(strip="keyword">True) # Look "keyword">for date ranges "keyword">in the body text date_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})', # 1979-1991 r&#x27;(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})', # 1979 - 1991 ] dates_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, body_text) dates_found.extend(matches) "keyword">if dates_found: # Use the first date range found start_year, end_year = dates_found[0] start_year, end_year = int(start_year), int(end_year) # Extract the rhyme (text "keyword">in italic/em tags) rhyme_elements = accordion_body.find_all(&#x27;em') rhyme_lines = [] "keyword">for em "keyword">in rhyme_elements: rhyme_text = em.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if rhyme_text: # Split by line breaks "keyword">and clean up lines = [line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in rhyme_text.split(&#x27;\n') "keyword">if line.strip()] rhyme_lines.extend(lines) flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year, &#x27;rhyme_lines': rhyme_lines, &#x27;body_text_preview': body_text[:200] + '...' "keyword">if len(body_text) > 200 "keyword">else body_text } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") "keyword">if rhyme_lines: print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(rhyme_lines)}") "keyword">if rhyme_lines: print(f" Last line: {rhyme_lines[-1]}") "keyword">else: print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No date range found") "keyword">else: print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No accordion body found") # Sort by earliest year to find the true oldest flavor "keyword">if extracted_flavors: extracted_flavors.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"\n=== STEP 3: OLDEST FLAVORS IDENTIFIED ===\n") print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}") print(f"\nTop 15 oldest flavors:") "keyword">for i, flavor "keyword">in enumerate(extracted_flavors[:15], 1): print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[&#x27;name']} ({flavor['date_range']}) - Started: {flavor['earliest_year']}") "keyword">if flavor.get(&#x27;rhyme_lines'): print(f" Rhyme last line: {flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'][-1]}") # Identify the true oldest flavor oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0] print(f"\nüéØ TRUE OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:") print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;date_range']}") print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']}") "keyword">if oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;rhyme_lines'): print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'])}") print(f" Last rhyme line: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'][-1]}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n") # Find matching headstone image "keyword">if &#x27;top_headstone_images' "keyword">in analysis_data: headstone_images = analysis_data[&#x27;top_headstone_images'] print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}") # Match the oldest flavor "keyword">with its headstone image oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[&#x27;name'].lower() matching_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in headstone_images: img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '').lower() img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '').lower() # Check "keyword">for exact matches "keyword">or word matches flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split() matches = 0 "keyword">for word "keyword">in flavor_words: "keyword">if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words "keyword">if word "keyword">in img_alt "keyword">or word "keyword">in img_src: matches += 1 "keyword">if matches > 0: img[&#x27;match_score'] = matches matching_images.append(img) "keyword">if matching_images: # Sort by match score matching_images.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;match_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) best_match = matching_images[0] print(f"\n‚úì BEST MATCHING HEADSTONE IMAGE:") print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')}") print(f" URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") # Save comprehensive results final_results = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'accordion_html_parsing', &#x27;total_flavors_extracted': len(extracted_flavors), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor, &#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image': best_match, &#x27;all_flavors_sorted_by_age': extracted_flavors, &#x27;next_steps': [ f&#x27;Download the oldest flavor headstone image: {best_match.get("src", "No URL")}', &#x27;Analyze the headstone photo "keyword">for background headstones', &#x27;Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">from background headstone', &#x27;Identify the last line of the background headstone rhyme' ] } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_complete_flavor_extraction.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Complete extraction results saved to: {results_file}") print(f"\n=== TRUE OLDEST FLAVOR SUCCESSFULLY IDENTIFIED ===\n") print(f"üéØ READY FOR HEADSTONE IMAGE ANALYSIS:") print(f" Oldest flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']} ({oldest_flavor['date_range']})") print(f" Headstone URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") print(f" Next: Download image "keyword">and examine background "keyword">for other headstones") "keyword">break # Found the accordion content, exit the loop "keyword">else: print(f"No matching headstone images found "keyword">for &#x27;{oldest_flavor['name']}'") "keyword">else: print(f"No flavors extracted "keyword">from accordion content") "keyword">else: print(f"No top_flavor_divs found "keyword">in analysis data") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error parsing analysis JSON: {e}") "keyword">else: print(f"Comprehensive analysis file "keyword">not found: {analysis_file}") print(f"\n=== COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION FINISHED ===\n")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === EXTRACTING ALL FLAVORS FROM ACCORDION HTML CONTENT === Objective: Parse the full accordion HTML structure to extract all flavor names and dates Strategy: Use the comprehensive analysis data but access the full HTML content directly === STEP 1: INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS STRUCTURE === Analysis file size: 221,410 characters Analysis file structure: analysis_date: 2025-08-11T07:43:50.546110 source_file: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html page_title: Flavor Graveyard | Ben & Jerry‚Äôs content_stats: Dictionary with 5 keys containers_found: 9 flavor_divs_found: 40 total_images: 84 relevant_images: 43 flavors_with_dates: 2 top_flavor_divs: List with 10 items top_headstone_images: List with 10 items oldest_flavors_candidates: List with 2 items Examining top_flavor_divs: Div 1: Classes: container-fluid Text length: 8,113 characters Text preview: Flavor GraveyardEven the best Ben & Jerry‚Äôs flavors eventually melt away. Here we lay our dearly de-pinted to rest so we can mourn their chunks and swirls and keep their sweet memories alive.Flavor Gr... Div 2: Classes: row grid-row Text length: 7,640 characters Text preview: Aloha Macadamia2001-2002Rich milk chocolate cashew Brazil-nut butter ice cream with macadamia nuts covered in white & dark fudge & milk chocolatey swirl.We won't blame the macadamiaBut we were kinda i... developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 7)
2025-08-11 07:48:46

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== ACCESSING THE CORRECT ACCORDION CONTENT FOR COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION ===\n") print("Objective: Access the correct div "keyword">with accordion "keyword">class to extract all flavors") print("Strategy: Target the div "keyword">with &#x27;accordion' "keyword">class that contains the full flavor data\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, safely inspect the comprehensive analysis file structure analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("=== STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE ===\n") "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_content = f.read() print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters") "keyword">try: analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content) # Safely check structure print("\nAnalysis file keys:") "keyword">for key "keyword">in analysis_data.keys(): print(f" {key}") # Safely examine top_flavor_divs "keyword">if &#x27;top_flavor_divs' "keyword">in analysis_data "keyword">and isinstance(analysis_data['top_flavor_divs'], list): print(f"\nFound {len(analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs'])} flavor divs") # Look "keyword">for the div "keyword">with accordion "keyword">class (should be div 4 based on previous output) accordion_div = "keyword">None accordion_div_index = "keyword">None "keyword">for i, div "keyword">in enumerate(analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs']): "keyword">if isinstance(div, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;classes' "keyword">in div: print(f"\nDiv {i+1}:") print(f" Classes: {div[&#x27;classes']}") "keyword">if &#x27;text_length' "keyword">in div: print(f" Text length: {div[&#x27;text_length']:,} characters") # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is the accordion div "keyword">if &#x27;accordion' "keyword">in div['classes']: print(f" *** FOUND ACCORDION DIV ***") accordion_div = div accordion_div_index = i "keyword">break "keyword">if accordion_div "keyword">and &#x27;text' "keyword">in accordion_div: print(f"\n=== STEP 2: PARSING ACCORDION CONTENT FOR ALL FLAVORS ===\n") accordion_text = accordion_div[&#x27;text'] print(f"Accordion text length: {len(accordion_text):,} characters") print(f"Text preview: {accordion_text[:300]}...") # Parse the accordion HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(accordion_text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for accordion items accordion_items = soup.find_all(&#x27;li', class_='accordion-item') print(f"\nFound {len(accordion_items)} accordion items") "keyword">if len(accordion_items) == 0: # If no li elements found, "keyword">try different approach print("No li accordion-item elements found. Trying alternative parsing...") # Look "keyword">for any elements "keyword">with accordion-related classes all_accordion_elements = soup.find_all(attrs={&#x27;"keyword">class': re.compile('accordion')}) print(f"Found {len(all_accordion_elements)} elements "keyword">with accordion classes") # Try to extract flavor data "keyword">from text patterns # Look "keyword">for flavor name + date pattern flavor_pattern = r&#x27;([A-Za-z\s&\'!]+?)(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})' matches = re.findall(flavor_pattern, accordion_text) print(f"Found {len(matches)} flavor name + date patterns") extracted_flavors = [] "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: flavor_name = match[0].strip() start_year = int(match[1]) end_year = int(match[2]) # Clean up flavor name flavor_name = re.sub(r&#x27;^(Skip to|Search|Flavor Graveyard)', '', flavor_name).strip() # Filter out invalid names "keyword">if len(flavor_name) > 3 "keyword">and len(flavor_name) < 50 "keyword">and "keyword">not any(skip "keyword">in flavor_name.lower() "keyword">for skip "keyword">in [&#x27;skip', 'search', 'suggestions', 'ice cream flavors']): flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f" Extracted: {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") "keyword">else: # Process accordion items normally extracted_flavors = [] "keyword">for item_idx, item "keyword">in enumerate(accordion_items, 1): # Extract flavor name "keyword">from button button = item.find(&#x27;button', class_='accordion-button') flavor_name = button.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if button "keyword">else f"Unknown Flavor {item_idx}" # Extract content "keyword">from accordion body accordion_body = item.find(&#x27;div', class_='accordion-body') "keyword">if accordion_body: body_text = accordion_body.get_text(strip="keyword">True) # Look "keyword">for date ranges date_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})', # 1979-1991 r&#x27;(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})', # 1979 - 1991 ] dates_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, body_text) dates_found.extend(matches) "keyword">if dates_found: start_year, end_year = dates_found[0] start_year, end_year = int(start_year), int(end_year) # Extract rhyme lines "keyword">from em tags rhyme_elements = accordion_body.find_all(&#x27;em') rhyme_lines = [] "keyword">for em "keyword">in rhyme_elements: rhyme_text = em.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if rhyme_text: lines = [line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in rhyme_text.split(&#x27;\n') "keyword">if line.strip()] rhyme_lines.extend(lines) flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year, &#x27;rhyme_lines': rhyme_lines } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") "keyword">if rhyme_lines: print(f" Last rhyme line: {rhyme_lines[-1]}") # Sort by earliest year to find the oldest "keyword">if extracted_flavors: extracted_flavors.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"\n=== STEP 3: COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}") print(f"\nAll flavors sorted by earliest year:") "keyword">for i, flavor "keyword">in enumerate(extracted_flavors, 1): print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[&#x27;name']} ({flavor['date_range']}) - Started: {flavor['earliest_year']}") "keyword">if flavor.get(&#x27;rhyme_lines'): print(f" Last rhyme line: {flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'][-1]}") # Identify the true oldest flavor oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0] print(f"\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IN BEN & JERRY&#x27;S GRAVEYARD:") print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;date_range']}") print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']}") "keyword">if oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;rhyme_lines'): print(f" Total rhyme lines: {len(oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'])}") print(f" Last rhyme line: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'][-1]}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n") # Find matching headstone image "keyword">if &#x27;top_headstone_images' "keyword">in analysis_data "keyword">and isinstance(analysis_data['top_headstone_images'], list): headstone_images = analysis_data[&#x27;top_headstone_images'] print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}") # Match the oldest flavor "keyword">with its headstone oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[&#x27;name'].lower() matching_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in headstone_images: "keyword">if isinstance(img, dict): img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '').lower() img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '').lower() # Check "keyword">for word matches flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split() matches = 0 "keyword">for word "keyword">in flavor_words: "keyword">if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words "keyword">if word "keyword">in img_alt "keyword">or word "keyword">in img_src: matches += 1 "keyword">if matches > 0: img_copy = img.copy() img_copy[&#x27;match_score'] = matches matching_images.append(img_copy) "keyword">if matching_images: # Sort by match score matching_images.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;match_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) best_match = matching_images[0] print(f"\n‚úì OLDEST FLAVOR HEADSTONE IMAGE FOUND:") print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')}") print(f" URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") print(f" Match score: {best_match.get(&#x27;match_score', 0)}") # Save comprehensive results final_results = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'correct_accordion_div_parsing', &#x27;total_flavors_extracted': len(extracted_flavors), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor, &#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image': best_match, &#x27;all_flavors_sorted_by_age': extracted_flavors, &#x27;plan_status': { &#x27;oldest_flavor_identified': "keyword">True, &#x27;headstone_image_located': "keyword">True, &#x27;next_step': 'Download "keyword">and analyze headstone image "keyword">for background details' } } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_final_oldest_flavor_results.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Final results saved to: {results_file}") print(f"\n=== PLAN PHASE 1 COMPLETE: OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED ===\n") print(f"üéØ OLDEST BEN & JERRY&#x27;S FLAVOR: {oldest_flavor['name']} ({oldest_flavor['date_range']})") print(f"üì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") print(f"\nüìã NEXT STEPS FOR PLAN COMPLETION:") print(f" 1. Download the oldest flavor&#x27;s headstone image") print(f" 2. Analyze the photo to locate background headstones") print(f" 3. Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">from background headstone") print(f" 4. Identify the last line of the background headstone&#x27;s rhyme") "keyword">else: print(f"No matching headstone images found "keyword">for &#x27;{oldest_flavor['name']}'") "keyword">else: print(f"No headstone images available "keyword">in analysis data") "keyword">else: print(f"No flavors extracted "keyword">from accordion content") "keyword">else: print(f"\nNo accordion div found "keyword">or no text content available") print(f"Available divs:") "keyword">for i, div "keyword">in enumerate(analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs'][:5]): "keyword">if isinstance(div, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;classes' "keyword">in div: print(f" Div {i+1}: {div[&#x27;classes']} ({div.get('text_length', 0):,} chars)") "keyword">else: print(f"No top_flavor_divs found "keyword">in analysis data") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error parsing analysis JSON: {e}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error processing analysis data: {e}") "keyword">import traceback traceback.print_exc() "keyword">else: print(f"Comprehensive analysis file "keyword">not found: {analysis_file}") print(f"\n=== COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION PROCESS FINISHED ===\n")
üìÑ Output

tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 07:48:46

Execution partially successful - The code ran without errors and successfully identified the correct accordion content structure. It found the div with 'accordion' class containing 7,640 characters of flavor data, but the flavor extraction failed because it only extracted 1 flavor (Aloha Macadamia 2001-2002) from what appears to be truncated text content (203 characters instead of the full 7,640 characters). The parsing logic is sound - it correctly uses BeautifulSoup to find accordion items and extract flavor names, dates, and rhyme lines - but it's not accessing the complete accordion HTML content. **PLAN** alignment: 40% - we have the right approach and found the accordion structure, but didn't extract all flavors to identify the true oldest one. The output shows the code found the accordion div but the text content was only 203 characters, suggesting a data access issue. Next step: The comprehensive analysis file structure shows there are multiple divs with the same 7,640-character length - need to access the correct div that contains the full HTML accordion structure with all flavor data, then the existing parsing logic should successfully extract all flavors and identify the genuinely oldest discontinued flavor from the 1980s era.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== ACCESSING THE CORRECT ACCORDION CONTENT FOR COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION ===\n") print("Objective: Access the correct div "keyword">with accordion "keyword">class to extract all flavors") print("Strategy: Target the div "keyword">with &#x27;accordion' "keyword">class that contains the full flavor data\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, safely inspect the comprehensive analysis file structure analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("=== STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE ===\n") "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_content = f.read() print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters") "keyword">try: analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content) # Safely check structure print("\nAnalysis file keys:") "keyword">for key "keyword">in analysis_data.keys(): print(f" {key}") # Safely examine top_flavor_divs "keyword">if &#x27;top_flavor_divs' "keyword">in analysis_data "keyword">and isinstance(analysis_data['top_flavor_divs'], list): print(f"\nFound {len(analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs'])} flavor divs") # Look "keyword">for the div "keyword">with accordion "keyword">class (should be div 4 based on previous output) accordion_div = "keyword">None accordion_div_index = "keyword">None "keyword">for i, div "keyword">in enumerate(analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs']): "keyword">if isinstance(div, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;classes' "keyword">in div: print(f"\nDiv {i+1}:") print(f" Classes: {div[&#x27;classes']}") "keyword">if &#x27;text_length' "keyword">in div: print(f" Text length: {div[&#x27;text_length']:,} characters") # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is the accordion div "keyword">if &#x27;accordion' "keyword">in div['classes']: print(f" *** FOUND ACCORDION DIV ***") accordion_div = div accordion_div_index = i "keyword">break "keyword">if accordion_div "keyword">and &#x27;text' "keyword">in accordion_div: print(f"\n=== STEP 2: PARSING ACCORDION CONTENT FOR ALL FLAVORS ===\n") accordion_text = accordion_div[&#x27;text'] print(f"Accordion text length: {len(accordion_text):,} characters") print(f"Text preview: {accordion_text[:300]}...") # Parse the accordion HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(accordion_text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for accordion items accordion_items = soup.find_all(&#x27;li', class_='accordion-item') print(f"\nFound {len(accordion_items)} accordion items") "keyword">if len(accordion_items) == 0: # If no li elements found, "keyword">try different approach print("No li accordion-item elements found. Trying alternative parsing...") # Look "keyword">for any elements "keyword">with accordion-related classes all_accordion_elements = soup.find_all(attrs={&#x27;"keyword">class': re.compile('accordion')}) print(f"Found {len(all_accordion_elements)} elements "keyword">with accordion classes") # Try to extract flavor data "keyword">from text patterns # Look "keyword">for flavor name + date pattern flavor_pattern = r&#x27;([A-Za-z\s&\'!]+?)(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})' matches = re.findall(flavor_pattern, accordion_text) print(f"Found {len(matches)} flavor name + date patterns") extracted_flavors = [] "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: flavor_name = match[0].strip() start_year = int(match[1]) end_year = int(match[2]) # Clean up flavor name flavor_name = re.sub(r&#x27;^(Skip to|Search|Flavor Graveyard)', '', flavor_name).strip() # Filter out invalid names "keyword">if len(flavor_name) > 3 "keyword">and len(flavor_name) < 50 "keyword">and "keyword">not any(skip "keyword">in flavor_name.lower() "keyword">for skip "keyword">in [&#x27;skip', 'search', 'suggestions', 'ice cream flavors']): flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f" Extracted: {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") "keyword">else: # Process accordion items normally extracted_flavors = [] "keyword">for item_idx, item "keyword">in enumerate(accordion_items, 1): # Extract flavor name "keyword">from button button = item.find(&#x27;button', class_='accordion-button') flavor_name = button.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if button "keyword">else f"Unknown Flavor {item_idx}" # Extract content "keyword">from accordion body accordion_body = item.find(&#x27;div', class_='accordion-body') "keyword">if accordion_body: body_text = accordion_body.get_text(strip="keyword">True) # Look "keyword">for date ranges date_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})', # 1979-1991 r&#x27;(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})', # 1979 - 1991 ] dates_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, body_text) dates_found.extend(matches) "keyword">if dates_found: start_year, end_year = dates_found[0] start_year, end_year = int(start_year), int(end_year) # Extract rhyme lines "keyword">from em tags rhyme_elements = accordion_body.find_all(&#x27;em') rhyme_lines = [] "keyword">for em "keyword">in rhyme_elements: rhyme_text = em.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if rhyme_text: lines = [line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in rhyme_text.split(&#x27;\n') "keyword">if line.strip()] rhyme_lines.extend(lines) flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year, &#x27;rhyme_lines': rhyme_lines } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") "keyword">if rhyme_lines: print(f" Last rhyme line: {rhyme_lines[-1]}") # Sort by earliest year to find the oldest "keyword">if extracted_flavors: extracted_flavors.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"\n=== STEP 3: COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}") print(f"\nAll flavors sorted by earliest year:") "keyword">for i, flavor "keyword">in enumerate(extracted_flavors, 1): print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[&#x27;name']} ({flavor['date_range']}) - Started: {flavor['earliest_year']}") "keyword">if flavor.get(&#x27;rhyme_lines'): print(f" Last rhyme line: {flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'][-1]}") # Identify the true oldest flavor oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0] print(f"\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IN BEN & JERRY&#x27;S GRAVEYARD:") print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;date_range']}") print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']}") "keyword">if oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;rhyme_lines'): print(f" Total rhyme lines: {len(oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'])}") print(f" Last rhyme line: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'][-1]}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n") # Find matching headstone image "keyword">if &#x27;top_headstone_images' "keyword">in analysis_data "keyword">and isinstance(analysis_data['top_headstone_images'], list): headstone_images = analysis_data[&#x27;top_headstone_images'] print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}") # Match the oldest flavor "keyword">with its headstone oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[&#x27;name'].lower() matching_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in headstone_images: "keyword">if isinstance(img, dict): img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '').lower() img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '').lower() # Check "keyword">for word matches flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split() matches = 0 "keyword">for word "keyword">in flavor_words: "keyword">if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words "keyword">if word "keyword">in img_alt "keyword">or word "keyword">in img_src: matches += 1 "keyword">if matches > 0: img_copy = img.copy() img_copy[&#x27;match_score'] = matches matching_images.append(img_copy) "keyword">if matching_images: # Sort by match score matching_images.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;match_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) best_match = matching_images[0] print(f"\n‚úì OLDEST FLAVOR HEADSTONE IMAGE FOUND:") print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')}") print(f" URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") print(f" Match score: {best_match.get(&#x27;match_score', 0)}") # Save comprehensive results final_results = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'correct_accordion_div_parsing', &#x27;total_flavors_extracted': len(extracted_flavors), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor, &#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image': best_match, &#x27;all_flavors_sorted_by_age': extracted_flavors, &#x27;plan_status': { &#x27;oldest_flavor_identified': "keyword">True, &#x27;headstone_image_located': "keyword">True, &#x27;next_step': 'Download "keyword">and analyze headstone image "keyword">for background details' } } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_final_oldest_flavor_results.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Final results saved to: {results_file}") print(f"\n=== PLAN PHASE 1 COMPLETE: OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED ===\n") print(f"üéØ OLDEST BEN & JERRY&#x27;S FLAVOR: {oldest_flavor['name']} ({oldest_flavor['date_range']})") print(f"üì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") print(f"\nüìã NEXT STEPS FOR PLAN COMPLETION:") print(f" 1. Download the oldest flavor&#x27;s headstone image") print(f" 2. Analyze the photo to locate background headstones") print(f" 3. Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">from background headstone") print(f" 4. Identify the last line of the background headstone&#x27;s rhyme") "keyword">else: print(f"No matching headstone images found "keyword">for &#x27;{oldest_flavor['name']}'") "keyword">else: print(f"No headstone images available "keyword">in analysis data") "keyword">else: print(f"No flavors extracted "keyword">from accordion content") "keyword">else: print(f"\nNo accordion div found "keyword">or no text content available") print(f"Available divs:") "keyword">for i, div "keyword">in enumerate(analysis_data[&#x27;top_flavor_divs'][:5]): "keyword">if isinstance(div, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;classes' "keyword">in div: print(f" Div {i+1}: {div[&#x27;classes']} ({div.get('text_length', 0):,} chars)") "keyword">else: print(f"No top_flavor_divs found "keyword">in analysis data") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error parsing analysis JSON: {e}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error processing analysis data: {e}") "keyword">import traceback traceback.print_exc() "keyword">else: print(f"Comprehensive analysis file "keyword">not found: {analysis_file}") print(f"\n=== COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION PROCESS FINISHED ===\n")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === ACCESSING THE CORRECT ACCORDION CONTENT FOR COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION === Objective: Access the correct div with accordion class to extract all flavors Strategy: Target the div with 'accordion' class that contains the full flavor data === STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE === Analysis file size: 221,410 characters Analysis file keys: analysis_date source_file page_title content_stats containers_found flavor_divs_found total_images relevant_images flavors_with_dates top_flavor_divs top_headstone_images oldest_flavors_candidates Found 10 flavor divs Div 1: Classes: container-fluid Text length: 8,113 characters Div 2: Classes: row grid-row Text length: 7,640 characters Div 3: Classes: col-md-6 Text length: 7,640 characters Div 4: Classes: accordion Text length: 7,640 characters *** FOUND ACCORDION DIV *** === STEP 2: PARSING ACCORDION CONTENT FOR ALL FLAVORS === Accordion text length: 203 characters Text preview: Aloha Macadamia2001-2002Rich milk chocolate cashew Brazil-nut butter ice cream with macadamia nuts covered in white & dark fudge & milk chocolatey swirl.We won't blame the macadamiaBut we were kinda i...... Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002) - Started: 2001 üéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IN BEN & JERRY'S GRAVEYARD: Name: Aloha Macadamia Date Range: 2001-2002 Started: 2001 === STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR === Available headstone images: 10 ‚úì OLDEST FLAVOR HEADSTONE IMAGE FOUND: Flavor: Aloha Macadamia Alt text: Aloha Macadamia tombstone URL: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0039_graveyard_aloha_macadamia.jpg Match score: 2 ‚úì Final results saved to: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_final_oldest_flavor_results.json === PLAN PHASE 1 COMPLETE: OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED === üéØ OLDEST BEN & JERRY'S FLAVOR: Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002) üì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0039_graveyard_aloha_macadamia.jpg üìã NEXT STEPS FOR PLAN COMPLETION: 1. developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 8)

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== DIRECT HTML PARSING TO EXTRACT ALL GRAVEYARD FLAVORS ===\n") print("Objective: Parse the original HTML file directly to extract all flavor names "keyword">and dates") print("Strategy: Access ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html "keyword">and parse accordion structure directly\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # Access the original HTML file directly html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html') "keyword">if os.path.exists(html_file): print("=== STEP 1: READING ORIGINAL HTML FILE ===\n") "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse the HTML "keyword">with BeautifulSoup print("\nParsing HTML content "keyword">with BeautifulSoup...") soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for the main accordion container accordion_container = soup.find(&#x27;div', class_='accordion') "keyword">if accordion_container: print(f"‚úì Found main accordion container") print(f"Accordion container ID: {accordion_container.get(&#x27;id', 'No ID')}") # Find all accordion items (li elements "keyword">with accordion-item "keyword">class) accordion_items = accordion_container.find_all(&#x27;li', class_='accordion-item') print(f"‚úì Found {len(accordion_items)} accordion items") "keyword">if len(accordion_items) > 0: print(f"\n=== STEP 2: EXTRACTING ALL FLAVORS FROM ACCORDION ITEMS ===\n") extracted_flavors = [] "keyword">for item_idx, item "keyword">in enumerate(accordion_items, 1): "keyword">try: # Extract flavor name "keyword">from the accordion button button = item.find(&#x27;button', class_='accordion-button') flavor_name = button.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if button "keyword">else f"Unknown Flavor {item_idx}" # Extract content "keyword">from the accordion body accordion_body = item.find(&#x27;div', class_='accordion-body') "keyword">if accordion_body: # Get all text content "keyword">from the body body_text = accordion_body.get_text(strip="keyword">True) # Look "keyword">for date ranges using multiple patterns date_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})', # 1979-1991 r&#x27;(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})', # 1979 - 1991 r&#x27;\b(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})\b', # Word boundaries ] dates_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, body_text) "keyword">if matches: dates_found.extend(matches) "keyword">break # Use first successful pattern "keyword">if dates_found: # Use the first date range found start_year_str, end_year_str = dates_found[0] start_year = int(start_year_str) end_year = int(end_year_str) # Extract rhyme lines "keyword">from <em> tags rhyme_elements = accordion_body.find_all(&#x27;em') rhyme_lines = [] "keyword">for em "keyword">in rhyme_elements: rhyme_text = em.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if rhyme_text: # Split by line breaks "keyword">and clean up lines = [line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in rhyme_text.replace(&#x27;\n', '|').split('|') "keyword">if line.strip()] rhyme_lines.extend(lines) # Extract description (the paragraph between date "keyword">and rhyme) content_paragraphs = accordion_body.find_all(&#x27;p') description = "" "keyword">for p "keyword">in content_paragraphs: p_text = p.get_text(strip="keyword">True) # Skip the date paragraph "keyword">and rhyme paragraphs "keyword">if "keyword">not re.search(r&#x27;\d{4}[-‚Äì‚Äî]\d{4}', p_text) "keyword">and "keyword">not p.find('em'): description = p_text "keyword">break flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year, &#x27;description': description, &#x27;rhyme_lines': rhyme_lines, &#x27;last_rhyme_line': rhyme_lines[-1] "keyword">if rhyme_lines "keyword">else "keyword">None } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f"{item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") "keyword">if rhyme_lines: print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(rhyme_lines)}") print(f" Last line: {rhyme_lines[-1]}") print(f" Description: {description[:100]}{&#x27;...' "keyword">if len(description) > 100 "keyword">else ''}") "keyword">else: print(f"{item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No date range found") print(f" Body text preview: {body_text[:100]}...") "keyword">else: print(f"{item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No accordion body found") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"{item_idx:2d}. Error processing item: {e}") "keyword">continue # Sort by earliest year to find the true oldest flavor "keyword">if extracted_flavors: extracted_flavors.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"\n=== STEP 3: ALL FLAVORS SORTED BY AGE ===\n") print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}") print(f"\nComplete list of flavors sorted by earliest year:") "keyword">for i, flavor "keyword">in enumerate(extracted_flavors, 1): print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[&#x27;name']} ({flavor['date_range']}) - Started: {flavor['earliest_year']}") "keyword">if flavor.get(&#x27;last_rhyme_line'): print(f" Last rhyme line: {flavor[&#x27;last_rhyme_line']}") # Identify the true oldest flavor oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0] print(f"\nüéØ TRUE OLDEST BEN & JERRY&#x27;S FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:") print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;date_range']}") print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']}") print(f" Description: {oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;description', 'No description')}") "keyword">if oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;rhyme_lines'): print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'])}") "keyword">for i, line "keyword">in enumerate(oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'], 1): print(f" {i}. {line}") print(f" *** LAST RHYME LINE: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;last_rhyme_line']} ***") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n") # Look "keyword">for headstone images "keyword">in the HTML all_images = soup.find_all(&#x27;img') headstone_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in all_images: img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') "keyword">or img.get('data-src', '') img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') "keyword">if img_src "keyword">and (&#x27;graveyard' "keyword">in img_src.lower() "keyword">or 'tombstone' "keyword">in img_alt.lower()): # Convert relative URLs to absolute "keyword">if img_src.startswith(&#x27;//'): img_src = &#x27;https:' + img_src "keyword">elif img_src.startswith(&#x27;/'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com' + img_src "keyword">elif "keyword">not img_src.startswith(&#x27;http'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com/' + img_src headstone_images.append({ &#x27;src': img_src, &#x27;alt': img_alt, &#x27;context': 'graveyard_headstone' }) print(f"Found {len(headstone_images)} headstone images") # Match the oldest flavor "keyword">with its headstone image oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[&#x27;name'].lower() matching_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in headstone_images: img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '').lower() img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '').lower() # Check "keyword">for word matches flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split() matches = 0 "keyword">for word "keyword">in flavor_words: "keyword">if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words "keyword">if word "keyword">in img_alt "keyword">or word "keyword">in img_src: matches += 1 "keyword">if matches > 0: img_copy = img.copy() img_copy[&#x27;match_score'] = matches matching_images.append(img_copy) "keyword">if matching_images: # Sort by match score matching_images.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;match_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) best_match = matching_images[0] print(f"\n‚úì OLDEST FLAVOR HEADSTONE IMAGE LOCATED:") print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')}") print(f" URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") print(f" Match score: {best_match.get(&#x27;match_score', 0)}") # Save comprehensive final results final_results = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'direct_html_accordion_parsing', &#x27;total_flavors_extracted': len(extracted_flavors), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor, &#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image': best_match, &#x27;all_flavors_complete_list': extracted_flavors, &#x27;plan_progress': { &#x27;phase_1_complete': "keyword">True, &#x27;oldest_flavor_identified': oldest_flavor['name'], &#x27;oldest_flavor_years': oldest_flavor['date_range'], &#x27;headstone_image_url': best_match.get('src', 'No URL'), &#x27;next_phase': 'Download headstone image "keyword">and analyze background' } } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_complete_graveyard_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Complete analysis saved to: {results_file}") print(f"\n=== PLAN PHASE 1 SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED ===\n") print(f"üéØ OLDEST BEN & JERRY&#x27;S FLAVOR: {oldest_flavor['name']} ({oldest_flavor['date_range']})") print(f"üì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") "keyword">if oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;last_rhyme_line'): print(f"üìù OLDEST FLAVOR&#x27;S LAST RHYME LINE: {oldest_flavor['last_rhyme_line']}") print(f"\nüìã READY FOR PLAN PHASE 2:") print(f" 1. Download the oldest flavor&#x27;s headstone image") print(f" 2. Examine the photo "keyword">for background headstones") print(f" 3. Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">from background headstone") print(f" 4. Identify the last line of the background headstone&#x27;s rhyme") "keyword">else: print(f"No matching headstone images found "keyword">for &#x27;{oldest_flavor['name']}'") print(f"Available headstone images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(headstone_images[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {img.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')} - {img.get('src', 'No URL')}") "keyword">else: print(f"No flavors were successfully extracted") "keyword">else: print(f"No accordion items found "keyword">in the accordion container") "keyword">else: print(f"No accordion container found "keyword">in the HTML") print(f"Searching "keyword">for alternative structures...") # Look "keyword">for any elements "keyword">with accordion-related classes accordion_elements = soup.find_all(attrs={&#x27;"keyword">class': re.compile('accordion', re.I)}) print(f"Found {len(accordion_elements)} elements "keyword">with accordion-related classes") "keyword">for i, elem "keyword">in enumerate(accordion_elements[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. Tag: {elem.name}, Classes: {elem.get(&#x27;"keyword">class', [])}") "keyword">else: print(f"HTML file "keyword">not found: {html_file}") print(f"Available files "keyword">in workspace:") "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): print(f" - {file}") print(f"\n=== DIRECT HTML PARSING COMPLETE ===\n")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === DIRECT HTML PARSING TO EXTRACT ALL GRAVEYARD FLAVORS === Objective: Parse the original HTML file directly to extract all flavor names and dates Strategy: Access ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html and parse accordion structure directly === STEP 1: READING ORIGINAL HTML FILE === HTML file size: 373,435 characters Parsing HTML content with BeautifulSoup... ‚úì Found main accordion container Accordion container ID: accordion-1ace45df-77cb-4f67-be03-08379c5e27c0 ‚úì Found 35 accordion items === STEP 2: EXTRACTING ALL FLAVORS FROM ACCORDION ITEMS === 1. Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002) Rhyme lines: 1 Last line: We won't blame the macadamiaBut we were kinda in denialThe Marketplace had spoken:Mac got aloha'ed off the aisle. Description: Rich milk chocolate cashew Brazil-nut butter ice cream with macadamia nuts covered in white & dark f... 2. Description: Milk chocolate ice cream & white fudge cows swirled with white chocolate ice cream & dark fudge cows 3. Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Frozen Yogurt (1994-2001) Rhyme lines: 1 Last line: So now we know: ¬†our Dough Fro YoJust wasn't as greate as expected.Folks who love Dough as well as Fro YoLove 'em separate, not interconnected. Description: Vanilla frozen yogurt with gobs of chocolate chip cookie dough 4. Chocolate Comfort (1999-1999) Rhyme lines: 1 Last line: It's curtains for thechocolate pairI ate alone in the comfy chair,One pint per night it mighthave beenBut 'twas low fat so itweren't no sin. Description: Chocolate Truffle Low Fat Ice Cream swirled with White Chocolate Low Fat Ice Cream. 5. Chocolate Macadamia (2010-2011) Rhyme lines: 1 Last line: Nuts about chocolateChocolate about nutsSwirled vanilla with chocolateMaybe too much? Description: Chocolate & Vanilla Ice Creams with Chocolatey Covered Macadamia Nuts 6. Coconutterly Fair (2011-2012) Rhyme lines: 1 Last line: Chocolate and coconutFairtrade, we must add.A taste sensation, we'd hopedBut it's gone now, so sad. Description: Chocolate Ice Cream with Coconut Caramel Swirls & a Chocolatey Covered Coconut Caramel Crunch 7. Cool Britannia (1995-1998) Rhyme lines: 1 Last line: A flavour so smashing -& yet it fouled out:Strawberries & shortbread -a love match devoutBut sadly it missedall the fame it deserved,A bit too much Englishput into the serve. Description: Vanilla ice cream with strawberries and fudge covered shortbread 8. Cow Power (2012-2012) Rhyme lines: 1 Last line: Cow welfare we felt,Deserved it's own flavour.Just a limited batch though,So a taste memory to savour. Description: Sweet Cream Ice Cream with Chocolate Cookie Pieces, Dark Chocolatey Cows & a Chocolate Fudge Swirl 9. Cr√®me Brulee (2007-2012) Rhyme lines: 1 Last line: Pardon our French,but we still swearOur Cr√®me Brulee isbeyond compare,So it may not be beaucouptoo late to saveCr√®me Brulee frombeyond the grave. Description: Sweet Custard Ice Cream with a Caramelized Sugar Swirl 10. Dastardly Mash (1979-1991) Rhyme lines: 1 Last line: Here the brazenDASTARDLY lies.Some say that raisin,Caused its demise. Description: Chocolate Ice Cream with Pecans, Almonds, Raisins, & Chocolate Chips 11. tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 07:49:53

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and successfully extracted all 35 flavors from the Ben & Jerry's graveyard page by parsing the HTML accordion structure directly. The analysis correctly identified 'Dastardly Mash' (1979-1991) as the oldest discontinued flavor, starting in 1979, which is significantly older than the previous incorrect identification of Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002). The code extracted complete flavor information including names, date ranges, descriptions, and rhyme lines, then sorted all flavors by earliest year. Successfully matched the oldest flavor with its headstone image URL and saved comprehensive results to workspace/ben_jerrys_complete_graveyard_analysis.json. **PLAN** alignment: 90% complete - Phase 1 is successfully finished. We have correctly identified the oldest flavor (Dastardly Mash 1979-1991), located its headstone image (tombstones_2023_0015_graveyard_dastardly_mash.jpg), and extracted its rhyme's last line. Ready for Phase 2: Download the Dastardly Mash headstone image, examine the photo for background headstones, extract the flavor name and complete rhyme from any visible background headstone, and identify the last line of that background headstone's rhyme to complete the PLAN objectives.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== DIRECT HTML PARSING TO EXTRACT ALL GRAVEYARD FLAVORS ===\n") print("Objective: Parse the original HTML file directly to extract all flavor names "keyword">and dates") print("Strategy: Access ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html "keyword">and parse accordion structure directly\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # Access the original HTML file directly html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html') "keyword">if os.path.exists(html_file): print("=== STEP 1: READING ORIGINAL HTML FILE ===\n") "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse the HTML "keyword">with BeautifulSoup print("\nParsing HTML content "keyword">with BeautifulSoup...") soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for the main accordion container accordion_container = soup.find(&#x27;div', class_='accordion') "keyword">if accordion_container: print(f"‚úì Found main accordion container") print(f"Accordion container ID: {accordion_container.get(&#x27;id', 'No ID')}") # Find all accordion items (li elements "keyword">with accordion-item "keyword">class) accordion_items = accordion_container.find_all(&#x27;li', class_='accordion-item') print(f"‚úì Found {len(accordion_items)} accordion items") "keyword">if len(accordion_items) > 0: print(f"\n=== STEP 2: EXTRACTING ALL FLAVORS FROM ACCORDION ITEMS ===\n") extracted_flavors = [] "keyword">for item_idx, item "keyword">in enumerate(accordion_items, 1): "keyword">try: # Extract flavor name "keyword">from the accordion button button = item.find(&#x27;button', class_='accordion-button') flavor_name = button.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if button "keyword">else f"Unknown Flavor {item_idx}" # Extract content "keyword">from the accordion body accordion_body = item.find(&#x27;div', class_='accordion-body') "keyword">if accordion_body: # Get all text content "keyword">from the body body_text = accordion_body.get_text(strip="keyword">True) # Look "keyword">for date ranges using multiple patterns date_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\d{4})', # 1979-1991 r&#x27;(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})', # 1979 - 1991 r&#x27;\b(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})\b', # Word boundaries ] dates_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, body_text) "keyword">if matches: dates_found.extend(matches) "keyword">break # Use first successful pattern "keyword">if dates_found: # Use the first date range found start_year_str, end_year_str = dates_found[0] start_year = int(start_year_str) end_year = int(end_year_str) # Extract rhyme lines "keyword">from <em> tags rhyme_elements = accordion_body.find_all(&#x27;em') rhyme_lines = [] "keyword">for em "keyword">in rhyme_elements: rhyme_text = em.get_text(strip="keyword">True) "keyword">if rhyme_text: # Split by line breaks "keyword">and clean up lines = [line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in rhyme_text.replace(&#x27;\n', '|').split('|') "keyword">if line.strip()] rhyme_lines.extend(lines) # Extract description (the paragraph between date "keyword">and rhyme) content_paragraphs = accordion_body.find_all(&#x27;p') description = "" "keyword">for p "keyword">in content_paragraphs: p_text = p.get_text(strip="keyword">True) # Skip the date paragraph "keyword">and rhyme paragraphs "keyword">if "keyword">not re.search(r&#x27;\d{4}[-‚Äì‚Äî]\d{4}', p_text) "keyword">and "keyword">not p.find('em'): description = p_text "keyword">break flavor_info = { &#x27;name': flavor_name, &#x27;start_year': start_year, &#x27;end_year': end_year, &#x27;date_range': f'{start_year}-{end_year}', &#x27;earliest_year': start_year, &#x27;description': description, &#x27;rhyme_lines': rhyme_lines, &#x27;last_rhyme_line': rhyme_lines[-1] "keyword">if rhyme_lines "keyword">else "keyword">None } extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info) print(f"{item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})") "keyword">if rhyme_lines: print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(rhyme_lines)}") print(f" Last line: {rhyme_lines[-1]}") print(f" Description: {description[:100]}{&#x27;...' "keyword">if len(description) > 100 "keyword">else ''}") "keyword">else: print(f"{item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No date range found") print(f" Body text preview: {body_text[:100]}...") "keyword">else: print(f"{item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No accordion body found") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"{item_idx:2d}. Error processing item: {e}") "keyword">continue # Sort by earliest year to find the true oldest flavor "keyword">if extracted_flavors: extracted_flavors.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;earliest_year']) print(f"\n=== STEP 3: ALL FLAVORS SORTED BY AGE ===\n") print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}") print(f"\nComplete list of flavors sorted by earliest year:") "keyword">for i, flavor "keyword">in enumerate(extracted_flavors, 1): print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[&#x27;name']} ({flavor['date_range']}) - Started: {flavor['earliest_year']}") "keyword">if flavor.get(&#x27;last_rhyme_line'): print(f" Last rhyme line: {flavor[&#x27;last_rhyme_line']}") # Identify the true oldest flavor oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0] print(f"\nüéØ TRUE OLDEST BEN & JERRY&#x27;S FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:") print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;date_range']}") print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;earliest_year']}") print(f" Description: {oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;description', 'No description')}") "keyword">if oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;rhyme_lines'): print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'])}") "keyword">for i, line "keyword">in enumerate(oldest_flavor[&#x27;rhyme_lines'], 1): print(f" {i}. {line}") print(f" *** LAST RHYME LINE: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;last_rhyme_line']} ***") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n") # Look "keyword">for headstone images "keyword">in the HTML all_images = soup.find_all(&#x27;img') headstone_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in all_images: img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') "keyword">or img.get('data-src', '') img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') "keyword">if img_src "keyword">and (&#x27;graveyard' "keyword">in img_src.lower() "keyword">or 'tombstone' "keyword">in img_alt.lower()): # Convert relative URLs to absolute "keyword">if img_src.startswith(&#x27;//'): img_src = &#x27;https:' + img_src "keyword">elif img_src.startswith(&#x27;/'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com' + img_src "keyword">elif "keyword">not img_src.startswith(&#x27;http'): img_src = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com/' + img_src headstone_images.append({ &#x27;src': img_src, &#x27;alt': img_alt, &#x27;context': 'graveyard_headstone' }) print(f"Found {len(headstone_images)} headstone images") # Match the oldest flavor "keyword">with its headstone image oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[&#x27;name'].lower() matching_images = [] "keyword">for img "keyword">in headstone_images: img_alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '').lower() img_src = img.get(&#x27;src', '').lower() # Check "keyword">for word matches flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split() matches = 0 "keyword">for word "keyword">in flavor_words: "keyword">if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words "keyword">if word "keyword">in img_alt "keyword">or word "keyword">in img_src: matches += 1 "keyword">if matches > 0: img_copy = img.copy() img_copy[&#x27;match_score'] = matches matching_images.append(img_copy) "keyword">if matching_images: # Sort by match score matching_images.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;match_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) best_match = matching_images[0] print(f"\n‚úì OLDEST FLAVOR HEADSTONE IMAGE LOCATED:") print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[&#x27;name']}") print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')}") print(f" URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") print(f" Match score: {best_match.get(&#x27;match_score', 0)}") # Save comprehensive final results final_results = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'direct_html_accordion_parsing', &#x27;total_flavors_extracted': len(extracted_flavors), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor, &#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image': best_match, &#x27;all_flavors_complete_list': extracted_flavors, &#x27;plan_progress': { &#x27;phase_1_complete': "keyword">True, &#x27;oldest_flavor_identified': oldest_flavor['name'], &#x27;oldest_flavor_years': oldest_flavor['date_range'], &#x27;headstone_image_url': best_match.get('src', 'No URL'), &#x27;next_phase': 'Download headstone image "keyword">and analyze background' } } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_complete_graveyard_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Complete analysis saved to: {results_file}") print(f"\n=== PLAN PHASE 1 SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED ===\n") print(f"üéØ OLDEST BEN & JERRY&#x27;S FLAVOR: {oldest_flavor['name']} ({oldest_flavor['date_range']})") print(f"üì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE URL: {best_match.get(&#x27;src', 'No URL')}") "keyword">if oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;last_rhyme_line'): print(f"üìù OLDEST FLAVOR&#x27;S LAST RHYME LINE: {oldest_flavor['last_rhyme_line']}") print(f"\nüìã READY FOR PLAN PHASE 2:") print(f" 1. Download the oldest flavor&#x27;s headstone image") print(f" 2. Examine the photo "keyword">for background headstones") print(f" 3. Extract flavor name "keyword">and rhyme "keyword">from background headstone") print(f" 4. Identify the last line of the background headstone&#x27;s rhyme") "keyword">else: print(f"No matching headstone images found "keyword">for &#x27;{oldest_flavor['name']}'") print(f"Available headstone images:") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(headstone_images[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {img.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text')} - {img.get('src', 'No URL')}") "keyword">else: print(f"No flavors were successfully extracted") "keyword">else: print(f"No accordion items found "keyword">in the accordion container") "keyword">else: print(f"No accordion container found "keyword">in the HTML") print(f"Searching "keyword">for alternative structures...") # Look "keyword">for any elements "keyword">with accordion-related classes accordion_elements = soup.find_all(attrs={&#x27;"keyword">class': re.compile('accordion', re.I)}) print(f"Found {len(accordion_elements)} elements "keyword">with accordion-related classes") "keyword">for i, elem "keyword">in enumerate(accordion_elements[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. Tag: {elem.name}, Classes: {elem.get(&#x27;"keyword">class', [])}") "keyword">else: print(f"HTML file "keyword">not found: {html_file}") print(f"Available files "keyword">in workspace:") "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): print(f" - {file}") print(f"\n=== DIRECT HTML PARSING COMPLETE ===\n")
üìÑ Output

developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 9)
2025-08-11 07:50:54

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== DOWNLOADING AND ANALYZING DASTARDLY MASH HEADSTONE IMAGE ===\n") print("Objective: Download the oldest flavor&#x27;s headstone image "keyword">and examine background") print("Strategy: Download image, analyze "keyword">for background headstones, extract details\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, safely inspect the complete analysis file to get the headstone URL analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_complete_graveyard_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("=== STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING ANALYSIS FILE FOR HEADSTONE URL ===\n") # First check file size "keyword">and structure file_size = os.path.getsize(analysis_file) print(f"Analysis file size: {file_size:,} bytes") "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: content_preview = f.read(500) # Read first 500 characters to check structure print(f"File content preview: {content_preview}...") # Now safely load "keyword">and inspect the JSON structure "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print("\nAnalysis file structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in analysis_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # Safely extract the oldest flavor "keyword">and headstone information "keyword">if &#x27;oldest_flavor' "keyword">in analysis_data "keyword">and 'oldest_flavor_headstone_image' "keyword">in analysis_data: oldest_flavor = analysis_data[&#x27;oldest_flavor'] headstone_image = analysis_data[&#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image'] print(f"\n‚úì Found oldest flavor data:") "keyword">if isinstance(oldest_flavor, dict): print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;name', 'Unknown')}") print(f" Date range: {oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;date_range', 'Unknown')}") print(f" Description: {oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;description', 'No description')[:100]}...") print(f"\n‚úì Found headstone image data:") "keyword">if isinstance(headstone_image, dict): headstone_url = headstone_image.get(&#x27;src', '') headstone_alt = headstone_image.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text') print(f" Alt text: {headstone_alt}") print(f" URL: {headstone_url}") "keyword">if headstone_url: print(f"\n=== STEP 2: DOWNLOADING DASTARDLY MASH HEADSTONE IMAGE ===\n") "keyword">try: # Set up headers to mimic a browser request headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'image/webp,image/apng,image/*,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', &#x27;DNT': '1', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } print(f"Downloading image "keyword">from: {headstone_url}") response = requests.get(headstone_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) response.raise_for_status() print(f"‚úì Image downloaded successfully") print(f" Status code: {response.status_code}") print(f" Content type: {response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', 'Unknown')}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Save the image to workspace image_filename = &#x27;dastardly_mash_headstone.jpg' image_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, image_filename) "keyword">with open(image_path, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.content) print(f"‚úì Image saved to: {image_path}") print(f"\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING HEADSTONE IMAGE PROPERTIES ===\n") # Load "keyword">and analyze the image using PIL "keyword">try: "keyword">with Image.open(image_path) "keyword">as img: print(f"Image analysis:") print(f" Format: {img.format}") print(f" Mode: {img.mode}") print(f" Size: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(image_path):,} bytes") # Check "keyword">if image has transparency "keyword">or other features that might indicate composite elements "keyword">if hasattr(img, &#x27;info'): print(f" Image info: {img.info}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: EXAMINING IMAGE FOR BACKGROUND HEADSTONES ===\n") # Since we can't perform computer vision analysis directly, # we'll provide detailed instructions "keyword">for manual examination print(f"üì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE ANALYSIS INSTRUCTIONS:") print(f"\nImage file downloaded: {image_path}") print(f"Image URL: {headstone_url}") print(f"Image dimensions: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels") print(f"\nüîç MANUAL EXAMINATION REQUIRED:") print(f"1. Open the downloaded image: {image_path}") print(f"2. Look carefully at the background of the Dastardly Mash headstone") print(f"3. Identify any other headstones visible "keyword">in the background") print(f"4. Read the flavor name on any background headstone") print(f"5. Read the complete rhyme text on the background headstone") print(f"6. Identify the last line of the background headstone&#x27;s rhyme") # Save analysis metadata image_analysis = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;oldest_flavor': oldest_flavor.get('name', 'Unknown'), &#x27;headstone_image_url': headstone_url, &#x27;local_image_path': image_path, &#x27;image_properties': { &#x27;format': img.format, &#x27;mode': img.mode, &#x27;width': img.size[0], &#x27;height': img.size[1], &#x27;file_size_bytes': os.path.getsize(image_path) }, &#x27;plan_status': { &#x27;phase_1_complete': "keyword">True, &#x27;phase_2_in_progress': "keyword">True, &#x27;oldest_flavor_identified': oldest_flavor.get('name', 'Unknown'), &#x27;headstone_image_downloaded': "keyword">True, &#x27;background_analysis_required': "keyword">True }, &#x27;next_steps': [ &#x27;Manually examine the downloaded headstone image', &#x27;Locate any background headstones visible "keyword">in the image', &#x27;Extract the flavor name "keyword">from the background headstone', &#x27;Extract the complete rhyme text "keyword">from the background headstone', &#x27;Identify the last line of the background headstone rhyme' ] } analysis_file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;dastardly_mash_image_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file_path, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(image_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n‚úì Image analysis metadata saved to: {analysis_file_path}") print(f"\n=== PLAN STATUS UPDATE ===\n") print(f"‚úÖ PHASE 1 COMPLETE: Oldest flavor identified (Dastardly Mash, 1979-1991)") print(f"üîÑ PHASE 2 IN PROGRESS: Headstone image downloaded "keyword">and ready "keyword">for analysis") print(f"üìÅ Image location: {image_path}") print(f"üéØ Next: Manual examination of image "keyword">for background headstone details") print(f"\nüìã TO COMPLETE THE PLAN:") print(f"1. ‚úÖ Access Ben & Jerry&#x27;s flavor graveyard - DONE") print(f"2. ‚úÖ Identify oldest flavor (Dastardly Mash, 1979-1991) - DONE") print(f"3. ‚úÖ Locate headstone photo - DONE") print(f"4. ‚úÖ Download headstone image - DONE") print(f"5. üîÑ Examine background "keyword">for other headstones - 2025-08-11 07:50:55

"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print("=== DOWNLOADING AND ANALYZING DASTARDLY MASH HEADSTONE IMAGE ===\n") print("Objective: Download the oldest flavor&#x27;s headstone image "keyword">and examine background") print("Strategy: Download image, analyze "keyword">for background headstones, extract details\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, safely inspect the complete analysis file to get the headstone URL analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_complete_graveyard_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("=== STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING ANALYSIS FILE FOR HEADSTONE URL ===\n") # First check file size "keyword">and structure file_size = os.path.getsize(analysis_file) print(f"Analysis file size: {file_size:,} bytes") "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: content_preview = f.read(500) # Read first 500 characters to check structure print(f"File content preview: {content_preview}...") # Now safely load "keyword">and inspect the JSON structure "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print("\nAnalysis file structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in analysis_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # Safely extract the oldest flavor "keyword">and headstone information "keyword">if &#x27;oldest_flavor' "keyword">in analysis_data "keyword">and 'oldest_flavor_headstone_image' "keyword">in analysis_data: oldest_flavor = analysis_data[&#x27;oldest_flavor'] headstone_image = analysis_data[&#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image'] print(f"\n‚úì Found oldest flavor data:") "keyword">if isinstance(oldest_flavor, dict): print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;name', 'Unknown')}") print(f" Date range: {oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;date_range', 'Unknown')}") print(f" Description: {oldest_flavor.get(&#x27;description', 'No description')[:100]}...") print(f"\n‚úì Found headstone image data:") "keyword">if isinstance(headstone_image, dict): headstone_url = headstone_image.get(&#x27;src', '') headstone_alt = headstone_image.get(&#x27;alt', 'No alt text') print(f" Alt text: {headstone_alt}") print(f" URL: {headstone_url}") "keyword">if headstone_url: print(f"\n=== STEP 2: DOWNLOADING DASTARDLY MASH HEADSTONE IMAGE ===\n") "keyword">try: # Set up headers to mimic a browser request headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'image/webp,image/apng,image/*,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', &#x27;DNT': '1', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } print(f"Downloading image "keyword">from: {headstone_url}") response = requests.get(headstone_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) response.raise_for_status() print(f"‚úì Image downloaded successfully") print(f" Status code: {response.status_code}") print(f" Content type: {response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', 'Unknown')}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Save the image to workspace image_filename = &#x27;dastardly_mash_headstone.jpg' image_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, image_filename) "keyword">with open(image_path, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.content) print(f"‚úì Image saved to: {image_path}") print(f"\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING HEADSTONE IMAGE PROPERTIES ===\n") # Load "keyword">and analyze the image using PIL "keyword">try: "keyword">with Image.open(image_path) "keyword">as img: print(f"Image analysis:") print(f" Format: {img.format}") print(f" Mode: {img.mode}") print(f" Size: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(image_path):,} bytes") # Check "keyword">if image has transparency "keyword">or other features that might indicate composite elements "keyword">if hasattr(img, &#x27;info'): print(f" Image info: {img.info}") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: EXAMINING IMAGE FOR BACKGROUND HEADSTONES ===\n") # Since we can't perform computer vision analysis directly, # we'll provide detailed instructions "keyword">for manual examination print(f"üì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE ANALYSIS INSTRUCTIONS:") print(f"\nImage file downloaded: {image_path}") print(f"Image URL: {headstone_url}") print(f"Image dimensions: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels") print(f"\nüîç MANUAL EXAMINATION REQUIRED:") print(f"1. üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urlparse print("=== ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: ACCESSING DASTARDLY MASH HEADSTONE IMAGE ===\n") print("Objective: Access the headstone image using alternative methods to bypass 403 error") print("Strategy: Try different approaches including session management "keyword">and referrer headers\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, safely inspect the analysis file to get the headstone URL analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerrys_complete_graveyard_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("=== STEP 1: SAFELY EXTRACTING HEADSTONE URL FROM ANALYSIS ===\n") # Check file structure first file_size = os.path.getsize(analysis_file) print(f"Analysis file size: {file_size:,} bytes") "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) # Safely extract headstone URL headstone_url = "keyword">None oldest_flavor_name = "keyword">None "keyword">if &#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image' "keyword">in analysis_data: headstone_image = analysis_data[&#x27;oldest_flavor_headstone_image'] "keyword">if isinstance(headstone_image, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;src' "keyword">in headstone_image: headstone_url = headstone_image[&#x27;src'] print(f"‚úì Found headstone URL: {headstone_url}") "keyword">if &#x27;oldest_flavor' "keyword">in analysis_data: oldest_flavor = analysis_data[&#x27;oldest_flavor'] "keyword">if isinstance(oldest_flavor, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;name' "keyword">in oldest_flavor: oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[&#x27;name'] print(f"‚úì Oldest flavor: {oldest_flavor_name}") "keyword">if headstone_url: print(f"\n=== STEP 2: ALTERNATIVE IMAGE ACCESS METHODS ===\n") # Method 1: Use session "keyword">with proper referrer print("Method 1: Session "keyword">with referrer headers") session = requests.Session() # First, visit the main graveyard page to establish session graveyard_url = &#x27;https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard' headers_main = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', &#x27;DNT': '1', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Dest': 'document', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Mode': 'navigate', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Site': 'none' } "keyword">try: print(f" Visiting main graveyard page: {graveyard_url}") main_response = session.get(graveyard_url, headers=headers_main, timeout=30) print(f" Main page response: {main_response.status_code}") "keyword">if main_response.status_code == 200: # Now "keyword">try to get the image "keyword">with proper referrer time.sleep(2) # Brief delay headers_image = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'image/webp,image/apng,image/*,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', &#x27;DNT': '1', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Referer': graveyard_url, &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Dest': 'image', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Mode': 'no-cors', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Site': 'same-origin' } print(f" Attempting image download "keyword">with session "keyword">and referrer...") image_response = session.get(headstone_url, headers=headers_image, timeout=30) "keyword">if image_response.status_code == 200: print(f" ‚úì SUCCESS! Image downloaded "keyword">with session method") print(f" Status: {image_response.status_code}") print(f" Content type: {image_response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', 'Unknown')}") print(f" Size: {len(image_response.content):,} bytes") # Save the image image_filename = &#x27;dastardly_mash_headstone.jpg' image_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, image_filename) "keyword">with open(image_path, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(image_response.content) print(f" ‚úì Image saved to: {image_path}") # Analyze the downloaded image print(f"\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING DOWNLOADED HEADSTONE IMAGE ===\n") "keyword">try: "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image "keyword">with Image.open(image_path) "keyword">as img: print(f"Image properties:") print(f" Format: {img.format}") print(f" Mode: {img.mode}") print(f" Size: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(image_path):,} bytes") print(f"\n=== STEP 4: EXAMINING FOR BACKGROUND HEADSTONES ===\n") # Since this "keyword">is a headstone image "keyword">from Ben & Jerry's graveyard, # we need to examine it "keyword">for other headstones "keyword">in the background print(f"üì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE ANALYSIS:") print(f"\nMain headstone: {oldest_flavor_name} (1979-1991)") print(f"Image file: {image_path}") print(f"Dimensions: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels") print(f"\nüîç BACKGROUND EXAMINATION PROCESS:") print(f"1.
