{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport re\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== ANALYZING EXISTING BEN & JERRY\'S GRAVEYARD DATA ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Parse existing HTML file to find oldest flavor and headstone photos")\nprint("Strategy: Analyze workspace files, extract flavor data, identify oldest flavor\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# First, let\'s inspect the existing files to understand their structure\nprint("=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE FILES ===\\n")\n\nworkspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir)\nprint(f"Files in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}")\n\nfor file in workspace_files:\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n\n# Inspect the JSON file structure first (as recommended)\njson_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_flavors_initial_extraction.json\')\nif os.path.exists(json_file):\n print(f"\\n=== INSPECTING JSON FILE STRUCTURE ===\\n")\n print(f"Reading: {json_file}")\n \n with open(json_file, \'r\') as f:\n json_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"JSON file content length: {len(json_content)} characters")\n print(f"JSON content preview: {json_content}")\n \n try:\n json_data = json.loads(json_content)\n print(f"\\nJSON structure:")\n for key, value in json_data.items():\n if isinstance(value, list):\n print(f" {key}: List with {len(value)} items")\n elif isinstance(value, dict):\n print(f" {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys")\n else:\n print(f" {key}: {value}")\n \n # If there\'s flavor data, show a sample\n if \'flavors_data\' in json_data and json_data[\'flavors_data\']:\n print(f"\\nSample flavor data structure:")\n sample_flavor = json_data[\'flavors_data\'][0]\n for key, value in sample_flavor.items():\n print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}{\'...\' if len(str(value)) > 100 else \'\'}")\n \n except json.JSONDecodeError as e:\n print(f"JSON parsing error: {e}")\n print("File may be corrupted or incomplete")\nelse:\n print(f"JSON file not found: {json_file}")\n\n# Now analyze the main HTML file\nhtml_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html\')\nif os.path.exists(html_file):\n print(f"\\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILE ===\\n")\n print(f"Reading: {html_file}")\n \n with open(html_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n html_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"HTML file length: {len(html_content):,} characters")\n \n # Parse with BeautifulSoup\n print(f"Parsing HTML content...")\n soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, \'html.parser\')\n \n # Get page title\n page_title = soup.title.get_text(strip=True) if soup.title else \'No title found\'\n print(f"Page title: {page_title}")\n \n # Basic content analysis\n page_text = soup.get_text()\n print(f"Total text length: {len(page_text):,} characters")\n \n flavor_mentions = page_text.lower().count(\'flavor\')\n graveyard_mentions = page_text.lower().count(\'graveyard\')\n discontinued_mentions = page_text.lower().count(\'discontinued\')\n \n print(f"Content analysis:")\n print(f" \'Flavor\' mentions: {flavor_mentions}")\n print(f" \'Graveyard\' mentions: {graveyard_mentions}")\n print(f" \'Discontinued\' mentions: {discontinued_mentions}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR FLAVOR CONTAINERS ===\\n")\n \n # Try multiple approaches to find flavor information\n \n # Approach 1: Look for common container patterns\n container_selectors = [\n \'.flavor-card\',\n \'.flavor-item\', \n \'.graveyard-item\',\n \'.flavor\',\n \'.product-card\',\n \'.card\',\n \'.item\',\n \'[data-flavor]\',\n \'.graveyard-flavor\',\n \'.discontinued-flavor\',\n \'div[class*="flavor"]\',\n \'div[class*="graveyard"]\',\n \'div[class*="card"]\'\n ]\n \n print("Searching for flavor containers using CSS selectors...")\n all_containers = []\n \n for selector in container_selectors:\n elements = soup.select(selector)\n if elements:\n print(f" Found {len(elements)} elements with selector \'{selector}\'")\n all_containers.extend(elements)\n else:\n print(f" No elements found with selector \'{selector}\'")\n \n # Remove duplicates\n unique_containers = list(set(all_containers))\n print(f"\\nTotal unique containers found: {len(unique_containers)}")\n \n # Approach 2: Look for any divs or sections that might contain flavor information\n print(f"\\nSearching for divs and sections with flavor-related content...")\n \n all_divs = soup.find_all([\'div\', \'section\', \'article\'])\n flavor_divs = []\n \n for div in all_divs:\n div_text = div.get_text(strip=True)\n div_classes = \' \'.join(div.get(\'class\', []))\n div_id = div.get(\'id\', \'\')\n \n # Check if this div contains flavor-related content\n combined_text = f"{div_text} {div_classes} {div_id}".lower()\n \n if any(keyword in combined_text for keyword in [\'flavor\', \'graveyard\', \'discontinued\']) and len(div_text) > 20:\n flavor_divs.append({\n \'element\': div,\n \'text\': div_text[:200] + (\'...\' if len(div_text) > 200 else \'\'),\n \'classes\': div_classes,\n \'id\': div_id,\n \'text_length\': len(div_text)\n })\n \n print(f"Found {len(flavor_divs)} divs with flavor-related content")\n \n # Sort by text length (longer content might be more relevant)\n flavor_divs.sort(key=lambda x: x[\'text_length\'], reverse=True)\n \n print(f"\\nTop 10 flavor-related divs by content length:")\n for i, div_info in enumerate(flavor_divs[:10], 1):\n print(f"\\n{i}. Length: {div_info[\'text_length\']:,} chars")\n print(f" Classes: {div_info[\'classes\']}")\n print(f" ID: {div_info[\'id\']}")\n print(f" Text preview: {div_info[\'text\']}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING FOR IMAGES (HEADSTONES) ===\\n")\n \n # Find all images\n all_images = soup.find_all(\'img\')\n print(f"Total images found: {len(all_images)}")\n \n headstone_images = []\n \n for img in all_images:\n img_src = img.get(\'src\', \'\') or img.get(\'data-src\', \'\') or img.get(\'data-lazy-src\', \'\')\n img_alt = img.get(\'alt\', \'\')\n img_title = img.get(\'title\', \'\')\n img_class = \' \'.join(img.get(\'class\', []))\n \n if img_src:\n # Convert relative URLs to absolute\n if img_src.startswith(\'//\'):\n img_src = \'https:\' + img_src\n elif img_src.startswith(\'/\'):\n img_src = \'https://www.benjerry.com\' + img_src\n elif not img_src.startswith(\'http\'):\n img_src = \'https://www.benjerry.com/\' + img_src\n \n # Check relevance for headstone/graveyard images\n img_context = f"{img_src} {img_alt} {img_title} {img_class}".lower()\n \n relevance_keywords = [\'headstone\', \'graveyard\', \'grave\', \'tombstone\', \'rip\', \'flavor\', \'discontinued\']\n relevance_score = sum(1 for keyword in relevance_keywords if keyword in img_context)\n \n if relevance_score > 0 or \'graveyard\' in img_src.lower() or \'flavor\' in img_src.lower():\n headstone_images.append({\n \'src\': img_src,\n \'alt\': img_alt,\n \'title\': img_title,\n \'class\': img_class,\n \'relevance_score\': relevance_score,\n \'context\': img_context\n })\n \n # Sort by relevance score\n headstone_images.sort(key=lambda x: x[\'relevance_score\'], reverse=True)\n \n print(f"Found {len(headstone_images)} potentially relevant images:")\n \n for i, img in enumerate(headstone_images[:15], 1): # Show top 15\n print(f"\\n{i}. Relevance score: {img[\'relevance_score\']}")\n print(f" Source: {img[\'src\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: {img[\'alt\']}")\n print(f" Title: {img[\'title\']}")\n print(f" Class: {img[\'class\']}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 4: SEARCHING FOR FLAVOR NAMES AND DATES ===\\n")\n \n # Look for text patterns that indicate flavor names with dates\n year_pattern = r\'\\b(19[7-9]\\d|20[0-2]\\d)\\b\' # 1970-2029\n date_range_pattern = r\'\\b(19[7-9]\\d|20[0-2]\\d)[-‚Äì‚Äî](19[7-9]\\d|20[0-2]\\d)\\b\' # Date ranges\n \n # Split page text into meaningful chunks\n paragraphs = [p.strip() for p in page_text.split(\'\\n\') if p.strip()]\n \n flavors_with_dates = []\n \n for paragraph in paragraphs:\n if len(paragraph) < 10 or len(paragraph) > 1000: # Skip very short or very long paragraphs\n continue\n \n # Check if paragraph contains years\n years_found = re.findall(year_pattern, paragraph)\n date_ranges = re.findall(date_range_pattern, paragraph)\n \n if years_found or date_ranges:\n # This might be a flavor with date information\n flavors_with_dates.append({\n \'text\': paragraph,\n \'years\': list(set(years_found)), # Remove duplicates\n \'date_ranges\': date_ranges,\n \'earliest_year\': min([int(y) for y in years_found]) if years_found else None\n })\n \n print(f"Found {len(flavors_with_dates)} text sections with date information")\n \n # Sort by earliest year to find the oldest\n flavors_with_dates_sorted = [f for f in flavors_with_dates if f[\'earliest_year\']]\n flavors_with_dates_sorted.sort(key=lambda x: x[\'earliest_year\'])\n \n print(f"\\nTop 15 sections by earliest year (potential oldest flavors):")\n for i, flavor_info in enumerate(flavors_with_dates_sorted[:15], 1):\n print(f"\\n{i}. Earliest year: {flavor_info[\'earliest_year\']}")\n print(f" All years: {flavor_info[\'years\']}")\n print(f" Date ranges: {flavor_info[\'date_ranges\']}")\n print(f" Text: {flavor_info[\'text\'][:200]}{\'...\' if len(flavor_info[\'text\']) > 200 else \'\'}")\n \n # Save comprehensive analysis\n analysis_data = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'source_file\': html_file,\n \'page_title\': page_title,\n \'content_stats\': {\n \'html_length\': len(html_content),\n \'text_length\': len(page_text),\n \'flavor_mentions\': flavor_mentions,\n \'graveyard_mentions\': graveyard_mentions,\n \'discontinued_mentions\': discontinued_mentions\n },\n \'containers_found\': len(unique_containers),\n \'flavor_divs_found\': len(flavor_divs),\n \'total_images\': len(all_images),\n \'relevant_images\': len(headstone_images),\n \'flavors_with_dates\': len(flavors_with_dates),\n \'top_flavor_divs\': flavor_divs[:10], # Top 10 by content length\n \'top_headstone_images\': headstone_images[:10], # Top 10 by relevance\n \'oldest_flavors_candidates\': flavors_with_dates_sorted[:10] # Top 10 oldest\n }\n \n analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json\')\n with open(analysis_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, default=str) # default=str to handle any non-serializable objects\n \n print(f"\\n‚úì Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}")\n \n # Summary and next steps\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 5: ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\\n")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully parsed Ben & Jerry\'s Graveyard HTML ({len(html_content):,} chars)")\n print(f"‚úì Found {len(flavor_divs)} flavor-related content sections")\n print(f"‚úì Located {len(headstone_images)} potentially relevant images")\n print(f"‚úì Identified {len(flavors_with_dates)} text sections with date information")\n \n if flavors_with_dates_sorted:\n oldest_candidate = flavors_with_dates_sorted[0]\n print(f"\\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR CANDIDATE IDENTIFIED:")\n print(f" Earliest year: {oldest_candidate[\'earliest_year\']}")\n print(f" Years mentioned: {oldest_candidate[\'years\']}")\n print(f" Text preview: {oldest_candidate[\'text\'][:300]}...")\n \n print(f"\\nüìã NEXT STEPS:")\n print(f" 1. Extract the specific flavor name from the oldest candidate")\n print(f" 2. Find the corresponding headstone image for this flavor")\n print(f" 3. Download and analyze the headstone photo for background details")\n print(f" 4. Identify other headstones visible in the background")\n print(f" 5. Extract flavor name and rhyme text from background headstone")\n else:\n print(f"\\n‚ö† No clear oldest flavor identified - may need refined analysis")\n print(f"Recommendation: Examine flavor divs and images more closely")\n\nelse:\n print(f"HTML file not found: {html_file}")\n print(f"Cannot proceed with analysis without the graveyard page content")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\\n")\nprint(f"Ready to proceed with oldest flavor identification and headstone image analysis")',
"description": "Comprehensive analysis of the existing Ben & Jerry's graveyard HTML file to extract flavor information and identify the oldest discontinued flavor. This implementation: (1) First inspects the JSON file structure to understand existing data format safely, (2) Parses the 374KB HTML file using BeautifulSoup to extract all relevant content, (3) Searches for flavor containers using multiple CSS selector strategies, (4) Identifies flavor-related divs and sections by content analysis, (5) Locates headstone images with relevance scoring based on keywords, (6) Extracts flavor names and dates using regex patterns for years (1970-2029) and date ranges, (7) Sorts flavors by earliest year to identify the oldest candidate, (8) Saves comprehensive analysis data to workspace/ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json for further processing. The code provides detailed logging of findings including the top oldest flavor candidates, most relevant headstone images, and largest flavor content sections. This analysis will enable us to identify the oldest flavor and proceed to examine its headstone photo for background details as required by the PLAN.",
}

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport re\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== REFINED FLAVOR DATE EXTRACTION FROM ACCORDION SECTIONS ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Extract actual flavor names and discontinuation dates from accordion content")\nprint("Strategy: Focus on the 7,640-character accordion sections that contain flavor details\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# First inspect the comprehensive analysis file structure\nanalysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json\')\nif os.path.exists(analysis_file):\n print("=== STEP 1: INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE STRUCTURE ===\\n")\n \n with open(analysis_file, \'r\') as f:\n analysis_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters")\n \n try:\n analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content)\n print("\\nAnalysis file structure:")\n for key, value in analysis_data.items():\n if isinstance(value, list):\n print(f" {key}: List with {len(value)} items")\n elif isinstance(value, dict):\n print(f" {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys")\n else:\n print(f" {key}: {value}")\n \n # Examine the top flavor divs structure\n if \'top_flavor_divs\' in analysis_data:\n print(f"\\nTop flavor divs structure (first item):")\n if analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\']:\n first_div = analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\'][0]\n for key, value in first_div.items():\n if key == \'text\':\n print(f" {key}: {len(str(value))} characters")\n else:\n print(f" {key}: {value}")\n \n except json.JSONDecodeError as e:\n print(f"JSON parsing error: {e}")\nelse:\n print(f"Analysis file not found: {analysis_file}")\n\n# Now analyze the HTML file directly, focusing on accordion sections\nhtml_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html\')\nif os.path.exists(html_file):\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 2: FOCUSED ANALYSIS OF ACCORDION SECTIONS ===\\n")\n \n with open(html_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n html_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"HTML file length: {len(html_content):,} characters")\n \n # Parse with BeautifulSoup\n soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, \'html.parser\')\n \n # Look specifically for accordion elements and their content\n print("Searching for accordion elements...")\n \n accordion_elements = soup.find_all([\'div\'], class_=lambda x: x and \'accordion\' in \' \'.join(x))\n print(f"Found {len(accordion_elements)} accordion elements")\n \n # Also look for collapse elements that contain flavor information\n collapse_elements = soup.find_all([\'div\'], class_=lambda x: x and \'collapse\' in \' \'.join(x))\n print(f"Found {len(collapse_elements)} collapse elements")\n \n # Combine and analyze all potential flavor containers\n flavor_containers = accordion_elements + collapse_elements\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 3: EXTRACTING FLAVOR NAMES AND DATES FROM CONTAINERS ===\\n")\n \n extracted_flavors = []\n \n for i, container in enumerate(flavor_containers, 1):\n container_text = container.get_text(strip=True)\n container_classes = \' \'.join(container.get(\'class\', []))\n container_id = container.get(\'id\', \'\')\n \n print(f"\\nContainer {i}:")\n print(f" Classes: {container_classes}")\n print(f" ID: {container_id}")\n print(f" Text length: {len(container_text):,} characters")\n \n if len(container_text) > 100: # Focus on containers with substantial content\n print(f" Text preview: {container_text[:200]}...")\n \n # Look for flavor name patterns (usually at the beginning)\n lines = container_text.split(\'\\n\')\n first_meaningful_line = None\n \n for line in lines:\n line_clean = line.strip()\n if len(line_clean) > 3 and not line_clean.lower().startswith((\'skip\', \'search\', \'suggestions\')):\n first_meaningful_line = line_clean\n break\n \n if first_meaningful_line:\n print(f" First meaningful line (potential flavor name): {first_meaningful_line}")\n \n # Extract date patterns with more comprehensive regex\n date_patterns = [\n r\'(\\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\\d{4})\', # 1993-2001\n r\'(\\d{4})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(\\d{4})\', # 1993 - 2001\n r\'\\b(19\\d{2}|20\\d{2})[-‚Äì‚Äî](19\\d{2}|20\\d{2})\\b\', # More specific year ranges\n r\'\\b(19\\d{2}|20\\d{2})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(19\\d{2}|20\\d{2})\\b\' # With spaces\n ]\n \n dates_found = []\n for pattern in date_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, container_text)\n dates_found.extend(matches)\n \n # Also look for individual years\n individual_years = re.findall(r\'\\b(19[7-9]\\d|20[0-2]\\d)\\b\', container_text)\n \n if dates_found or individual_years:\n print(f" Date ranges found: {dates_found}")\n print(f" Individual years found: {individual_years}")\n \n # Determine the earliest year for this flavor\n all_years = []\n for date_range in dates_found:\n all_years.extend([int(date_range[0]), int(date_range[1])])\n all_years.extend([int(year) for year in individual_years])\n \n if all_years:\n earliest_year = min(all_years)\n latest_year = max(all_years)\n \n # Try to extract the flavor name more precisely\n flavor_name = None\n \n # Look for text before the first date\n text_before_date = container_text\n for pattern in date_patterns + [r\'\\b19\\d{2}\\b\', r\'\\b20\\d{2}\\b\']:\n match = re.search(pattern, text_before_date)\n if match:\n text_before_date = text_before_date[:match.start()].strip()\n break\n \n # Clean up the potential flavor name\n potential_names = [line.strip() for line in text_before_date.split(\'\\n\') if line.strip()]\n \n # Find the most likely flavor name (usually short and meaningful)\n for name in potential_names:\n if 5 <= len(name) <= 50 and not any(skip_word in name.lower() for skip_word in [\'skip\', \'search\', \'flavor graveyard\', \'ben & jerry\', \'ice cream\']):\n flavor_name = name\n break\n \n if not flavor_name and potential_names:\n flavor_name = potential_names[0] # Fallback to first line\n \n extracted_flavors.append({\n \'container_index\': i,\n \'flavor_name\': flavor_name,\n \'earliest_year\': earliest_year,\n \'latest_year\': latest_year,\n \'date_ranges\': dates_found,\n \'individual_years\': individual_years,\n \'container_classes\': container_classes,\n \'container_text_preview\': container_text[:500]\n })\n \n print(f" *** FLAVOR EXTRACTED ***")\n print(f" Name: {flavor_name}")\n print(f" Earliest year: {earliest_year}")\n print(f" Latest year: {latest_year}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 4: SORTING FLAVORS BY AGE TO FIND THE OLDEST ===\\n")\n \n # Sort by earliest year to find the true oldest flavor\n extracted_flavors.sort(key=lambda x: x[\'earliest_year\'])\n \n print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}")\n print(f"\\nTop 15 oldest flavors:")\n \n for i, flavor in enumerate(extracted_flavors[:15], 1):\n print(f"\\n{i}. {flavor[\'flavor_name\'] or \'Unknown Name\'}")\n print(f" Years: {flavor[\'earliest_year\']} - {flavor[\'latest_year\']}")\n print(f" Date ranges: {flavor[\'date_ranges\']}")\n print(f" Container classes: {flavor[\'container_classes\']}")\n \n if extracted_flavors:\n oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0]\n print(f"\\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:")\n print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[\'flavor_name\']}")\n print(f" Years: {oldest_flavor[\'earliest_year\']} - {oldest_flavor[\'latest_year\']}")\n print(f" Date ranges: {oldest_flavor[\'date_ranges\']}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 5: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\\n")\n \n # Load the headstone images from previous analysis\n if \'analysis_data\' in locals() and \'top_headstone_images\' in analysis_data:\n headstone_images = analysis_data[\'top_headstone_images\']\n print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}")\n \n # Try to match the oldest flavor name with a headstone image\n oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[\'flavor_name\'] or \'\'\n matching_headstones = []\n \n for img in headstone_images:\n img_alt = img.get(\'alt\', \'\').lower()\n img_src = img.get(\'src\', \'\').lower()\n \n # Check if the flavor name appears in the image alt text or filename\n if oldest_flavor_name:\n flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.lower().split()\n if any(word in img_alt or word in img_src for word in flavor_words if len(word) > 3):\n matching_headstones.append(img)\n \n if matching_headstones:\n print(f"Found {len(matching_headstones)} potentially matching headstone images:")\n for i, img in enumerate(matching_headstones, 1):\n print(f"\\n{i}. {img[\'src\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: {img[\'alt\']}")\n print(f" Relevance score: {img.get(\'relevance_score\', 0)}")\n \n best_match = matching_headstones[0]\n print(f"\\n‚úì BEST MATCHING HEADSTONE IMAGE:")\n print(f" URL: {best_match[\'src\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: {best_match[\'alt\']}")\n else:\n print(f"No direct matches found for \'{oldest_flavor_name}\'")\n print(f"Will need to examine all headstone images manually")\n \n # Show all available headstone images for manual inspection\n print(f"\\nAll available headstone images:")\n for i, img in enumerate(headstone_images[:10], 1):\n print(f"\\n{i}. {img[\'alt\']}")\n print(f" URL: {img[\'src\']}")\n \n # Save the refined flavor extraction results\n refined_results = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'extraction_method\': \'focused_accordion_analysis\',\n \'total_flavors_extracted\': len(extracted_flavors),\n \'oldest_flavor\': oldest_flavor if extracted_flavors else None,\n \'all_flavors_by_age\': extracted_flavors,\n \'next_steps\': [\n \'Download the oldest flavor headstone image\',\n \'Analyze the image for background headstones\',\n \'Extract flavor name and rhyme from background headstone\',\n \'Identify the last line of the background headstone rhyme\'\n ]\n }\n \n refined_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_refined_flavor_extraction.json\')\n with open(refined_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(refined_results, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n‚úì Refined flavor extraction results saved to: {refined_file}")\n \nelse:\n print(f"HTML file not found: {html_file}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== REFINED FLAVOR EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===\\n")\nprint(f"Next: Download and analyze the oldest flavor\'s headstone image for background details")',
"description": "Refined analysis focusing on extracting actual flavor names and discontinuation dates from the accordion sections that contain the real flavor data. This implementation: (1) First inspects the comprehensive analysis file structure to understand available data safely, (2) Focuses specifically on accordion and collapse elements that contain the detailed flavor information (the 7,640-character sections), (3) Uses multiple regex patterns to extract date ranges like '1993-2001' and individual years, (4) Attempts to identify flavor names by finding text that appears before the first date in each container, (5) Sorts all extracted flavors by their earliest year to correctly identify the true oldest flavor, (6) Attempts to match the oldest flavor name with available headstone images using alt text and filename analysis, (7) Saves refined extraction results to workspace/ben_jerrys_refined_flavor_extraction.json. This approach should correctly identify the oldest discontinued flavor (likely from the 1980s-1990s) and find its corresponding headstone image, enabling us to proceed with the background headstone analysis as required by the PLAN.",
}

Fair</button>\n</h2>\n<div aria-labelledby="accordion-item-e1d0b520-bd93-4aff-a6fa-66de4957feeb" class="accordion-collapse collapse" id="collapse-e1d0b520-bd93-4aff-a6fa-66de4957feeb" role="region">\n<div class="accordion-body">\n<div class="content-block">\n<p><strong>2011-2012</strong></p>\n<p>Chocolate Ice Cream with Coconut Caramel Swirls &amp; a Chocolatey Covered Coconut Caramel Crunch</p>\n<p><em>Chocolate and coconut<br/>\nFairtrade, we must add.<br/>\nA taste sensation, we\'d hoped<br/>\nBut it\'s gone now, so sad.</em></p>\n</div><img alt="image-from-the-document-manager" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" src="/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_graveyard_coconutterly.jpg" width="750"/></div>\n</div>\n</li><li class="accordion-item">\n<h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-eea3ef75-4dce-401b-bf16-7ac5eedb473f">\n<button aria-controls="collapse-eea3ef75-4dce-401b-bf16-7ac5eedb473f" aria-expanded="false" class="accordion-body">\n<div class="content-block">\n<p><strong>1995-1998</strong></p>\n<p>Vanilla ice cream with strawberries and fudge covered shortbread</p>\n<p><em>A flavour so smashing -<br/>\n&amp; yet it fouled out:<br/>\nStrawberries &amp; shortbread -<br/>\na love match devout<br/>\nBut sadly it missed<br/>\nall the fame it deserved,<br/>\nA bit too much English<br/>\nput into the serve.</em></p>\n</div><img alt="Cool Britannia tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" Caramelized Sugar Swirl</p>\n<p><em>Pardon our French,<br/>\nbut we still swear<br/>\nOur Cr√®me Brulee is<br/>\nbeyond compare,<br/>\nSo it may not be beaucoup<br/>\ntoo late to save<br/>\nCr√®me Brulee from<br/>\nbeyond the grave.</em></p>\n</div><img alt="Creme Brulee tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" Passion Fruit Sorbet With Other Natural Flavors</p>\n<p><em>We kept the passion going<br/>\n\'til all efforts were in vain.<br/>\nNow Purple Passion\'s majesty\'s<br/>\nbeneath the fruited plain.</em></p>\n</div><img alt="Purple Passion Fruit tombstone" class="" height="750" loading="lazy" class="accordion-item">\n<h2 class="accordion-header heading-3" id="accordion-item-176211a6-af3d-43f6-af25-8263ec7b105c">\n<button aria-controls="collapse-176211a6-af3d-43f6-af25-8263ec7b105c" class="banner-content">\n<h2 class="heading heading-2">Tell us what flavor you\'d like to see back!</h2>\n<div class="banner-body"><p>Tell us what flavor you\'d like to see back and why and we will resurrect the most popular.</p>\n</div>\n<div class="banner-buttons">\n<a class="btn btn-primary" href="/contact-us" target="_self" title="Contact Us">Resurrect a Flavor</a></div>\n</div>\n</article><div class="row grid-row">\n<div class="col-12">\n</div>\n</div></div>\n text: 203 characters\n classes: container-fluid\n id: \n text_length: 8113\n\n=== STEP 2: FOCUSED ANALYSIS OF ACCORDION SECTIONS ===\n\nHTML file length: 373,435 characters\nSearching for accordion elements...\nFound 0 accordion elements\nFound 0 collapse elements\n\n=== STEP 3: EXTRACTING FLAVOR NAMES AND DATES FROM CONTAINERS ===\n\n\n=== STEP 4: SORTING FLAVORS BY AGE TO FIND THE OLDEST ===\n\nTotal flavors extracted: 0\n\nTop 15 oldest flavors:\n\n‚úì Refined flavor extraction results saved to: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_refined_flavor_extraction.json\n\n=== REFINED FLAVOR EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===\n\nNext: Download and analyze the oldest flavor\'s headstone image for background details',
}
{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport re\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== EXTRACTING FLAVOR DATA FROM COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Use existing comprehensive analysis data to extract flavor names and dates")\nprint("Strategy: Parse the accordion content that was already identified in previous analysis\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# First, let\'s safely inspect the comprehensive analysis file\nanalysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json\')\nif os.path.exists(analysis_file):\n print("=== STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE ===\\n")\n \n with open(analysis_file, \'r\') as f:\n analysis_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters")\n \n # Parse JSON safely\n try:\n analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content)\n print("\\nAnalysis file structure:")\n for key, value in analysis_data.items():\n if isinstance(value, list):\n print(f" {key}: List with {len(value)} items")\n elif isinstance(value, dict):\n print(f" {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys")\n else:\n print(f" {key}: {value}")\n \n # Examine the top_flavor_divs structure safely\n if \'top_flavor_divs\' in analysis_data and analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\']:\n print(f"\\nExamining top_flavor_divs structure:")\n \n # Look at the structure of the first div\n first_div = analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\'][0]\n print(f"First div keys: {list(first_div.keys())}")\n \n # The \'text\' field should contain the actual flavor content\n if \'text\' in first_div:\n text_content = first_div[\'text\']\n print(f"First div text length: {len(text_content):,} characters")\n print(f"Text preview: {text_content[:300]}...")\n \n # Check if this contains the accordion content we need\n if \'accordion\' in text_content.lower():\n print("‚úì Found accordion content in the flavor divs!")\n else:\n print("‚ö† No accordion content found in first div text")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 2: EXTRACTING FLAVOR DATA FROM THE LARGE CONTENT SECTION ===\\n")\n \n # The second largest div (7,640 chars) should contain the actual flavor data\n if \'top_flavor_divs\' in analysis_data and len(analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\']) >= 2:\n flavor_content_div = analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\'][1] # Second largest\n \n print(f"Analyzing flavor content div:")\n print(f" Classes: {flavor_content_div.get(\'classes\', \'None\')}")\n print(f" ID: {flavor_content_div.get(\'id\', \'None\')}")\n print(f" Text length: {flavor_content_div.get(\'text_length\', 0):,} characters")\n \n if \'text\' in flavor_content_div:\n flavor_text = flavor_content_div[\'text\']\n print(f"\\nExtracting flavors from {len(flavor_text):,} characters of content...")\n \n # This text should contain all the flavor information\n # Let\'s parse it to extract individual flavors\n \n # Split by flavor names (look for patterns like "Aloha Macadamia2001-2002")\n # First, let\'s find all the date patterns\n date_pattern = r\'(\\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\\d{4})\'\n date_matches = re.finditer(date_pattern, flavor_text)\n \n print(f"\\nFound date patterns in the text:")\n \n extracted_flavors = []\n \n # Find flavor names and their associated date ranges\n lines = flavor_text.split(\'\\n\')\n current_flavor = None\n \n for line in lines:\n line_clean = line.strip()\n \n # Skip empty lines and very short lines\n if len(line_clean) < 5:\n continue\n \n # Look for date patterns in this line\n date_match = re.search(date_pattern, line_clean)\n \n if date_match:\n start_year = int(date_match.group(1))\n end_year = int(date_match.group(2))\n \n # The flavor name should be the text before the date\n text_before_date = line_clean[:date_match.start()].strip()\n \n # Clean up the flavor name\n if text_before_date and len(text_before_date) < 100: # Reasonable flavor name length\n flavor_name = text_before_date\n \n # Look for the description and rhyme in subsequent lines\n flavor_info = {\n \'name\': flavor_name,\n \'start_year\': start_year,\n \'end_year\': end_year,\n \'date_range\': f\'{start_year}-{end_year}\',\n \'earliest_year\': start_year\n }\n \n extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info)\n \n print(f" Found: {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})")\n \n # If the above approach didn\'t work well, try a different method\n if len(extracted_flavors) < 10: # We should have many more flavors\n print(f"\\nFirst approach found only {len(extracted_flavors)} flavors. Trying alternative parsing...")\n \n # Look for flavor patterns using regex\n # Pattern: Flavor Name followed by year range\n flavor_pattern = r\'([A-Za-z\\s&\\\'!]+)(\\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\\d{4})\'\n \n flavor_matches = re.finditer(flavor_pattern, flavor_text)\n \n extracted_flavors = [] # Reset\n \n for match in flavor_matches:\n flavor_name = match.group(1).strip()\n start_year = int(match.group(2))\n end_year = int(match.group(3))\n \n # Clean up flavor name (remove common prefixes/suffixes)\n flavor_name = re.sub(r\'^(Skip to|Search|Flavor Graveyard)\', \'\', flavor_name).strip()\n \n if len(flavor_name) > 3 and len(flavor_name) < 50: # Reasonable length\n flavor_info = {\n \'name\': flavor_name,\n \'start_year\': start_year,\n \'end_year\': end_year,\n \'date_range\': f\'{start_year}-{end_year}\',\n \'earliest_year\': start_year\n }\n \n extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info)\n print(f" Found: {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})")\n \n # Sort by earliest year to find the oldest\n if extracted_flavors:\n extracted_flavors.sort(key=lambda x: x[\'earliest_year\'])\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 3: OLDEST FLAVORS IDENTIFIED ===\\n")\n print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}")\n \n print(f"\\nTop 15 oldest flavors:")\n for i, flavor in enumerate(extracted_flavors[:15], 1):\n print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[\'name\']} ({flavor[\'date_range\']}) - Started: {flavor[\'earliest_year\']}")\n \n if extracted_flavors:\n oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0]\n print(f"\\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:")\n print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']}")\n print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[\'date_range\']}")\n print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[\'earliest_year\']}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\\n")\n \n # Look for matching headstone image\n if \'top_headstone_images\' in analysis_data:\n headstone_images = analysis_data[\'top_headstone_images\']\n print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}")\n \n # Try to match the oldest flavor name with headstone images\n oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[\'name\'].lower()\n matching_images = []\n \n for img in headstone_images:\n img_alt = img.get(\'alt\', \'\').lower()\n img_src = img.get(\'src\', \'\').lower()\n \n # Check if flavor name words appear in image alt or src\n flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split()\n matches = 0\n for word in flavor_words:\n if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words like \'and\', \'the\'\n if word in img_alt or word in img_src:\n matches += 1\n \n if matches > 0:\n img[\'match_score\'] = matches\n matching_images.append(img)\n \n if matching_images:\n # Sort by match score\n matching_images.sort(key=lambda x: x.get(\'match_score\', 0), reverse=True)\n \n print(f"Found {len(matching_images)} potentially matching headstone images:")\n for i, img in enumerate(matching_images[:3], 1):\n print(f"\\n{i}. Match score: {img.get(\'match_score\', 0)}")\n print(f" Alt text: {img.get(\'alt\', \'No alt text\')}")\n print(f" URL: {img.get(\'src\', \'No URL\')}")\n \n best_match = matching_images[0]\n print(f"\\n‚úì BEST MATCHING HEADSTONE IMAGE:")\n print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(\'alt\', \'No alt text\')}")\n print(f" URL: {best_match.get(\'src\', \'No URL\')}")\n \n # Save the results\n final_results = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'extraction_method\': \'comprehensive_analysis_parsing\',\n \'total_flavors_extracted\': len(extracted_flavors),\n \'oldest_flavor\': oldest_flavor,\n \'oldest_flavor_headstone_image\': best_match,\n \'all_flavors_sorted_by_age\': extracted_flavors[:20], # Top 20 oldest\n \'next_steps\': [\n \'Download the oldest flavor headstone image\',\n \'Analyze the image for background headstones\',\n \'Extract flavor name and rhyme from background headstone\',\n \'Identify the last line of the background headstone rhyme\'\n ]\n }\n \n results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_oldest_flavor_identified.json\')\n with open(results_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n‚úì Final results saved to: {results_file}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== OLDEST FLAVOR SUCCESSFULLY IDENTIFIED ===\\n")\n print(f"üéØ READY FOR NEXT PHASE: Download and analyze headstone image")\n print(f" Oldest flavor: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']} ({oldest_flavor[\'date_range\']})")\n print(f" Headstone image: {best_match.get(\'src\', \'No URL\')}")\n print(f" Next: Download image and examine background for other headstones")\n \n else:\n print(f"No matching headstone images found for \'{oldest_flavor[\'name\']}\'")\n print(f"Will need to examine all headstone images manually")\n \n else:\n print(f"No flavors extracted from the content. May need manual parsing.")\n \n else:\n print(f"No text content found in flavor content div")\n \n else:\n print(f"Insufficient flavor divs found in analysis data")\n \n except json.JSONDecodeError as e:\n print(f"Error parsing analysis JSON: {e}")\n\nelse:\n print(f"Comprehensive analysis file not found: {analysis_file}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== FLAVOR EXTRACTION FROM ANALYSIS DATA COMPLETE ===\\n")',
"description": "Strategic implementation to extract flavor data using the existing comprehensive analysis file rather than re-parsing HTML. This approach: (1) Safely inspects the comprehensive analysis JSON structure before accessing any keys, following best practices for handling intermediate files, (2) Focuses on the large flavor content section (7,640 characters) that contains the actual accordion data with flavor names and dates, (3) Uses multiple regex parsing strategies to extract flavor names and date ranges like '1979-1991', '1988-1988', etc., (4) Sorts extracted flavors by earliest year to correctly identify the true oldest flavor from the 1970s-1980s era, (5) Matches the oldest flavor name with available headstone images using word matching in alt text and URLs, (6) Saves comprehensive results to workspace/ben_jerrys_oldest_flavor_identified.json for the next phase. This method leverages the previously successful HTML parsing while avoiding the CSS selector issues, enabling us to identify the oldest flavor (likely Dastardly Mash from 1979-1991) and its corresponding headstone image for background analysis as required by the PLAN.",

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport re\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== EXTRACTING ALL FLAVORS FROM ACCORDION HTML CONTENT ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Parse the full accordion HTML structure to extract all flavor names and dates")\nprint("Strategy: Use the comprehensive analysis data but access the full HTML content directly\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# First, inspect the comprehensive analysis file structure safely\nanalysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json\')\nif os.path.exists(analysis_file):\n print("=== STEP 1: INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS STRUCTURE ===\\n")\n \n with open(analysis_file, \'r\') as f:\n analysis_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters")\n \n try:\n analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content)\n \n # Safely inspect the structure\n print("\\nAnalysis file structure:")\n for key, value in analysis_data.items():\n if isinstance(value, list):\n print(f" {key}: List with {len(value)} items")\n elif isinstance(value, dict):\n print(f" {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys")\n else:\n print(f" {key}: {value}")\n \n # Look at the top_flavor_divs structure safely\n if \'top_flavor_divs\' in analysis_data and analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\']:\n print(f"\\nExamining top_flavor_divs:")\n \n for i, div in enumerate(analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\'][:5], 1): # First 5 divs\n print(f"\\nDiv {i}:")\n if \'classes\' in div:\n print(f" Classes: {div[\'classes\']}")\n if \'text_length\' in div:\n print(f" Text length: {div[\'text_length\']:,} characters")\n if \'text\' in div:\n text_preview = div[\'text\'][:200] + "..." if len(div[\'text\']) > 200 else div[\'text\']\n print(f" Text preview: {text_preview}")\n \n # Check if this div contains accordion data\n if \'accordion\' in div[\'text\'].lower():\n print(f" *** CONTAINS ACCORDION CONTENT ***")\n \n # This is likely the div with all the flavor data\n full_accordion_text = div[\'text\']\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 2: PARSING ACCORDION CONTENT FOR ALL FLAVORS ===\\n")\n print(f"Parsing {len(full_accordion_text):,} characters of accordion content...")\n \n # Parse the accordion content using BeautifulSoup to handle HTML structure\n soup = BeautifulSoup(full_accordion_text, \'html.parser\')\n \n # Look for accordion items (li elements with accordion-item class)\n accordion_items = soup.find_all(\'li\', class_=\'accordion-item\')\n print(f"Found {len(accordion_items)} accordion items")\n \n extracted_flavors = []\n \n for item_idx, item in enumerate(accordion_items, 1):\n # Extract flavor name from the button text\n button = item.find(\'button\', class_=\'accordion-button\')\n flavor_name = button.get_text(strip=True) if button else f"Unknown Flavor {item_idx}"\n \n # Extract content from the accordion body\n accordion_body = item.find(\'div\', class_=\'accordion-body\')\n \n if accordion_body:\n body_text = accordion_body.get_text(strip=True)\n \n # Look for date ranges in the body text\n date_patterns = [\n r\'(\\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\\d{4})\', # 1979-1991\n r\'(\\d{4})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(\\d{4})\', # 1979 - 1991\n ]\n \n dates_found = []\n for pattern in date_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, body_text)\n dates_found.extend(matches)\n \n if dates_found:\n # Use the first date range found\n start_year, end_year = dates_found[0]\n start_year, end_year = int(start_year), int(end_year)\n \n # Extract the rhyme (text in italic/em tags)\n rhyme_elements = accordion_body.find_all(\'em\')\n rhyme_lines = []\n for em in rhyme_elements:\n rhyme_text = em.get_text(strip=True)\n if rhyme_text:\n # Split by line breaks and clean up\n lines = [line.strip() for line in rhyme_text.split(\'\\n\') if line.strip()]\n rhyme_lines.extend(lines)\n \n flavor_info = {\n \'name\': flavor_name,\n \'start_year\': start_year,\n \'end_year\': end_year,\n \'date_range\': f\'{start_year}-{end_year}\',\n \'earliest_year\': start_year,\n \'rhyme_lines\': rhyme_lines,\n \'body_text_preview\': body_text[:200] + \'...\' if len(body_text) > 200 else body_text\n }\n \n extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info)\n \n print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})")\n if rhyme_lines:\n print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(rhyme_lines)}")\n if rhyme_lines:\n print(f" Last line: {rhyme_lines[-1]}")\n \n else:\n print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No date range found")\n else:\n print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No accordion body found")\n \n # Sort by earliest year to find the true oldest flavor\n if extracted_flavors:\n extracted_flavors.sort(key=lambda x: x[\'earliest_year\'])\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 3: OLDEST FLAVORS IDENTIFIED ===\\n")\n print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}")\n \n print(f"\\nTop 15 oldest flavors:")\n for i, flavor in enumerate(extracted_flavors[:15], 1):\n print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[\'name\']} ({flavor[\'date_range\']}) - Started: {flavor[\'earliest_year\']}")\n if flavor.get(\'rhyme_lines\'):\n print(f" Rhyme last line: {flavor[\'rhyme_lines\'][-1]}")\n \n # Identify the true oldest flavor\n oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0]\n print(f"\\nüéØ TRUE OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:")\n print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']}")\n print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[\'date_range\']}")\n print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[\'earliest_year\']}")\n if oldest_flavor.get(\'rhyme_lines\'):\n print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(oldest_flavor[\'rhyme_lines\'])}")\n print(f" Last rhyme line: {oldest_flavor[\'rhyme_lines\'][-1]}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\\n")\n \n # Find matching headstone image\n if \'top_headstone_images\' in analysis_data:\n headstone_images = analysis_data[\'top_headstone_images\']\n print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}")\n \n # Match the oldest flavor with its headstone image\n oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[\'name\'].lower()\n matching_images = []\n \n for img in headstone_images:\n img_alt = img.get(\'alt\', \'\').lower()\n img_src = img.get(\'src\', \'\').lower()\n \n # Check for exact matches or word matches\n flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split()\n matches = 0\n \n for word in flavor_words:\n if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words\n if word in img_alt or word in img_src:\n matches += 1\n \n if matches > 0:\n img[\'match_score\'] = matches\n matching_images.append(img)\n \n if matching_images:\n # Sort by match score\n matching_images.sort(key=lambda x: x.get(\'match_score\', 0), reverse=True)\n \n best_match = matching_images[0]\n print(f"\\n‚úì BEST MATCHING HEADSTONE IMAGE:")\n print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(\'alt\', \'No alt text\')}")\n print(f" URL: {best_match.get(\'src\', \'No URL\')}")\n \n # Save comprehensive results\n final_results = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'extraction_method\': \'accordion_html_parsing\',\n \'total_flavors_extracted\': len(extracted_flavors),\n \'oldest_flavor\': oldest_flavor,\n \'oldest_flavor_headstone_image\': best_match,\n \'all_flavors_sorted_by_age\': extracted_flavors,\n \'next_steps\': [\n f\'Download the oldest flavor headstone image: {best_match.get("src", "No URL")}\',\n \'Analyze the headstone photo for background headstones\',\n \'Extract flavor name and rhyme from background headstone\',\n \'Identify the last line of the background headstone rhyme\'\n ]\n }\n \n results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_complete_flavor_extraction.json\')\n with open(results_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n‚úì Complete extraction results saved to: {results_file}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== TRUE OLDEST FLAVOR SUCCESSFULLY IDENTIFIED ===\\n")\n print(f"üéØ READY FOR HEADSTONE IMAGE ANALYSIS:")\n print(f" Oldest flavor: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']} ({oldest_flavor[\'date_range\']})")\n print(f" Headstone URL: {best_match.get(\'src\', \'No URL\')}")\n print(f" Next: Download image and examine background for other headstones")\n \n break # Found the accordion content, exit the loop\n \n else:\n print(f"No matching headstone images found for \'{oldest_flavor[\'name\']}\'")\n \n else:\n print(f"No flavors extracted from accordion content")\n \n else:\n print(f"No top_flavor_divs found in analysis data")\n \n except json.JSONDecodeError as e:\n print(f"Error parsing analysis JSON: {e}")\nelse:\n print(f"Comprehensive analysis file not found: {analysis_file}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION FINISHED ===\\n")',
"description": "Comprehensive implementation to extract all flavors from the accordion HTML structure that was captured in the previous analysis. This approach: (1) Safely inspects the comprehensive analysis file structure before accessing any keys, following best practices for intermediate file handling, (2) Identifies the div containing accordion content by searching for 'accordion' in the text content, (3) Uses BeautifulSoup to parse the HTML structure and extract all accordion items (li elements with accordion-item class), (4) Extracts flavor names from button text and date ranges from accordion body content using regex patterns, (5) Captures rhyme lines from italic/em tags within each flavor's content, (6) Sorts all extracted flavors by earliest year to correctly identify the true oldest flavor (likely from 1979-1991 era), (7) Matches the oldest flavor with its corresponding headstone image, (8) Saves complete results to workspace/ben_jerrys_complete_flavor_extraction.json. This method should successfully extract all flavors from the graveyard and identify the genuinely oldest discontinued flavor with its headstone image, enabling us to proceed with the background headstone analysis as required by the PLAN.",
}

"role": 'tester',
"feedback": "Partial success - Code executed without errors and successfully extracted flavor data from the comprehensive analysis file. The code correctly identified that the large flavor content section contains accordion data and attempted to parse flavor names and dates. However, there's a critical data access issue: the code is reading from the wrong div index - it's accessing the first div (203 characters) instead of the larger accordion section that contains the complete flavor data. The output shows only 1 flavor extracted (Aloha Macadamia 2001-2002) when there should be dozens of flavors from the 1980s-1990s era. **PLAN** alignment: 30% - we have the parsing logic and headstone matching working, but we're not accessing the full flavor dataset. The comprehensive analysis shows there are 40 flavor divs and the accordion section should contain all the discontinued flavors. Recommended fix: Access the correct div index that contains the full 7,640-character accordion content with all flavor names and dates, then the existing parsing logic should extract the complete list of flavors and correctly identify the true oldest flavor from the graveyard.",
"code_output": "Code Output: \n\n=== EXTRACTING ALL FLAVORS FROM ACCORDION HTML CONTENT ===\n\nObjective: Parse the full accordion HTML structure to extract all flavor names and dates\nStrategy: Use the comprehensive analysis data but access the full HTML content directly\n\n=== STEP 1: INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS STRUCTURE ===\n\nAnalysis file size: 221,410 characters\n\nAnalysis file structure:\n analysis_date: 2025-08-11T07:43:50.546110\n source_file: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html\n page_title: Flavor Graveyard | Ben & Jerry‚Äôs\n content_stats: Dictionary with 5 keys\n containers_found: 9\n flavor_divs_found: 40\n total_images: 84\n relevant_images: 43\n flavors_with_dates: 2\n top_flavor_divs: List with 10 items\n top_headstone_images: List with 10 items\n oldest_flavors_candidates: List with 2 items\n\nExamining top_flavor_divs:\n\nDiv 1:\n Classes: container-fluid\n Text length: 8,113 characters\n Text preview: Flavor GraveyardEven the best Ben & Jerry‚Äôs flavors eventually melt away. Here we lay our dearly de-pinted to rest so we can mourn their chunks and swirls and keep their sweet memories alive.Flavor Gr...\n\nDiv 2:\n Classes: row grid-row\n Text length: 7,640 characters\n Text preview: Aloha Macadamia2001-2002Rich milk chocolate cashew Brazil-nut butter ice cream with macadamia nuts covered in white & dark fudge & milk chocolatey swirl.We won't blame the macadamiaBut we were kinda i...\n\nDiv 3:\n Classes: col-md-6\n Text length: 7,640 characters\n Text preview: Aloha Macadamia2001-2002Rich milk chocolate cashew Brazil-nut butter ice cream with macadamia nuts covered in white & dark fudge & milk chocolatey swirl.We won't blame the macadamiaBut we were kinda i...\n\nDiv 4:\n Classes: accordion\n Text length: 7,640 characters\n Text preview: Aloha Macadamia2001-2002Rich milk chocolate cashew Brazil-nut butter ice cream with macadamia nuts covered in white & dark fudge & milk chocolatey swirl.We won't blame the macadamiaBut we were kinda i...\n\nDiv 5:\n Classes: container-fluid\n Text length: 1,294 characters\n Text preview: Skip to main contentSkip to footerIce Cream FlavorsOur FlavorsIce Cream PintsNon-Dairy PintsCertified Gluten-Free FlavorsCookie Dough ChunksCores Ice Cream PintsDoggie DessertsMini CupsScoop-apaloozaS...\n\n=== COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION FINISHED ===",

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport re\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== ACCESSING THE CORRECT ACCORDION CONTENT FOR COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Access the correct div with accordion class to extract all flavors")\nprint("Strategy: Target the div with \'accordion\' class that contains the full flavor data\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# First, safely inspect the comprehensive analysis file structure\nanalysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_comprehensive_analysis.json\')\nif os.path.exists(analysis_file):\n print("=== STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE ===\\n")\n \n with open(analysis_file, \'r\') as f:\n analysis_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"Analysis file size: {len(analysis_content):,} characters")\n \n try:\n analysis_data = json.loads(analysis_content)\n \n # Safely check structure\n print("\\nAnalysis file keys:")\n for key in analysis_data.keys():\n print(f" {key}")\n \n # Safely examine top_flavor_divs\n if \'top_flavor_divs\' in analysis_data and isinstance(analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\'], list):\n print(f"\\nFound {len(analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\'])} flavor divs")\n \n # Look for the div with accordion class (should be div 4 based on previous output)\n accordion_div = None\n accordion_div_index = None\n \n for i, div in enumerate(analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\']):\n if isinstance(div, dict) and \'classes\' in div:\n print(f"\\nDiv {i+1}:")\n print(f" Classes: {div[\'classes\']}")\n if \'text_length\' in div:\n print(f" Text length: {div[\'text_length\']:,} characters")\n \n # Check if this is the accordion div\n if \'accordion\' in div[\'classes\']:\n print(f" *** FOUND ACCORDION DIV ***")\n accordion_div = div\n accordion_div_index = i\n break\n \n if accordion_div and \'text\' in accordion_div:\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 2: PARSING ACCORDION CONTENT FOR ALL FLAVORS ===\\n")\n \n accordion_text = accordion_div[\'text\']\n print(f"Accordion text length: {len(accordion_text):,} characters")\n print(f"Text preview: {accordion_text[:300]}...")\n \n # Parse the accordion HTML content\n soup = BeautifulSoup(accordion_text, \'html.parser\')\n \n # Look for accordion items\n accordion_items = soup.find_all(\'li\', class_=\'accordion-item\')\n print(f"\\nFound {len(accordion_items)} accordion items")\n \n if len(accordion_items) == 0:\n # If no li elements found, try different approach\n print("No li accordion-item elements found. Trying alternative parsing...")\n \n # Look for any elements with accordion-related classes\n all_accordion_elements = soup.find_all(attrs={\'class\': re.compile(\'accordion\')})\n print(f"Found {len(all_accordion_elements)} elements with accordion classes")\n \n # Try to extract flavor data from text patterns\n # Look for flavor name + date pattern\n flavor_pattern = r\'([A-Za-z\\s&\\\'!]+?)(\\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\\d{4})\'\n \n matches = re.findall(flavor_pattern, accordion_text)\n print(f"Found {len(matches)} flavor name + date patterns")\n \n extracted_flavors = []\n \n for match in matches:\n flavor_name = match[0].strip()\n start_year = int(match[1])\n end_year = int(match[2])\n \n # Clean up flavor name\n flavor_name = re.sub(r\'^(Skip to|Search|Flavor Graveyard)\', \'\', flavor_name).strip()\n \n # Filter out invalid names\n if len(flavor_name) > 3 and len(flavor_name) < 50 and not any(skip in flavor_name.lower() for skip in [\'skip\', \'search\', \'suggestions\', \'ice cream flavors\']):\n flavor_info = {\n \'name\': flavor_name,\n \'start_year\': start_year,\n \'end_year\': end_year,\n \'date_range\': f\'{start_year}-{end_year}\',\n \'earliest_year\': start_year\n }\n \n extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info)\n print(f" Extracted: {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})")\n \n else:\n # Process accordion items normally\n extracted_flavors = []\n \n for item_idx, item in enumerate(accordion_items, 1):\n # Extract flavor name from button\n button = item.find(\'button\', class_=\'accordion-button\')\n flavor_name = button.get_text(strip=True) if button else f"Unknown Flavor {item_idx}"\n \n # Extract content from accordion body\n accordion_body = item.find(\'div\', class_=\'accordion-body\')\n \n if accordion_body:\n body_text = accordion_body.get_text(strip=True)\n \n # Look for date ranges\n date_patterns = [\n r\'(\\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\\d{4})\', # 1979-1991\n r\'(\\d{4})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(\\d{4})\', # 1979 - 1991\n ]\n \n dates_found = []\n for pattern in date_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, body_text)\n dates_found.extend(matches)\n \n if dates_found:\n start_year, end_year = dates_found[0]\n start_year, end_year = int(start_year), int(end_year)\n \n # Extract rhyme lines from em tags\n rhyme_elements = accordion_body.find_all(\'em\')\n rhyme_lines = []\n for em in rhyme_elements:\n rhyme_text = em.get_text(strip=True)\n if rhyme_text:\n lines = [line.strip() for line in rhyme_text.split(\'\\n\') if line.strip()]\n rhyme_lines.extend(lines)\n \n flavor_info = {\n \'name\': flavor_name,\n \'start_year\': start_year,\n \'end_year\': end_year,\n \'date_range\': f\'{start_year}-{end_year}\',\n \'earliest_year\': start_year,\n \'rhyme_lines\': rhyme_lines\n }\n \n extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info)\n print(f" {item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})")\n if rhyme_lines:\n print(f" Last rhyme line: {rhyme_lines[-1]}")\n \n # Sort by earliest year to find the oldest\n if extracted_flavors:\n extracted_flavors.sort(key=lambda x: x[\'earliest_year\'])\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 3: COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION RESULTS ===\\n")\n print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}")\n \n print(f"\\nAll flavors sorted by earliest year:")\n for i, flavor in enumerate(extracted_flavors, 1):\n print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[\'name\']} ({flavor[\'date_range\']}) - Started: {flavor[\'earliest_year\']}")\n if flavor.get(\'rhyme_lines\'):\n print(f" Last rhyme line: {flavor[\'rhyme_lines\'][-1]}")\n \n # Identify the true oldest flavor\n oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0]\n print(f"\\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IN BEN & JERRY\'S GRAVEYARD:")\n print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']}")\n print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[\'date_range\']}")\n print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[\'earliest_year\']}")\n if oldest_flavor.get(\'rhyme_lines\'):\n print(f" Total rhyme lines: {len(oldest_flavor[\'rhyme_lines\'])}")\n print(f" Last rhyme line: {oldest_flavor[\'rhyme_lines\'][-1]}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\\n")\n \n # Find matching headstone image\n if \'top_headstone_images\' in analysis_data and isinstance(analysis_data[\'top_headstone_images\'], list):\n headstone_images = analysis_data[\'top_headstone_images\']\n print(f"Available headstone images: {len(headstone_images)}")\n \n # Match the oldest flavor with its headstone\n oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[\'name\'].lower()\n matching_images = []\n \n for img in headstone_images:\n if isinstance(img, dict):\n img_alt = img.get(\'alt\', \'\').lower()\n img_src = img.get(\'src\', \'\').lower()\n \n # Check for word matches\n flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split()\n matches = 0\n \n for word in flavor_words:\n if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words\n if word in img_alt or word in img_src:\n matches += 1\n \n if matches > 0:\n img_copy = img.copy()\n img_copy[\'match_score\'] = matches\n matching_images.append(img_copy)\n \n if matching_images:\n # Sort by match score\n matching_images.sort(key=lambda x: x.get(\'match_score\', 0), reverse=True)\n \n best_match = matching_images[0]\n print(f"\\n‚úì OLDEST FLAVOR HEADSTONE IMAGE FOUND:")\n print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(\'alt\', \'No alt text\')}")\n print(f" URL: {best_match.get(\'src\', \'No URL\')}")\n print(f" Match score: {best_match.get(\'match_score\', 0)}")\n \n # Save comprehensive results\n final_results = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'extraction_method\': \'correct_accordion_div_parsing\',\n \'total_flavors_extracted\': len(extracted_flavors),\n \'oldest_flavor\': oldest_flavor,\n \'oldest_flavor_headstone_image\': best_match,\n \'all_flavors_sorted_by_age\': extracted_flavors,\n \'plan_status\': {\n \'oldest_flavor_identified\': True,\n \'headstone_image_located\': True,\n \'next_step\': \'Download and analyze headstone image for background details\'\n }\n }\n \n results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_final_oldest_flavor_results.json\')\n with open(results_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n‚úì Final results saved to: {results_file}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== PLAN PHASE 1 COMPLETE: OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED ===\\n")\n print(f"üéØ OLDEST BEN & JERRY\'S FLAVOR: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']} ({oldest_flavor[\'date_range\']})")\n print(f"üì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE: {best_match.get(\'src\', \'No URL\')}")\n print(f"\\nüìã NEXT STEPS FOR PLAN COMPLETION:")\n print(f" 1. Download the oldest flavor\'s headstone image")\n print(f" 2. Analyze the photo to locate background headstones")\n print(f" 3. Extract flavor name and rhyme from background headstone")\n print(f" 4. Identify the last line of the background headstone\'s rhyme")\n \n else:\n print(f"No matching headstone images found for \'{oldest_flavor[\'name\']}\'")\n \n else:\n print(f"No headstone images available in analysis data")\n \n else:\n print(f"No flavors extracted from accordion content")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nNo accordion div found or no text content available")\n print(f"Available divs:")\n for i, div in enumerate(analysis_data[\'top_flavor_divs\'][:5]):\n if isinstance(div, dict) and \'classes\' in div:\n print(f" Div {i+1}: {div[\'classes\']} ({div.get(\'text_length\', 0):,} chars)")\n \n else:\n print(f"No top_flavor_divs found in analysis data")\n \n except json.JSONDecodeError as e:\n print(f"Error parsing analysis JSON: {e}")\n except Exception as e:\n print(f"Error processing analysis data: {e}")\n import traceback\n traceback.print_exc()\n\nelse:\n print(f"Comprehensive analysis file not found: {analysis_file}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION PROCESS FINISHED ===\\n")',
"description": "Final implementation to correctly access the accordion div (div 4 with 'accordion' class) that contains the complete flavor data from Ben & Jerry's graveyard. This approach: (1) Safely inspects the comprehensive analysis file structure and identifies available keys before accessing any data, (2) Systematically examines all flavor divs to locate the one with 'accordion' class that contains the full 7,640-character content, (3) Uses BeautifulSoup to parse the accordion HTML structure and extract all li elements with accordion-item class, (4) Extracts flavor names from button elements and date ranges from accordion body content, (5) Captures rhyme lines from em/italic tags within each flavor's description, (6) Sorts all extracted flavors by earliest year to correctly identify the true oldest flavor from the 1980s era, (7) Matches the oldest flavor with its corresponding headstone image using word matching in alt text and URLs, (8) Saves comprehensive results to workspace/ben_jerrys_final_oldest_flavor_results.json. This method should successfully extract all discontinued flavors and identify the genuinely oldest one (likely Dastardly Mash from 1979-1991) with its headstone image, completing the first phase of the PLAN and enabling us to proceed with downloading and analyzing the headstone photo for background details.",

"code_output": "Code Output: \n\n=== ACCESSING THE CORRECT ACCORDION CONTENT FOR COMPLETE FLAVOR EXTRACTION ===\n\nObjective: Access the correct div with accordion class to extract all flavors\nStrategy: Target the div with 'accordion' class that contains the full flavor data\n\n=== STEP 1: SAFELY INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS FILE ===\n\nAnalysis file size: 221,410 characters\n\nAnalysis file keys:\n analysis_date\n source_file\n page_title\n content_stats\n containers_found\n flavor_divs_found\n total_images\n relevant_images\n flavors_with_dates\n top_flavor_divs\n top_headstone_images\n oldest_flavors_candidates\n\nFound 10 flavor divs\n\nDiv 1:\n Classes: container-fluid\n Text length: 8,113 characters\n\nDiv 2:\n Classes: row grid-row\n Text length: 7,640 characters\n\nDiv 3:\n Classes: col-md-6\n Text length: 7,640 characters\n\nDiv 4:\n Classes: accordion\n Text length: 7,640 characters\n *** FOUND ACCORDION DIV ***\n\n=== STEP 2: PARSING ACCORDION CONTENT FOR ALL FLAVORS ===\n\nAccordion text length: 203 characters\nText preview: Aloha Macadamia2001-2002Rich milk chocolate cashew Brazil-nut butter ice cream with macadamia nuts covered in white & dark fudge & milk chocolatey swirl.We won't blame the macadamiaBut we were kinda i......\n\nFound 0 accordion items\nNo li accordion-item elements found. Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002) - Started: 2001\n\nüéØ OLDEST FLAVOR IN BEN & JERRY'S GRAVEYARD:\n Name: Aloha Macadamia\n Date Range: 2001-2002\n Started: 2001\n\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n\nAvailable headstone images: 10\n\n‚úì OLDEST FLAVOR HEADSTONE IMAGE FOUND:\n Flavor: Aloha Macadamia\n Alt text: Aloha Macadamia tombstone\n URL: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0039_graveyard_aloha_macadamia.jpg\n Match score: 2\n\n‚úì Final results saved to: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_final_oldest_flavor_results.json\n\n=== PLAN PHASE 1 COMPLETE: OLDEST FLAVOR IDENTIFIED ===\n\nüéØ OLDEST BEN & JERRY'S FLAVOR: Aloha Macadamia (2001-2002)\nüì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0039_graveyard_aloha_macadamia.jpg\n\nüìã NEXT STEPS FOR PLAN COMPLETION:\n 1. {
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport re\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== DIRECT HTML PARSING TO EXTRACT ALL GRAVEYARD FLAVORS ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Parse the original HTML file directly to extract all flavor names and dates")\nprint("Strategy: Access ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html and parse accordion structure directly\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# Access the original HTML file directly\nhtml_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html\')\nif os.path.exists(html_file):\n print("=== STEP 1: READING ORIGINAL HTML FILE ===\\n")\n \n with open(html_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n html_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters")\n \n # Parse the HTML with BeautifulSoup\n print("\\nParsing HTML content with BeautifulSoup...")\n soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, \'html.parser\')\n \n # Look for the main accordion container\n accordion_container = soup.find(\'div\', class_=\'accordion\')\n \n if accordion_container:\n print(f"‚úì Found main accordion container")\n print(f"Accordion container ID: {accordion_container.get(\'id\', \'No ID\')}")\n \n # Find all accordion items (li elements with accordion-item class)\n accordion_items = accordion_container.find_all(\'li\', class_=\'accordion-item\')\n print(f"‚úì Found {len(accordion_items)} accordion items")\n \n if len(accordion_items) > 0:\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 2: EXTRACTING ALL FLAVORS FROM ACCORDION ITEMS ===\\n")\n \n extracted_flavors = []\n \n for item_idx, item in enumerate(accordion_items, 1):\n try:\n # Extract flavor name from the accordion button\n button = item.find(\'button\', class_=\'accordion-button\')\n flavor_name = button.get_text(strip=True) if button else f"Unknown Flavor {item_idx}"\n \n # Extract content from the accordion body\n accordion_body = item.find(\'div\', class_=\'accordion-body\')\n \n if accordion_body:\n # Get all text content from the body\n body_text = accordion_body.get_text(strip=True)\n \n # Look for date ranges using multiple patterns\n date_patterns = [\n r\'(\\d{4})[-‚Äì‚Äî](\\d{4})\', # 1979-1991\n r\'(\\d{4})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(\\d{4})\', # 1979 - 1991\n r\'\\b(\\d{4})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(\\d{4})\\b\', # Word boundaries\n ]\n \n dates_found = []\n for pattern in date_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, body_text)\n if matches:\n dates_found.extend(matches)\n break # Use first successful pattern\n \n if dates_found:\n # Use the first date range found\n start_year_str, end_year_str = dates_found[0]\n start_year = int(start_year_str)\n end_year = int(end_year_str)\n \n # Extract rhyme lines from <em> tags\n rhyme_elements = accordion_body.find_all(\'em\')\n rhyme_lines = []\n \n for em in rhyme_elements:\n rhyme_text = em.get_text(strip=True)\n if rhyme_text:\n # Split by line breaks and clean up\n lines = [line.strip() for line in rhyme_text.replace(\'\\n\', \'|\').split(\'|\') if line.strip()]\n rhyme_lines.extend(lines)\n \n # Extract description (the paragraph between date and rhyme)\n content_paragraphs = accordion_body.find_all(\'p\')\n description = ""\n for p in content_paragraphs:\n p_text = p.get_text(strip=True)\n # Skip the date paragraph and rhyme paragraphs\n if not re.search(r\'\\d{4}[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\d{4}\', p_text) and not p.find(\'em\'):\n description = p_text\n break\n \n flavor_info = {\n \'name\': flavor_name,\n \'start_year\': start_year,\n \'end_year\': end_year,\n \'date_range\': f\'{start_year}-{end_year}\',\n \'earliest_year\': start_year,\n \'description\': description,\n \'rhyme_lines\': rhyme_lines,\n \'last_rhyme_line\': rhyme_lines[-1] if rhyme_lines else None\n }\n \n extracted_flavors.append(flavor_info)\n \n print(f"{item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} ({start_year}-{end_year})")\n if rhyme_lines:\n print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(rhyme_lines)}")\n print(f" Last line: {rhyme_lines[-1]}")\n print(f" Description: {description[:100]}{\'...\' if len(description) > 100 else \'\'}")\n \n else:\n print(f"{item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No date range found")\n print(f" Body text preview: {body_text[:100]}...")\n \n else:\n print(f"{item_idx:2d}. {flavor_name} - No accordion body found")\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f"{item_idx:2d}. Error processing item: {e}")\n continue\n \n # Sort by earliest year to find the true oldest flavor\n if extracted_flavors:\n extracted_flavors.sort(key=lambda x: x[\'earliest_year\'])\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 3: ALL FLAVORS SORTED BY AGE ===\\n")\n print(f"Total flavors extracted: {len(extracted_flavors)}")\n \n print(f"\\nComplete list of flavors sorted by earliest year:")\n for i, flavor in enumerate(extracted_flavors, 1):\n print(f"{i:2d}. {flavor[\'name\']} ({flavor[\'date_range\']}) - Started: {flavor[\'earliest_year\']}")\n if flavor.get(\'last_rhyme_line\'):\n print(f" Last rhyme line: {flavor[\'last_rhyme_line\']}")\n \n # Identify the true oldest flavor\n oldest_flavor = extracted_flavors[0]\n print(f"\\nüéØ TRUE OLDEST BEN & JERRY\'S FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:")\n print(f" Name: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']}")\n print(f" Date Range: {oldest_flavor[\'date_range\']}")\n print(f" Started: {oldest_flavor[\'earliest_year\']}")\n print(f" Description: {oldest_flavor.get(\'description\', \'No description\')}")\n if oldest_flavor.get(\'rhyme_lines\'):\n print(f" Rhyme lines: {len(oldest_flavor[\'rhyme_lines\'])}")\n for i, line in enumerate(oldest_flavor[\'rhyme_lines\'], 1):\n print(f" {i}. {line}")\n print(f" *** LAST RHYME LINE: {oldest_flavor[\'last_rhyme_line\']} ***")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\\n")\n \n # Look for headstone images in the HTML\n all_images = soup.find_all(\'img\')\n headstone_images = []\n \n for img in all_images:\n img_src = img.get(\'src\', \'\') or img.get(\'data-src\', \'\')\n img_alt = img.get(\'alt\', \'\')\n \n if img_src and (\'graveyard\' in img_src.lower() or \'tombstone\' in img_alt.lower()):\n # Convert relative URLs to absolute\n if img_src.startswith(\'//\'):\n img_src = \'https:\' + img_src\n elif img_src.startswith(\'/\'):\n img_src = \'https://www.benjerry.com\' + img_src\n elif not img_src.startswith(\'http\'):\n img_src = \'https://www.benjerry.com/\' + img_src\n \n headstone_images.append({\n \'src\': img_src,\n \'alt\': img_alt,\n \'context\': \'graveyard_headstone\'\n })\n \n print(f"Found {len(headstone_images)} headstone images")\n \n # Match the oldest flavor with its headstone image\n oldest_flavor_name = oldest_flavor[\'name\'].lower()\n matching_images = []\n \n for img in headstone_images:\n img_alt = img.get(\'alt\', \'\').lower()\n img_src = img.get(\'src\', \'\').lower()\n \n # Check for word matches\n flavor_words = oldest_flavor_name.split()\n matches = 0\n \n for word in flavor_words:\n if len(word) > 3: # Skip short words\n if word in img_alt or word in img_src:\n matches += 1\n \n if matches > 0:\n img_copy = img.copy()\n img_copy[\'match_score\'] = matches\n matching_images.append(img_copy)\n \n if matching_images:\n # Sort by match score\n matching_images.sort(key=lambda x: x.get(\'match_score\', 0), reverse=True)\n \n best_match = matching_images[0]\n print(f"\\n‚úì OLDEST FLAVOR HEADSTONE IMAGE LOCATED:")\n print(f" Flavor: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: {best_match.get(\'alt\', \'No alt text\')}")\n print(f" URL: {best_match.get(\'src\', \'No URL\')}")\n print(f" Match score: {best_match.get(\'match_score\', 0)}")\n \n # Save comprehensive final results\n final_results = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'extraction_method\': \'direct_html_accordion_parsing\',\n \'total_flavors_extracted\': len(extracted_flavors),\n \'oldest_flavor\': oldest_flavor,\n \'oldest_flavor_headstone_image\': best_match,\n \'all_flavors_complete_list\': extracted_flavors,\n \'plan_progress\': {\n \'phase_1_complete\': True,\n \'oldest_flavor_identified\': oldest_flavor[\'name\'],\n \'oldest_flavor_years\': oldest_flavor[\'date_range\'],\n \'headstone_image_url\': best_match.get(\'src\', \'No URL\'),\n \'next_phase\': \'Download headstone image and analyze background\'\n }\n }\n \n results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ben_jerrys_complete_graveyard_analysis.json\')\n with open(results_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n‚úì Complete analysis saved to: {results_file}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== PLAN PHASE 1 SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED ===\\n")\n print(f"üéØ OLDEST BEN & JERRY\'S FLAVOR: {oldest_flavor[\'name\']} ({oldest_flavor[\'date_range\']})")\n print(f"üì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE URL: {best_match.get(\'src\', \'No URL\')}")\n if oldest_flavor.get(\'last_rhyme_line\'):\n print(f"üìù OLDEST FLAVOR\'S LAST RHYME LINE: {oldest_flavor[\'last_rhyme_line\']}")\n \n print(f"\\nüìã READY FOR PLAN PHASE 2:")\n print(f" 1. Download the oldest flavor\'s headstone image")\n print(f" 2. Examine the photo for background headstones")\n print(f" 3. Extract flavor name and rhyme from background headstone")\n print(f" 4. Identify the last line of the background headstone\'s rhyme")\n \n else:\n print(f"No matching headstone images found for \'{oldest_flavor[\'name\']}\'")\n print(f"Available headstone images:")\n for i, img in enumerate(headstone_images[:5], 1):\n print(f" {i}. {img.get(\'alt\', \'No alt text\')} - {img.get(\'src\', \'No URL\')}")\n \n else:\n print(f"No flavors were successfully extracted")\n \n else:\n print(f"No accordion items found in the accordion container")\n \n else:\n print(f"No accordion container found in the HTML")\n print(f"Searching for alternative structures...")\n \n # Look for any elements with accordion-related classes\n accordion_elements = soup.find_all(attrs={\'class\': re.compile(\'accordion\', re.I)})\n print(f"Found {len(accordion_elements)} elements with accordion-related classes")\n \n for i, elem in enumerate(accordion_elements[:5], 1):\n print(f" {i}. Tag: {elem.name}, Classes: {elem.get(\'class\', [])}")\n\nelse:\n print(f"HTML file not found: {html_file}")\n print(f"Available files in workspace:")\n if os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n for file in os.listdir(workspace_dir):\n print(f" - {file}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== DIRECT HTML PARSING COMPLETE ===\\n")',
"description": "Comprehensive implementation to directly parse the original Ben & Jerry's graveyard HTML file and extract all flavor data from the accordion structure. This approach: (1) Reads the original ben_jerrys_graveyard_page.html file directly to access the complete content without any truncation issues, (2) Uses BeautifulSoup to locate the main accordion container and all li elements with accordion-item class, (3) Extracts flavor names from button elements and date ranges from accordion body content using multiple regex patterns, (4) Captures complete rhyme lines from em/italic tags and identifies the last line of each rhyme, (5) Extracts flavor descriptions from paragraph elements, (6) Sorts all extracted flavors by earliest year to correctly identify the true oldest flavor from the 1980s era, (7) Locates all headstone images and matches the oldest flavor with its corresponding image, (8) Saves comprehensive results to workspace/ben_jerrys_complete_graveyard_analysis.json. This method bypasses any data truncation issues and should successfully extract all discontinued flavors, identify the genuinely oldest one (likely from 1979-1991), and provide its headstone image URL for the next phase of background analysis as required by the PLAN.",

Cow Power (2012-2012) - Started: 2012\n Last rhyme line: Cow welfare we felt,Deserved it's own flavour.Just a limited batch though,So a taste memory to savour.\n\nüéØ TRUE OLDEST BEN & JERRY'S FLAVOR IDENTIFIED:\n Name: Dastardly Mash\n Date Range: 1979-1991\n Started: 1979\n Description: Chocolate Ice Cream with Pecans, Almonds, Raisins, & Chocolate Chips\n Rhyme lines: 1\n 1. Here the brazenDASTARDLY lies.Some say that raisin,Caused its demise.\n *** LAST RHYME LINE: Here the brazenDASTARDLY lies.Some say that raisin,Caused its demise. ***\n\n=== STEP 4: FINDING HEADSTONE IMAGE FOR OLDEST FLAVOR ===\n\nFound 40 headstone images\n\n‚úì OLDEST FLAVOR HEADSTONE IMAGE LOCATED:\n Flavor: Dastardly Mash\n Alt text: Dastardly Mash tombstone\n URL: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0015_graveyard_dastardly_mash.jpg\n Match score: 2\n\n‚úì Complete analysis saved to: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/ben_jerrys_complete_graveyard_analysis.json\n\n=== PLAN PHASE 1 SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED ===\n\nüéØ OLDEST BEN & JERRY'S FLAVOR: Dastardly Mash (1979-1991)\nüì∏ HEADSTONE IMAGE URL: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0015_graveyard_dastardly_mash.jpg\nüìù OLDEST FLAVOR'S LAST RHYME LINE: Here the brazenDASTARDLY lies.Some say that raisin,Caused its demise.\n\nüìã READY FOR PLAN PHASE 2:\n 1. Identify the last line of the background headstone's rhyme\n\n=== DIRECT HTML PARSING COMPLETE ===",
